description:
I've lived in SF for over 20 years and this was the first time I stopped in to Victor's.  I had driven past it for many years and always wondered about it.  
My friend and I were headed to Erasure concert at the Masonic and met up at Victor's for dinner and drinks.  I'm so glad she chose this spot.
It smells so good as you walk in the door.  
The restaurant is charmingly old school: the decor, the plates, utensils and glassware. Reminds me of an old place like Caesar's.
The portions are GENEROUS. I am a pretty cheap gal, and I approve of their pricing.  We had chicken parmigiana $19 which comes with soup or salad, bread & butter, small plate of pasta bolognese, huge hunk of chicken parmigiana and vegetables. It was delicious!
We also ordered Victor's speciality pizza. DELICIOUS! The right amount of crust, left in the oven the right amount of time. The toppings were generous and yummy.
We also had glasses of merlot. Nice generous pour-- like how you'd pour yourself a glass of wine at home.
Our waitress was friendly and chatty.. not too much, and gave us the right amount of attention.  You could spend hours there and not feel rushed. 
My friend treated me to this place, and I'm grateful she brought me there.
Go check this place out. I'll see you there.
author: Lita T.

description:
This is probably the worst pizza I have ever tried in my entire life: lots of cheese on it and vegetables were uncooked, not to mention the large amount of raw onion.

My advice is that they sauté all vegetables in advance with herbs and then put them on the pizza.

Crust should be rubbed with a mix of garlic, oil, parsley, and Italian seasoning topped with parmesan grated cheese. In addition a light coat of pizza sauce, light amount of mozzarella cheese, and pre sauté vegetables would make them delicious.

I would encourage employees to be grateful for customers since they are them that make it possible for us to make our living.
author: Oswaldo M.

description:
tl;dr: I wouldn't be opposed to returning here, but this is definitely not the "best pizza in town", nor is this place the "best drunk pizza in town" (which is probably DNA Pizza).

I came here after a night-out drinking (when I was in a good place but not "drunk"). Decided to come here because I saw the 4-star rating on Yelp and lots of super-positive reviews, and I was craving some good pizza. 

They allow you to buy pizza by the slice, but you need to take it to-go and they won't let you sit inside if you only buy by-the-slice. This didn't make much sense to me since the restaurant was pretty empty when I came.

I ordered a slice of cheese and it was a perfectly decent slice of cheese pizza. Service is fast and price for a slice is $4.50, which seems reasonable given the neighborhood.
author: Karanveer M.

description: The staff here must be saints, dealing with the Polk Street crowd on the weekends. Victor's has been around since 1954 and they are the only place you can get a decent pie or slice in the neighborhood. I highly recommend their calzones. Probably better to take-out than eat-in.
author: A E.

description: I love their chicken wings here and their pizza are delicious.  I try to eat here when I have a pizza craving or meeting friends for lunch.
author: Teens F.

description: Gentleman at the counter with the glasses and balding Head is extremely rude. That is all
author: Isabella D.

description:
Walking down Polk street my friends and I were bar hopping acting like goons, when we stumbled upon the what I thought was heavens light. Turns out it was actually the glowing Victors Pizza sign. Close enough! You know we had to stop by and get a slice.

I ordered the pepperoni and it hit the spot. Wasn't amazing, wasn't life changing, but oh man did it hit the spot! I'd definitely recommend coming here to refuel while bar hopping down Polk St, you can't really go wrong.
author: Joshua H.

description: Went to Victor's for a night out in SF. Great Italian restaurant! Everything from the start( Fresh warm baked bread) to our main course (Victor's speciality Pizza, Linguine with pesto) were tasted freshly and fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant for a great food and reasonable price!
author: Nikki Y.

description: Highly recommend this place. Was very quaint and very delicious. The minestrone was so great tasted like home cooking. Awwww... the fresh warm baked bread was fantastic!!!! Will come again
author: Hidemy B.

description:
I have dined at Victor's Pizza & Restaurant a few times. But I never had their tasty pizza delivered to my crib. Recently I finally used the Eat24 website to have the pizza and dinner delivered to me at my Russian Hill place on a rainy Wednesday night. 

I have had many of their signature and customized pizzas. But my latest meal, I had the famous "Zorba" Special pizza. For $17.00, the small 12-inch pizza comprised of Cheese, salami, pepperoni, black olives, tomato, feta cheese, and onions. This is the restaurant's famous pizza and clearly one of my favorites. 

My pizza was delivered in about 25 minutes. And my pizza was still temperature-hot. On Eat24, there is a $15.00 minimum order with an additional $3.00 delivery fee when you order here. 

This is my first time using the Eat24 website, and having my dinner delivered to my crib. The two did a tremendous job in making my Wednesday night a less hassle.
author: Matt G.

description: Highest quality pizza you will find in San Francisco. They take pride in their business.
author: Richard T.

description:
Was at the crib in north beach watching Game 3 of the 2018 NBA Finals: Warriors vs Cavs. Warriors mopped up and my boys and I were hungry as champions. Capos quit taking orders at 9pm. Nizario's and North Beach pizza were busy or wouldn't answer their phone. Dominos and Pizza Hut wouldn't deliver to North Beach. Ive eaten at golden boy so many times that square pizza gives me the hives. Haven already given up, my friend searched deep in the dark web (Grubhub) and found Victors.
Nestle somewhere near polk gulch, this place has the speed of a Tesla model x. We ordered an extra large combination which came to $33. 20 mins later the doorbell rang and hot pizza had found me. The pizza itself wasn't bad. The toppings were ample yet the crust was a little soggy. The pizza was probably 3 1/2 stars but the delivery speed was breathtaking. Polk to NB in twenty mins is as quick as an Uber. Next time surge prices are through the roof, I'm calling Victor
author: Johny B.

description:
I discovered Victor's Pizzeria in between all the bars and cafes in the area. They seem to have cornered the market here on late night snacks, and that is exactly why I ventured inside. They allow you to buy your pizza by the slice which could not be better suited for this audience. The restaurant seems to be take out only, there was no place to sit and eat.

Was their pizza amazing? It was okay, what made it great was the ability to balance your alcohol-food level after visiting other places around. It also prevents you from going hangry later at night. 

What pizza do they have? They keep it to the basics: cheese, pepperoni, mushrooms and mushroom/pepperoni. 

Service could not have been more to the point: you order, you pay, you get your food immediately. This spot was made to serve you fast and easy.
author: Ellen H.

description: Delicious thin crisp crust pizza, sauce tastes fresh and the toppings were plentiful. Our server Mark was friendly and helpful to us tourists  and the food came fast.
author: Debra D.

description: Perfect food and service. The dough is bomb, the sauce, cheese and meat everything has so much flavor. Nice little spot in San Francisco. Would definitely recommend.
author: Mariela T.

description: It's hard to find good pizza in SF but you will not regret grabbing a slice (or even better - a whole pie) from Victor's. They've never delivered in more time than they estimate and their crust is always perfectly cooked
author: Kelly H.

description: Wow! I stopped at this place randomly because it was close to my hotel and ended up having the best calzone I have ever had in my life and amazing service! If you are in San Fran and want the best Italian at an amazing price, you must go here!
author: Ashley G.

description: Well we didn't order until 8:00 pm on a Tuesday evening and the wait time was 60 to 90 mins...received in 45 mins...Small Pizza  was just enough for two of us...along with the eight chicken wings...terrific on all points, received everything very warm...we do recommend this restaurant
author: Judy K.

description: Since finding this gem I don't ever drive through San Francisco with out stopping and getting an eggplant parm hero and a pizza for the fam when I get home. Being a New Yorker it's super authentic.
author: Rick E.

description:
Grubhub order and asked to have the pizza extra crispy. Arrived hot but wasnt crispy, and forget the extra crispy part. Ceaser salad had pretty runny dressing and in about 20min it was all soggy.
Decent for a late night after bar pizza.
author: Natalya V.

description: Amazing pizza  very Authentic. You know it's good pizza when you can taste all the flavors on the pizza. And you know it's good when the cheese is melted and stringy when your eating it. Just talking about it makes my mouth water. Very good customer service as well.
author: Daniela R.

description: Really tasty, NY style pizza. This was a Yelp find, and I'm really glad I found it! Would order from Victor's again.
author: Brett F.

description:
Nothing too special about the pizza place, it's on the expensive side and we randomly found the joint while waiting for house of prime rib. 

We got seated for a party of 6 and fortunately we were on the well lit clean side of the restaurant. We asked for water and found that the water tasted really funky. No matter, we figure it was just weird tap water and ordered the pizza. We got the victors special large to split for 6 (which actually worked out for our entire party) and they cut the pizza into 10 slices. The victors special came loaded with sausage, salami, olives, green bell pepper, onion, and pepperoni. The flavor of the pizza was good but the crust was definitely burnt. It was not "Neapolitan" style where some of the burnt pieces actually compliment the crust. The crust was hard and cardboard-like, but luckily the ingredients on top helped make it palatable.

The main reason for the low rating is the sketchiness of the management. I inquired about the 10% off deal from the Yelp check in and an older gentlemen behind the counter (which I assume to be a manager or possible owner? after seeing how he talked with the other associates) said sorry, the check in deal is only for to-go orders. I go back to my table and re-read the check in deal offer and found that it was in fine print...."10% off ONLY FOR DINE-IN Orders". Confused, I go back to the same person and showed him the check in deal. He reads it out loud and then tells me again "Sorry, it should be only for to-go orders"

So beware of using your Yelp check in deal, but otherwise the associates were friendly, restaurant was clean, and the pizza was OK.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Best pizza in town. The best hole in the wall you may find 
Great people as well
Michel p
La habra

Coming in a few weeks back to the bay can't wait to come by and eat amazing food
author: Michel P.

description: Best pizza in all of San Francisco by 1000 miles. Decent prices too. Go here. You'll thank me later.
author: JP F.

description: Pretty avg pizza for on the go. Had a slice of cheese which was warmed promptly and a ranch for $5.50 total
author: Atif J.

description:
i guess the one good thing about this place is that they stay open quite late, enough for drunkies to make a pit stop out of desperation for food. 

two friends raved about this place, so we decided to give it a try after a night out.  not surprisingly, it wasnt that great(they were drunk the two times they had it). food always tastes exponentially better when you arent sober.  lol. 

their slices were equivalent sized to costco, however about $5 a piece.  way expensive.... totally not worth it.
author: Abby Q.

description:
Wow, just wow. The guy yelled at me on the phone?! I've been going here for nearly two decades but NEVER again. Here's how the call went:

Him: Hello, Victor's Pizza. 
Me: Hi, I ordered delivery over an hour ago...
Him: (interrupts me) What?
Me: I ordered over an hour ago. I'm calling to see if my food is coming. 
Him: What do you want from me?
Me: I want to know when my food will arrive. 
Him: Who ARE you?! I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHO YOU ARE!!

That's the rudest tone I've ever heard from a restaurant. He yelled so loud my friend across the room looked up at me with worry. 

I guess this business thinks they don't need loyal neighbourhood support. Oh well, there's a dozen other places to go to instead.
author: Drew B.

description:
Update: after posting my review the owner contacted me to apologize. Apparently the delivery driver added a $20 dollar tip to my account after I had signed my receipt. He said that anyone who steals from his costumers steals from him. I was refunded my $20 dollars. The food was bomb best Pizza I had in a long time. Wings were so crispy and delicious.
Unbelievable.... we stayed about .5 of a mile away. We order pizza, wings, salad and pasta. My total came to $96 and change. We had it delivered to our hotel. Pizza arrived an hr and 15 min after ordering it. I sign my receipt and put a total of $100. Checked my back account 3 days later and they added $16.55 more to my account. Called my bank to file a fraud charge sense my receipt only states that my total with tip included came to $100.
author: Leslie A.

description: Food is ok if you just need a quick bite but in my opinion the pepperoni was a bit too salty and the minestrone soup was all carrots! I will not be back for a second visit.
author: Lynnette V.

description: Spouse and I had dinner here the other night.  We had lasagna and a meatball sandwich.  The lasagna came with soup or salad and bread; the meatball sandwich came with soup or salad and a small side of spaghetti - portions were good.  I don't believe they sat waiting between the kitchen and delivery to the table, but they were more warm than hot when it reached us.  The meals were filling and flavor was okay, nothing extraordinary - it was comfort food though on a chilly night.  Service was good, the waiter was attentive.
author: Dei C.

description:
This so far one of the best pizza restaurants in the city 
Calamari was very good
Wing were deep fried style yummy 
Cheese bread very good 
Ranch dip tasty 
Overall I would recommend this pizza spot I will be back
author: Big A.

description:
The cups were dirty and crusty. My sister's had a hair in it. The water was an off yellow. We were barked at by the owner or manager the second we walked in the door. Rude. 

The cheese on the pizza was disgusting. Come here is you want to catch something weird.
author: Samantha W.

description:
It's all so divine, where do I start? Charming little place on Polk St between California and Pine St, a block from the Golden Gate Holiday Inn. 
Nice staff, quite affordable even in San Fran. My husband ordered an antipasto salad and cheese pizza, both so fresh and perfect. We could have adult have split his order. 
I had the pleasure of a buttery, rich chicken Marsala with zucchini and carrots cooked to exacting crisp California produce perfection. The side of spaghetti with meat sauce was another delight. My husband helped himself to my dishes and was equally pleased. 
Checked in on Yelp and got 10% off! I will return for sure since San Francisco is one of our favorite places.
author: MJ R.

description:
The line for a slice was about 25 minutes given that it was Santa Con at the time. As we waited in line, the owner was attempting to parallel park and an individual tried to stop him as he proceeded to hit a car. The owner then began cursing and antagonizing the individual RIGHT in front of his restaurant and the man was trying to help him. 

By the time we got our slices, the pizza was very underwhelming, a bit greasy and not very appetizing. Will not be coming back.
author: Trevor M.

description:
Love the pizza and garlic bread here. You can skip the cheese with the garlic bread, since the dish itself is already so flavorful! As for the pizza I shared a small vegetarian with friends, which comes in 6 slices. They put a lot of toppings on here which gets you pretty full after a couple of slices. :) 

They have both a dine-in and take home option, although pizza by the slice is only to go. Plenty of seating, great service, and a nice, quaint atmosphere to get away from the city noise. Will be back to try the other pizza items on the menu!
author: Esther K.

description: Okaayyy. Whether it is for sit down, or to just grab a slice of pizza, it is DELICIOUS. The food is so good, cheesey, and made fresh to order. Ate here about 4 times during my one week stay haha.
author: Jenny L.

description:
The pizza is excellent, but the wait staff are dead of human emotion or basic common sense on customer service. They only smiled when they saw me checking in on Yelp at the end of my dinner. 

Ordering to go or for delivery is my recommendation!
author: M D.

description: Great pizza.  Ask for them to make it crispy. Their wings are good too.  Service can be a little quicker and attentive but other than that everything is great.
author: David S.

description:
Excellent Chef Salad, I get it weekly. Always ask for
the dressing on the side tho :)
author: Katie S.

description: This is good pizza. I abhor chain pizza places and I'm very picky about my pizza selection. If I like it then it's definitely to my taste. Of course it's no Bravo's pizza, but I feel like it's a close second and tied with North beach pizza on my list.
author: Bernadette R.

description: Pizza is on the thinner side, it had good flavor but I feel like the sauce was heavy on the condiments and so was their soup. The chicken Caesar salad I ordered was good. I just wished they would not add extra oregano or at least ask before they sprinkle condiments to the food.
author: Hard Taco I.

description: Delicious and tasty. Highly recommended. Affordable and not too pricey selections. Great for parties
author: Abigail S.

description:
Tiny place with a big heart! We ordered take-out and the service (even just over the phone and for pick-up) was kind and gracious. 

We got the Victor's special and a side of wings for a lazy Friday night. Pizza was slightly above average. A bit of a limp crust and not chewy/airy enough. Reminded me of pizza from Costco. It's not artisan or Neapolitan but it'll get the job done! Wings were delicious actually and some of he beast I've had. They come with the buffalo sauce on the side which I appreciated.

Older gentleman at the front is wonderful and I'm glad that business is booming for him! Great local, no-frills, pizza place.
author: Semuteh F.

description: I had two pies delivered from here the other day.., a med. pepperoni and a victors special. They were delivered early and were fresh and hot. Loved the ingredients, both pies were delicious!
author: Simon W.

description: Huge slice, sauce and cheese were delicious. The crust was a little tough, but edible. $4.50 for a slice of cheese pizza which is about right in the city. Definitely worth it.
author: Christina J.

description: A good pepperoni pizza. Had it delivered to our hotel room. Yes a little expensive but what isn't anymore. Would order from them again when we are in San Francisco again.
author: Christina J.

description:
Besides the pizza being barely edible (so tough my jaw hurt after 1 slice) they gave me a salami salad instead of a green salad. I'm a vegetarian. 
I tried to call to fix it but the only number listed is a fax number. So I can't get my salad or a refund.
author: Janis E.

description: The best pizza I've ever had and is fresh since I'm a little lactose and I had to go right after I finished eating
author: John P.

description: Pizza was pretty good but the service was horrible room was empty and really dark and slice I had was really garlicky. Overall I would recommend eating here but for SF I've had beeter pizza at other places for the same price. With wayyy better service . I want to rate it a 2 and a half but there not an option
author: Moath I.

description: Victors special is pretty good for SF! I'm from Chicago so I know good pizza. Have always been disappointed when I've tried other pizza places in SF.
author: Angela L.

description: We had a very good calzone, not flashy or trendy. Tasty sauce, creamy ricotta, crust with just the right amount of chew, I'd return for sure.
author: Dan K.

description: Best pizza in the area. Friendly service. Fast delivery and pickup. You can't go wrong with any pizza. Fresh toppings. Cheesy garlic bread super yummy!
author: KJ G.

description:
Really good and cheap Tender Nob neighborhood pizza joint. 

Recommended to me by folks in the neighborhood, this was a great find that's going to be a keeper.

Open late night for an after hours meal, the quality is much better than you might *think* you'd expect in this 'hood, but it's legit.

I've had a variety of toppings and I have found each combination equally as good as the other.

If you live nearby go try it. Or if you find yourself nearby, try it.

Hundreds of Yelpers can't be wrong. 

Right? ; - )
author: Diana V.

description:
Easily the best pizza in this city. Everything is really well balanced.

Perfect example of hole in the wall place with simply and charming decor. 

Staff is prompt and efficient. Are they super nice and bubbly? No. Does it matter as long as that big dinner rush line moves efficiently? No. Is the food really good? Yes!
author: Matthew P.

description: I live close by so I always pick my order up. When ordering by phone it's very quick and easy. When picking up is hot, ready and staff is helpful. But the real beauty comes when you try their pizzas, all three of them that I have had are really good, and very hearty. Without a doubt is one of the best options in the area.
author: Roberto V.

description:
My wife and I are in San Francisco on vacation.  We just walked like 12 miles in the last two days.  We were tired, sore and just needed some comfort food.

The hotel recommended Victor's.  The wife says calling to order was very easy.  What really impressed me is we were quoted 40 minutes to deliver.  It got here in 17!  Amazing!

The pizza itself was pretty good.  Was it the most amazing thing I've ever put in my mouth?  No, BUT it did do exactly what a pizza is supposed to do.  Be hot, tasty, slightly greasy and not health food.  All those boxes were checked.

For the afficionados here, the sauce was a bit mild, with a hint of fennel I believe.  The cheese didn't pull off the dough in one big glob.  The toppings were evenly distributed.  No major bubbling.  And lastly, it is a hand docked dough, which is always nice.

While I don't foresee being back in SF anytime soon, I wouldn't hesitate to order from Victors again.

P.S. - I manage a Pizzeria.  I do know a good pie when I have one.
author: Dan Z.

description: One of the best pizza joints we've been to. When we would dine in, we continuously felt rushed by the same waitress girl. We tried many other items on the menu and they were okay, we've had better Italian food. Overall, it is a very cozy place and we would HIGHLY recommend their PIZZA.
author: Dilvin I.

description: I'm so picky about pizza but Victor's has won me over. Slices aren't too expensive, but you can only get them to go. If you want a full pie (you do.) or pasta or wings, you can sit inside. There are two dining areas - the one to the left is dimly lit and the one to the right is a little bigger and has brighter lighting. Ask for the pizza to be cooked well-done, as it adds a little bit of extra crisp to the crust! By far my favorite pizza in the city.
author: Sarah B.

description: Awesome food & service! We're visiting from Southern California & we just wanted good Italian food from a local restaurant & that's exactly what we got. The place is clean, calm, and has a very comforting mom & pop kind of feel to it & the service was fast and good. The food was great & tastes home-made & had a decent portion for the price! Would love to visit when I'm in town again.
author: Elvira X.

description: Ordered delivery and it came quickly and still hot. Pizza was amazing! Lots of cheese, toppings and it wasn't falling apart in the box. I would def order again.
author: KaTiE H.

description: I am definitely surprised that this place has 4 stars. Upon entering this establishment, the owner barked "Go sit back there!" Sat ourselves and the server brought us 5 glasses filled with... yellowish water? One had something crusty at the bottom (yes it was inside the glass) and another (aka mine) had a hair in it. The cheese on the pizza was stretchy and weird and did not taste like normal cheese. This place is pretty memorable, but not for good reasons. A hilarious New Years Eve memory of bad service, not so great food, and hairy & crusty water glasses. Sometimes places are just so bad that you have to laugh about it.
author: Miranda W.

description: We used to come to Victor's in the 90s, and during that time the food especially the pizza was always amazing and the service was really good we recently returned back to San Francisco after a long absence. However the old Victor's we love is gone. We're okay with them not changing the decor, even though it really needs a refresh it's very blah blah. However what shocked us is twice we had pizza there different dates and both times the pizza was undercooked and wet and runny in the middle really wasn't a good experience.
author: Eric A.

description: Every time I spoke of the city people would ask me if I tried Victor's Pizzeria & Italian. We finally gave it a shot and from the fresh salad with mozzarella slices, fresh bread, amazing pizza, and to die for pasta this restaurant was worth a second visit on our last day. I'm going to make this a must go to destination every trip out here.
author: Alan J.

description: Living in a world where there is so much change right now, I was very happy to see  Luckily, Victor's Pizza is still at it. I often go down a street and see a new restaurant going in and can't remember what was there last.  I would definitely miss Victor's if it disappeared.   I have been coming to this pizza place for 25 plus years. I recently started working in the area. Whenever I need a quick lunch I go over to Victor's to get a slice of its delicious pizza.  As I love anchovies on a pizza, that is my go to.  Anchovies on a slice of cheese pizza.  Their sauce is thick and tasty.  Ambience could be better, but I usually take away anyway.
author: Derald C.

description: I only order delivery from Victor's so this review is based on the food and timing. I've ordered different plates at different times/days and the food has always been really amazing in really quick delivery time. Never been disappointed. They are my go to when it comes to Italian food delivery.
author: Jay T.

description: Best Calzone on the west coast! Dough well cooked, crispy crust just the right amount of sauce just perfect, Haven't had one so good since I left NY also fast and friendly delivery, food delivered out of the oven hot.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Not a bad Italian spot.

Pizzas are better than the pastas.  The pastas are very one-note and very heavy tomato-ey.  The rigatoni bolognese tasted like your standard cheap Italian pasta dish at a diner of some sort.  Big portions, but I'm not sure I wanted that much mediocre pasta!

The pizzas are pretty enjoyable, but if you get one of the special pizzas, you cannot substitute. I think next time I would go with a make your own but the Victor's Special was really good.  I think if you order in the restaurant or through Eat24 you have to order the whole pizza, but if you walk in, they do have individual slices for purchase. My guess is they will sell you whatever slices they have in the window in the front.

The soups are meh but the dinners come with soup or salad, so at least that's nice.  The salad is ok, but the Italian dressing is super tart!  I think I would go with another dressing next time but the veggies were fresh (albeit lots of iceberg lettuce).

I'd come back but I think for the pizzas only.  The pasta was an experiment but if you want pasta, go the extra 15 minutes into north beach and get real pasta.  If you just want pizza, this one will do just fine.

WARNING FOR DELIVERY: they charge $3 for delivery and then the delivery guy will demand a tip, and if you get the same one I got, he's not even very friendly.  Not a good experience.
author: Traci H.

description: Went here twice during my week stay. Good food at good prices. The first visit we had an awesome server (young man who said he was pretty new, unfortunately I forgot his name). Great service & attentive. 2nd time still good food, a different server not as good but still a good time. Big window out front where you can watch them make pizza.
author: Lisa R.

description: Great little pizza place at a fair price. I was scrolling for a more traditional pizza place and found this one. The food was fresh and hot but super Greasy. But my boyfriend loved it. I wish I would have gotten the single slice, it looked less greasy. Overall it's a good place with fresh pizza and the ranch is good!
author: Sabrina F.

description:
Great pizza and service.
Staff is nice and the bathrooms are clean.

Will be back soon
author: Sam Z.

description: Nice food , great servers(Very nice Turkish girls) but so rude owners/managers! Place is old but so cozy.
author: Kerem Y.

description: I've had pizza b4 but I don't remember when I've had pizza this amazing, omg! the only bad thing about it that it was gone . I would come back from Arizona just for that pizza.
author: Junior R.

description: Excellent place to get a hot, thin slice pizza. They heat up the pizza in the oven before they serve it to you so it's piping hot. There's a nice amount of grease and cheese as well.
author: Young Y.

description: Solid spot for a to go slice (or 2)! I have never dined-in because hey only offer slices to go, but my pizza has always been good and definitely hit the spot. A bit greasy but consistently satisfying (and close).
author: Emily L.

description: Waited a long time for a very average slice of pizza. Was overpriced and pretty greasy. Could have just been because there was a huge crowd there, but still probably wouldn't return to try this again.
author: Sahil S.

description: Great Pizza place, order from them all the time. Quick delivery and awesome pizza!!
author: Michael H.

description: I was excited try victors. It had positive reviews and hoping for authentic Italian pizza (thin crust and slightly salty sauce). We ordered Victor's favorite it was just OK. Personally I like Georgio's or Gaspare's Pizza better I would rank Victor's a slightly behind Avellino's.
author: Dave L.

description: Best pizza in town.  Period.  Italian sausage is the best!  I order it "crispy" so that the crust is a little bit crunchy.  Delivery is usually less than 30 minutes.
author: B T.

description: On time delivery and hot but the pizza was just OK in terms of taste. A bit on the bland side.
author: Be K.

description: Another pizza shop on Polk. Came here after the bars on Santa con, and this definitely filled my craving. Not the Best pizza I've had in my life, but definitely a solid option if it is late and you are hungry. Ps the Hawaiian is my fav!
author: Ross S.

description: If you want a reasonably priced Italian restaurant, this is an excellent choice. The service is friendly and prompt. I was recommended the rigatoni Alfredo with two meatballs and a side of tomato soup. The meatballs have a great consistency and good flavor. The Alfredo sauce is quite creamy, and thick enough to cling to the noodles. The tomato soup is complemented well with the soft, dense breadsticks. Overall this was a pleasant visit I was in and out quickly.
author: Bryce T.

description: Good food with friendly good looking service. :) we were in the area and decided we were hungry. Read the other reviews and decided to stop in.  Very glad we did.
author: Deborah I.

description:
This place is solid none of that really fancy gourmet arugula, prosciutto, egg, goat cheese, etc pizza that's been popular lately. Service was friendly and quick and there's plenty of seating inside.

We had a medium (8 slices) pepperoni, sausage, bell pepper, olives, onions, cheese pizza (~$22) and it was delicious! That was more than enough for two people. They gave us aluminum foil and a bag to wrap up the leftovers. This savory and cheesy pizza really hit the spot!
author: Linda X.

description:
Pretty decent pizza by the slice. $4 for plain cheese (recommended) and 50¢ for each topping (not recommended). The pizzas are on standby and just get popped into the oven for baking when you request your slice. Unfortunately they aren't in there long enough to really cook the toppings. My pepperoni came out limp and bland - but that could also be because they don't use the good pepperoni. But the pizza itself was actually pretty good. They make a darn good chewy crust, and with the sauce and cheese it really hits the spot. 

So forget about the topping and stick to a plain cheese slice. BTW, it's huge. Three slices is as big as a small pizza.
author: Jean K.

description: We were looking for a pizza place to eat after the Giants game,well this place was close to our hotel and had great reviews so we tried it!! From the curb it looks so authentic! The staff knew what they were doing and were kind! Small but genuine place,we ordered a medium pizza to go and wow it was amazing!! We love thin pizza with real flavor and that's what we got. We recommend this restauraunt and will come back.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Hot wings and pizza is so good. I'm not a pizza person and very often would say I hate pizza. They use really good ingredients and tastes like no other pizza I've ever had. 

Really recommend. My rating is 100 percent food, the service is good too.
author: Lety S.

description: Ordered this for delivery at our hotel. Quick delivery!  Sauce to cheese ratio was perfect. Good flavors in the sauce. Crust was not too thin or thick.
author: Laura B.

description: Small little pizza place but very good! We were in SF for the weekend and wanted some quick/local pizza. Victors was friendly, quick & tasty!
author: Candace F.

description: This place was awesome  the food was really good. We ordered the victor special a ceaser salad and an Italian sub. Everything was awesome.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Ernie C.

description: The place is very traditional and very tasty!  Much love for the pie here!  Recommended highly!
author: Travis S.

description: Worst pizza I've had yet I could have asked a homeless guy to make a better pizza they are way over priced and as I go to pay I can see the people who made our pizza smoking cigarettes inside the restaurant and at no point did anyone wash there hands we chose to not tip due to the service and the amount of time we had waited for our pizza there was nobody else was in front of us either then they had the balls to follow us outside because we didn't tip them
author: Sal G.

description: Always amazing pizza! We no longer live in SF but will always make a stop at Victor's when we are in town!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Other than the fact that the day went went was over 100 degrees (you never ever see that in San Francisco) our experience was just fine. It's not over fancy restaurant but the food is super super good. They nailed that and that's what I love. They don't use food from cans or boxes (like many neighboring "restaurants") they use the real stuff. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.
author: Joe P.

description: Great go to pizza delivery in SF.   They are good on the toppings and follow special requests.
author: Kristine K.

description: Been going there for years and their pizzas are really good with nice spices and not too thick. I like their Poor Boy and Chicken Marsala dishes.
author: Jean-Denis H.

description: Very top notch pizza if you order it as a whole pizza and not as a slice so it's not dried out and hard. The Victors special is what I recommend with a side of warm marinara sauce.
author: N A.

description:
cheapest pizza in town

ordered a whole pizza and was disappointed with the lack of ingredient and taste, it looks obvious that they do not give much and also tasted very salty.  it was one of the worst pizza I had in SF.  FYI Costco pizza much better and it's cheaper too
author: Mason C.

description: We went to Victor's because my husband wanted pizza and it was close to our hotel.  The staff was friendly, but it was way overpriced and the food was not good.  The minestrone was good, and had a rustic feel to it.  However, the lasagna was hard to eat.  It was covered in foul tasting sauce.  It was difficult to tell the pasta from the cheese.  It was a mess.  My son had gnocchi that was so undercooked that it was basically lumps of mashed potatoes.  Also, they charge for refills on soft drinks.  It cost more than a meal at Disneyland, and was awful. I would not go there again.
author: Diane D.

description:
I've always marched to my own drummer and usually that's worked for me.

In the case of Victor's Pizza, it's meant that until today, I've only done take out or delivery of their (fantastic) chicken Marsala. 

Not pizza, just chicken Marsala.

Too tired to cook, not feeling leftovers, I Yelped my way through my usual pizza spots and up came Victor's among the mix.

What I can say is the Victor's Special ($21.50 medium) is spectacular: Stacked with loads of pepperoni, sausage (nicely infused with fennel), mushrooms, bell peppers, onions & black olives, every bite was a little bit of heaven.

The crust was chewy but not too thick. The amount and quality of the toppings were fantastic.

I'd personally put Victor's Pizza ahead of Little Star (taste test yourself) and hey, if you're not in the mood for pizza, choose Victor's chicken Marsala! 

PS Victor's delivers for free- and to a much larger area, too.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
This place is pretty good. Had delivery today for dinner since I was too lazy to walk around. Staying a the Westin and this place was one of the places that delivers. Called to order the hawaiian pizza and some wings. Came out to be around $30. A bit pricey for just a pizza and wings but it hit the spot and it was just what I needed tonight.
Ingredients were pretty fresh and the delivery was actually pretty quick. 

I would definitely come back to eat at this place again.
author: Jacob H.

description: This is my favorite pizza spot in SF. Great for delivery or eating in. Can't go wrong with their pizzas or pastas. They have good basic salads as well. I live in the neighborhood and always get my delivery in less than 30 min.
author: Marc U.

description: Victor's is the best cheap pizza in the city. They arrive within 30 minutes every time I order and bring the pizza with a CUP of ranch. Yes, that's right, people, a coffee cup filled with ranch. My life is complete.
author: Mike B.

description: Hidden neighborhood gem! This unassuming spot in nob hill was on the way from my daily shuttle stop. Out of curiosity, I looked past the seemingly rustic interior and dined there. Ordered a chicken marsala which came with a soup, homemade bread and spaghetti. The food was great - esp if you are craving "homey" food and don't feel like cooking. The waitress lightens the room up with her warmth and smile. Will definitely be back!
author: Vivien S.

description: Old fashioned, casual Italian Italian. Nice booths or tables, two different rooms in which to eat. Their spaghetti is good, so is their pizza and minestrone and breads. Reasonable prices for a meal, $25 ish. Even though it's SF, where parking is illegal, I've still had better than moderate success finding a spot.
author: Jane S.

description: We went to this restaurant while we were on vacation.  We were there on a Saturday evening and we were able to get a seat right away.  The food was delicious and everything was served piping hot. We had rigatoni Alfredo, seafood linguini and lasagna. The waitstaff were very attentive. I definitely recommend checking it out!
author: A A.

description:
Victors!  Top 2 for Pizza in the Sucker Free!

This is FRISCO pizza...Crisp on bottom...moist dough...little burn on it.  This is Native Style PIZZA!! 

Stop comparing it to N.Y. pizza..you want that then take/move yo AZZ back to that place...
oh and get out your heavy coat cuz youll freeze this time of year while we in SF enjoying Victors pizza without a jacket on!

Furthermore i dont visit Manhattan talkin bout your bread sucks SF sour dough is way better!!!  Check yourself and remember where your at!

415!!!
author: Craig G.

description: This place hit my craving for night time eats.  They have big slices of pizza, I got my two fav pizzas: cheese,  mushroom & sausage.  Both were good.  Nice guys at the counter too.  No complaints!
author: Lyn C.

description: Great pizza. We had the Victors special and were not disappointed. Crust was the right combination of chewy and crispy. Toppings galore.
author: Jason M.

description: The pizza was delicious and delivered in a timely manor for an authentic oven baked pizza. The service was quality but refills and extra napkins were tought to come by for how greasy the pizza was. Overall good experience and would highly recommend.
author: Matt K.

description: Ordered our pizza via Eat24, so that part was painless. Delivery came about 5-10 minutes early, so that part went great. As for the eating, that was phenomenal. Probably best pizza I've had in 5 years, and I live in North Beach.
author: Zack G.

description: Delicious pizza with light, slightly burned crust (in a good way). Super fast delivery. For salad orders, be sure to order dressing on the side!
author: Jane C.

description: Stopped here for some pizza after checking in to the Holiday Inn.  My wife and I split a medium Victor's favorite and some mozzarella sticks.  They were both delicious!
author: Josh C.

description:
This is for take out only. I have not yet dined in... 
My kids and I were hanging at a park nearby and I could tell they were getting hungry and not willing to sit at any restaurant. Time to duck out quick and grab the kiddos something they'll eat and fast. Low and behold I trusted my app (w a 10% off check in offer) to lead me here. I phoned in my order and the gentlemen on the phone said 15mins. Wow fast! I quickly drove there and it was ready as expected. 

Large half pep and half cheese + 10% off =$18 (plus tip, I always tip I'm in the biz to).

Good thin crust. Nice and hot... I'd return.
author: Liz N.

description: Came in twice for a slice. Smells great inside and the service is a touch gruff, but friendly if they're not too busy. Pizza was fairly good, nice crust, decent toppings. The to go is on a paper plate with foil on top. I asked for a bag and received one. They deliver, too.
author: Penguin S.

description: Oh my word! Everything from the marsala to the lasagne, the eggplant and the chicken fettuccine alfredo were amazing! Their minestrone soup was also delicious. Our waiter, was so attentive and polite!! We sat and watched as 1 pizza after another flew out of here!! Don't pass this one by.
author: Kat A.

description:
Why don't they clearly state in their ad that they do not deliver?
Its reads they take pick up orders.  They must get a lots for pizza orders.
Bet it goes something like this.  I want to order a ham and sausage pizza.
What size?  Medium.  And add a 2 liter of soda and a dessert.  What kind of desserts do you 
have?  We don't have desserts.  Oh.  Ok.  How much is that going to be?  That will be $200 dollars.  How long will it be do you think?  I am kinda hungry?  It should be 45 minutes or less.
Where are you coming from?  I know your on Polk I live at 777 Van Ness that's where your coming to?  Oh we don't deliver. WTF.  10 minutes on the phone and you tell me now.  Click.

Wait a minute.  I am gonna call them and see how the call goes.  Watch.
---They did not answer the phone.  No voice mail. Not ordering from Victor's.  LOL
author: John D.

description:
I like the idea of a place trying to do a NY slice near the Tenderloin but the pizza dough is too thick. Given some real credit for the tomato mozzarella ratio - it's got real substance and greasy mix to it. 

The three stars are not a slam - I'd give 2 or less to almost every other place in SF.  But strictly for deep cravings only.
author: Tatiana G.

description: Delivery food was cold, no utensils and the salad was already dressed making it pretty soggy. Delivery was quick, though.
author: Michael G.

description:
Definitely happy we stubbled upon Victor's pIzza.  Just a good old fashion NY slice of pizza dough, grease, pepperoni, sausage and salty cheese.... just like Sal made it back in the day.

Its like holding piece of New York right in your hand all the way out here on the West side and your hand gets greasy 

Had the pizza delivered with some cokes... no problems with the driver.  Not sure  why 'Leslie 
A" had such an issue with them.. Im getting  headache listening to all her whining  just walk outside and meet the driver Les... boom your done.  Maybe the "A" stands for something like A whole lotta pains in the neck. 

Check out the pie... its pretty good for San Fran
author: Peter S.

description:
Their individual slices aren't anything special. I ordered a slice of pepperoni and the total came out to $4.90 ($4.00 cheese slice + $.50 pepperoni + tax). They baked the pizza slice for a short time, and when they handed it to me, the pepperoni seemed a little undercooked. The pizza was generally dry and lacking in flavor - I expected more seasoning and red sauce, and the cheese to be more melted. Individual slices are only to-go, so even if there is a lot of seating available, you aren't really allowed to eat it inside, which I find to be a strange rule given that there is so much seating.

Maybe their whole pies are tastier, but I wasn't impressed with my individual slice, and found it overpriced compared to other places that do pizza by the slice.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description: They ran out of pizza while I was waiting in line and instead of letting people know, they just closed up shop and directed us to a pizza place across the street. It would have been nice to give us more of a notification rather than let people wait 15 minutes.
author: Nick Y.

description:
Got a slice of pepperoni and mushroom to go. Cost a little under $5.00 for one slice. Kinda pricey, and also undercooked.

Could have used more time in the oven, and it should be cheaper.

You can see the undercooked toppings in the photo.
author: Jack R.

description:
Where do you go when you need to get dinner before you go out? Victors pizza.
My 30 year old butt decided it was going to go out with my friends 30 year old butts. Needless to say- we don't go out much and when we do its work.
So we met at Victors pizza, bought a medium pizza which would be too little for a regular night for 3 people, but when you are trying to go out and wear a slutty dress you eat less.
So we split a medium pizza, and poured the contents of our disposable flasks into our water and prepartied discretely.
It ended up being a great night and it all started with pizza at Victors pizza!
author: Julianna I.

description: We stopped in cause they had a great check in offer for those dining in. This place is very bare bones when it comes to decorations, but they more than make up for it with their fast and attentive service, and the fantastic pizza. They have a make your own model (along with a few pre-created options) and a number of calzones, pastas, and side dishes. I got a 12" cheese, sausage and garlic pizza and it was DELISH. Just the perfect size.
author: Kristen T.

description: I don't review on ambiance because all I care about it how it tastes. Victors is awesome. The pizza was so melty and the crust was crisped to perfection. We also got the garlic bread. I loved it, but its pretty strong stuff, real garlic cloves baked right in the bread. Price was pretty decent, and the place was clean. Would def go again when we visit SF in the future
author: Kevin B.

description: EXCELLENT calzone, so I'm guessing that the pizza is great as well. The cannelloni was really good too, but I definitely enjoyed the calzone. The waiter was great. Watching the food be made in the front window and hearing the owner take orders added to the family feel of the place and I really enjoyed it.
author: Kayla K.

description: If all you want is a slice, you have to get it to go. We wanted a place to sit, so we ended up getting a glass of beer and the manager let us dine inside with our slices. Slices are fairly big, so I feel like I got my money's worth. Wasn't the best pizza I ever had, but at least I was satisfied afterwards.
author: Anita L.

description: Dear Victor's - don't tell a customer it's a 45 minute delivery and then make up some bullshit excuse when the customer calls in at 60 minutes for status. Make sure your idiot delivery person has the right address and encourage them not to f*ck around in their parked car for 10 minutes before making the delivery. And lastly, when the customer refuses delivery because the pizza is f*cking cold, pick up the phone and make it good. Your prices are high enough. You exist by the good grace of Polk Gulch customers.
author: Michael S.

description:
So good. Amazing pizza available at a late hour. The service was fast since we ordered by the slide. The slides were huge and loaded with the toppings. You know you've had good pizza when the roof of your mouth is burnt because you couldn't wait for the pizza to cool down. 

No complaints at all with this pizza experience.
author: Kelby H.

description: $5 a slice after last call at the bars seems like a small price to pay to soak up the alkie. Slices are pretty big and the flavors are good. We had some meat and veggie slices. I like cold pizza and they didn't give me grief for asking them not to warm it up. Yay.
author: Julie L.

description: Came in from a Yelp review, and pizza was fantastic!  Great dough, sauce and dough had a nice smoky flavor to the crust - they absolutely know what they're doing, and I highly recommend!  Very attentive and nice folks, prompt service.
author: Jeff R.

description: Felt legit Italian. Hit the spot and was super fresh.
author: Ana + Eric D.

description: We are from the east coast and are very tired from traveling. We decided to get pizza and stay in the room tonight. This is absolutely DELICIOUS!!!!! We just got an extra cheese pizza and garlic cheese bread. Our 2 year old is throwing down on this pizza. If we are ever back in the area we will absolutely get this pizza again.
author: Shunterika L.

description: This place is awesome!! In SF and exhausted after a long weekend of apartment hunting and sightseeing. Searched for a good pizza place near our hotel and stumbled on the great reviews for Victor's. We gave them a call - first sign of great things to come! The man who answered the phone was so nice, and made the order and delivery process very easy. He said the pizza would be here in 45 minutes. Less than 30 minutes later, a delicious pie showed up at the door. We couldn't have been happier with the service or food. We ordered the vegetarian specialty pizza - the veggies were very fresh and the pizza was baked perfectly. We also ordered a side order of garlic bread. Not my favorite garlic bread (a little too crispy) but not the worst either. Will definitely order from Victor's again!!
author: Tash L.

description: We rumbled on in through the front entry, confidently ordered a large pepperoni with sausage and shrooms, 15 mins later, walked away with a fresh, hot and pretty darn good pizza!
author: Andrew H.

description: They ran out of dough and did not notify anyone in line. Just closed up shop and told everyone to leave.
author: Mark A.

description:
Found this place while staying around the block for a conference. The service here was fantastic: the waitress I has was so friendly, knowledgable about the menu, and told she was a pesto fanatic. Does it get better than that? 

The food was solid. I got spinach gnocchi with pesto sauce and it came with a basic salad and a roll o' bread. Nothing fancy, but not bad. The gnocchi was hard core...never seen them so big. A generous serving and they were dense over fluffy, which I like. Vegetarian friendly (though not for vegans), solid service and tasty food with large servings? Definitely worth a nosh! Plus, I was missing my partner, and a cute Italian NY hole in the wall was just what I needed!
author: Shanna K.

description:
I really enjoy the food from this place, and I have been ordering from here for a long time. The Chicken Parmesan is some of the best that I have had delivered;watch out for bay leaves in the sauce. I really enjoy the pizza, HOWEVER, (this is where the 1 star deduction comes in) I stopped ordering pizza for delivery, because it tastes like cardboard by the time I get it. I would like to suggest using a sheet of wax paper or something when sending it out for delivery, so it doesn't arrive at a lower quality than what I believe you want your customers to have. 

Note* Chicken Parmesan comes with a small amount of pasta, some bread, and choice of soup or salad.
author: Angelo P.

description: Man, it's been a while.  Hi.  Today's lunch to go was meat lasagna, salad, and bread from Victor's.  For "in case' measure I also ordered a side of their meatballs with the "in case" being if I didn't like the lasagna.  All in all it was tasty plus they are not shy in providing lots of meat sauce.  I would definitely get their meatballs again with some of that crusty tasty bread although I must say I had a very heavy lunch that will tie me over well into the night I think.
author: Emy B.

description: Wow!!! Great Food , Speedy and friendly service. Coming from San Diego it was difficult to choose from so many pizzerias, but wow this place was worth it. Highly Recommended it... Yummy
author: Maria I.

description:
SF pizza at its finest.

This place truly is the gift that keeps on giving!

An extra crispy pepperoni mushroom black olive pie with a side of the richest, creamiest, heavenliest ranch that has ever graced your mouth = Heaven!
author: Derek R.

description:
Been coming here since before the kids.  And we still come here.  Why? Because it's good.  It's comfortable.  

The neighborhood has transitioned from "this to that" and everything else in between. But Victor's has always been a constant.  

I like them. I recommend them for a very good meal with large portions.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Pretty good pizza for SF. High price and pretty unfriendly operators. But given the neighborhood -- historic but still transitioning -- I don't really blame them. 

Open late, but takeout only.
author: Nikolai Y.

description: Good.
author: Wendy S.

description:
My review may be unreliable, you see, I was inebriated when I tried this place. But for $20 or so, we had a God sent pizza to fill the bellies of drunken swine like me. 

The service was terrible, however, and the man behind the counter reminded me of the famous Soup Nazi from Seinfeld. I had witnessed him yelling at a woman ahead of me for being unclear about her order. Get a grip, guy, she's a customer.

They were stingy about handing out Parmesan and pepper packets, too. But hey, a pizza place that's a stone's throw away from the bar? Perfect.
author: Danielle S.

description: Great crust. Nice touch of oregano. Great service too. Just the perfect touch of sauce and cheese.
author: Dana M.

description:
Yes,this place IS a New York style pizza palace of fine pizza and Yes! I am from new York and will attest that to be so! The sausage,cheese and light sauce is much to my
 childhood delight.It'
s a hole in the wall just the way you like your pizza place,fast and to go-goodbye!.
I will be back when in the city!.I love the fact you can see all the ingredients they use right in front of you.....This of course ads to the ideas you may have while ordering as to toppings you choose! They will simply accommodate! Go for it San Francisco! This place is great! You can smell that dough cooking from 39 feet away on California street!
author: Brian D.

description:
We ordered take out here  - so this is a delivery review.

The packaging for the food was terrible. The bags were soaked with butter because someone put butter underneath all of the hot food and the plastic containers were not sturdy enough - but the food itself was delicious.

We ordered spaghetti and meatball - so delicious
Minestrone soup which was much more flavorful than I expected and was good
Clam linguine with white wine sauce and it was really good - needed a tiny bit more salt
The only negative was the garlic bread - it was hard and slightly burnt but I could tell that the travel in the car took away from the freshness

I would definitely order again.
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Very satisfied with the customer service. Employees are friendly. Waitress was really nice and our pizza only took less than 10 min to come out. I love that I didn't have to wait so long for my pizza to come out because I was starving and was afraid to get full of soda.
author: Aimee H.

description:
There's honestly not that many great local pizza joints in SF to be honest. I think people just have bad taste buds and don't know what real flavor and good crust tastes like lol. And seriously, forget all these new fancy pizza toppings such as "argula" like WTF. LEAVE TRADITIONAL PIZZA ALONE. Victor's comes a little closer to what I'm looking for in a local pizza joint. The crust isn't too crunchy, although the crust edges could be better so they can be eaten easily. I almost ate a whole small pie in like a sitting and a half lol. Pepperoni, Sausage, Mushroom. The sauce is flavorful and not too watery like other places. Cheese good. And the leftovers I did have STILL tasted good after like 2 days when I warmed it in the microwave with a few drops of water. So Kudos. 

The service could use a little work of course, like with most local places owned by foreigners/people not from here.
author: Marquis A.

description:
Beware! Disgusting act witnessed! 

I walked into this place today around noon with the intention of purchasing a slice of pepperoni pizza. 
The man who was behind the counter (older middle eastern dude) didn't notice when I walked in, and as I was standing at the counter waiting to be helped, I saw him accidentally drop a plastic container of pepperoni onto the floor, casually pick it up, slice by slice and place it back into the container! He then continued to place the container of tainted pepperoni onto the table with the other toppings where they prepare the pizzas. (I guess this guy believes in the five second rule.) Needless to say I was aghast.

He then continued to go about his business and, when he realized I had been standing there the entire time and witnessed what he had done, became very nervous and embarrassed and immediately made a show of retrieving the container of floor pepperoni and throwing it into the garbage! The pepperoni which had come into direct contact with the floor and which he had painstakingly collected and put back into the container! The pepperoni which he had intended on serving to his customers! Needless to say I was appalled and disgusted and immediately walked out!!! No food poisoning for me, thank you very much! I wonder if he retrieved the pepperoni out of the garbage after I left...

Not cool-This is San Francisco baby! We don't play that here! Makes me wonder what else is going on behind the scenes when no one is looking. Yikes!

I called the health department today and reported this disgusting act. Eat here at your own risk.
author: Vic F.

description: Solid pizza but shady business. Ordered about a month or so ago. Paid with my credit card and they had to copy it with the old school paper scanner thing. They didn't give me a receipt or anything and I wasn't able to indicate my desired tip for the driver. Anyways, I figured they're used to this business and maybe the tip was built into the price or something since I couldn't write anything in. Anyways, I look at my credit card statement a few days later and see it was charged $20 more than my bill! I tried messaging the business but got no response. Clearly they don't care about their reputation or they would have responded. If you're gonna order here be sure to pay with cash!
author: Nate D.

description: Ordered a pizza they said it would be ready in 25 minutes traffic is horrible around the area and there is no place to park I dropped my friend off to pick the pizza up and they had not even made it, they said we would just have to wait and they were not apologetic at all the pizza is not worth the wait order from a place that has their shit together
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Went in to grab a slice of cheese pizza. Service was fast and pizza was great. Would definitely go back.
author: Raman S.

description: This is my go-to pizza place in SF. The pesto pizza is really really good, and a medium is pretty big. Enough for three hungry people. I love that they're open super late, too. Only drawback is that it's super expensive, but then again, so is everywhere in SF.
author: Madeleine M.

description: Just ordered pizza and wings delivery on a saturday night. Ordered a pepperoni pizza and a victor's special and the best crispiest wings ever!! I'm so glad I found this place, it's delicious.
author: Ingrid J.

description:
Holy crap, Victor's delivers one fabulous pizza, and FAST!   Granted I only live half a mile away but that can easily translate into decent waiting times when I order delivery - but not Victors.   They get that piping hot pie to you in 20 minutes almost every time.  

I always order the same thing, a large Victor's Special.  It hits the spot every time and has great flavor and quality dough.  Every time I'm tempted to branch out I realize that there is no need to, I've already found the perfect pizza. 

Prices aren't bad either. I think it's around 31 bucks before tip.
author: Bobby L.

description:
Raised by two New Yorkers, I'm what some call a "pizza snob".  
Their sausage is my favorite- and they aren't shy with the toppings!
The people who work their are nice, to the point and quick !!
author: Kaila B.

description: It's slim pickins for a good slice in SF.  Victor's is one of the better spots but at $4.90 for a mushroom and cheese the juice isn't worth the squeeze anymore.  Save your cash and check out Arinell's in the Mission.
author: Carl C.

description: So far... This is the best pizza place on Polk in SF that I know of so far.... The service is pretty good and the pizza is reasonably priced. Went here before seeing Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (gotta have pizza right?)
author: Cliff S.

description:
When you tell them to put garlic on there, they don't hold back. I ordered a simple cheese pizza with garlic, and they just went for it. I like me some garlic, but know that you're going to ward off vampires in three counties if you have it.

It's a pretty easy setup, at least for the late night stop I made. Walk up and order by the slice, served to-go only, or go back and sit in the very dimly lit dining area and order something more substantial. It would be nice to order by the slice and stick around, but methinks that's the whole point in only offering whole pizzas to dine-in customers; keep the riff-raff out.

I did dig the neon sign and had to snap a pic. The guy running the joint and the old-school feel (not as a gimmick, just that it's really old school) lent a certain charm to the whole experience. It's probably not the best slice in all of San Francisco land, but it's a solid stop in the neighborhood.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Didn't mean 5 stars, guess can't go back. 3 stars in guess. Mozzarella sticks good. Ordered Hawaiian pizza. Good, nothing exceptional but good pizza nonetheless. The Yelp coupon gives you 10% off so that's nice. I love yelp.
author: Kelly P.

description: This place is pretty cheap, I don't really like the food that much though.   I got a supreme pizza with no olives, the service was poor.
author: Michael E.

description: I was staying around the corner at the holiday inn. I had saw victors pizza so I gave it a try. I ordered an medium pie and 8 wings. Ordering on the phone the owner came off a little rude, didn't even ask for a name and hung up on me. The pizza was burnt and not as great as larger chain pizza shop. You would think with the price I was paying I would get a better tasting pizza. Instead I got a cardboard. Wings are okay, but pizza was terrible. I had ate one slice and threw it away. Spent close to 40 dollars. Not satisfying. I would rate a 2 star, but since wings was good 3 stars for me. Will I come back? Nope!
author: Scott P.

description: Just a run of the mill pizza really (not bad but not amazing either) they have really tasty fried chicken wings though! Just too many other amazing places in SF.... Ok though.
author: Kirk M.

description: Quote "no slices after eleven" (at 9:20 pm on Halloween). Overpriced for what it is and incredibly slow service. There is much better to be had a few doors up and down Polk Street.
author: Mike V.

description:
We were looking for a Pizza Hut but fortunately they did not have dine in and we ended up at Victor's because of the high ratings and it was walking distance from our hotel (Holiday Inn). We ordered 2 large Pizza's,mozzarella sticks and beer. Other than the fact that the Mozzarella sticks were fried to a crisp and slightly burnt, the pizza was good. Crust had a char to it but lacked flavor. Place was clean and we enjoyed our meal.  Service was fast and the server was friendly. 

Would certainly recommend this place.
author: Caco F.

description: Not trendy but they have it where it counts.  Great pizzas and other Italian food.  Plus the delivery is fast.  Local fave!
author: Tom K.

description: This is a hidden gem, especially when all you ever want at 7 pm is a slice of good pie.
author: J Q.

description: Great pizza, but a little pricey compared to others in the area. Delivery was super quick! Would order again.
author: Charlotte C.

description: This is my favorite pizza in the city (well, top 5 - they are all at the same level).  Great crust, DELICIOUS sauce.  I love it!!
author: Pam L.

description: Great pizza and salad and friendly service. A 28 dollar pizza serves 4 easily. Yum. Try the Victors Favorite with a Greek salad :)
author: Chris L.

description: Fantastic food!! You need to try the pesto gnocchi and the bread... Amazing!!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
They overcharged my credit card by $5 on my last order. I'm guessing someone there wrote in a tip, even though I tipped in cash.

Extra star because the pizza's pretty good.
author: Eric T.

description: Nice restaurant and great pizza!!! Really good vibe, lovely place, great service e delicious pizza! We choose B and recomend :)
author: Samantha B.

description: Super fast delivery, super flavorful pepperoni! Pizza arrived hot. The toppings were generous and the crust is pretty good. New favorite pizza place for sure:) I'm happy to report SF's pizza game is on the up.
author: Shana A.

description: As a visitor in SF, I had no idea where I could get good pizza. I googled and trusted reviews. I'm really glad to try it. Victor's special pizza was delicious and served hot right after baked. All toppings were generous and perfectly cooked. Gnocchi pesto was creamy and had perfect amount of basil pesto in it. Staffs were friendly and kind.
author: Kwan Ho R.

description: Solid pizza joint if you just need a slice to go. $10 cash minimum and a slice of pepperoni is just under $5. You could do worse for post-bar food or late night eats.
author: Jenny N.

description: Excellent authentic New York-style pizza -- the dry, thick crust that I've missed since moving west four years ago.  Fresh cheese, home-made sauce (not what I call the phony Chef Boy-ar-dee corn syrup slop) and toppings that are real and freshly chopped.  Bravissimo!
author: Bill W.

description: Victors pizza is legit. This review is based on take out only- my husband and I have been walking by victors for over a year and have never ordered or eaten there because the pizza-by-the-slice pizzas are sitting in the window and frankly, they don't look too appetizing. But tonight we took a chance, and I'm so glad we did. We ordered a pizza and he got a meatball sub with a salad and it also surprisingly came with a side of pasta too! Everything was so fresh, the bread, the dough, the sauce, the salad- really really good. The sauce on the pizza was insane, it made my night. Def going back
author: Jasmine S.

description: BEST PIZZA IN TOWN! The restaurant itself it's very simple, and doesn't look really clean, butttttt when you order your food everything change.. Its the classic italian pizza, with all the fresh ingredients and the taste is insane! Don't judge for the cover, go inside and order the best pizza of your life! Plus the staff are really kind
author: Viviane C.

description:
To the haters: The staff is supposed to be a little grumpy - they've been on their feet serving unappreciative twerps like you all day... and a little food poisoning now and then is a small price to pay for authentic eats. 
Many great great spots have grumpy servers and dated decor.  Been to Gino and Carlos lately? How about Specs? I hope those places are still in existence.
After being gone for many years we were back in town playing tourist in the neighborhood and stopped 4 a slice after scoring a closet full of vintage clothing across street. Foolishly got mushroomS added at wife's request. She's from California so is still learning the role of the local pizzeria in a neighborhood like Polk Street. As a native Chicagoan I get Victors completely. It's a cultural icon. 
I scraped the mushrooms off outside (they were still cold... Apparently added at last minute... and devoured the slice properly  - no folding - savoring every morsel. It was awesome; confirming the authenticity not only of the establishment, but of the neighborhood ... and what the hell ... The entire city.
Thank you Victors for keeping it real, and for reminding us what it was like before the Chipotification of American cuisine.
And didn't they ha e a little problem recently?
author: Mike R.

description: Found this gem of a place quite randomly while I was in San Francisco, and I'm so glad I did. Pizza is absolutely amazing! Their crust is divine and their sauce is authentic Italian marinara. Easily, one of the best pizza joints in the Bay Area.
author: Lucy M.

description: I ordered deliver so that's what I'm reviewing on. 45 minutes for a small cheese pizza and small soup. 20$$??? And they guy had the nerve to say tip not included. If the pizza was good I would have no problem paying the 20 bucks but it taste like crap I'm sure dominos would have been better and cheaper than this. Idk how you can mess up a cheese pizza..... From an Italian place...
author: Alex Z.

description: Quick, easy and delicious! The portion size were huge! The seasoning was tasty. Even the crust was good without any sauce. At first I thought $4/slice was expensive than I saw the size and the taste itself makes it worth it. It was right next to the bar we came out of. Although it was Halloween night and busy the service was quick and easy. Wish I got more of it!
author: T S.

description:
The free baked bread is amazing, tastes homemade! My friend and I both had pasta dishes and they were delightful.

Small, hole-in-the-wall place right around the corner from our hotel. The service was great and the waiter's were friendly. Reasonably priced.

Couldn't have asked for more!
author: Krissy K.

description: Amazing food. Great service!! When we come back to San Fransisco we will definitely be coming back here.
author: Ashley B.

description: Polk Street is my stamping grounds and this is the best slice to eat & stroll on Polk try the others and compare had a Victor's cheese slice that was sublime thin and packed with tastiness! Other Polk St. slices are like wonder bread big white bloated and you feel full and yuck. I thoughtfully chewed the slice as I walked by about 5 joints that don't hold a candle to Victor's Pizza.
author: SF T.

description: At half time of the niner game my friend and I came here to refuel. We were seated and it was kind of dark in the dining room. Service was very attentive though. I had the minestrone soup I think. It was pretty good. I didn't like the fact that they kept the bay leaf in the soup, that's inedible. I believe we both had a sausage sandwich which came with a side of spaghetti. It was a pretty good hole in the wall, not sure if I'd go out of my way to come back. Also, their yelp menu is not updated because it had an item not on the current menu. The price was right.
author: Marty J.

description: Awesome pizza.  Came here for a late night eat and found them on yelp.  4 stars, open till late, and AMAZING pizza.  You can't go wrong.  I got 4 XL pizzas and they prepped it in about 15-20 mins for pick up.  The ambiance is pretty nice for dine-in too but we took them to the hotel.  Definitely worth every penny.  Highly recommended.
author: Reza A.

description:
If you're reading this review and you're perhaps a little drunk, horridly hungover, or too lazy to get off the couch to go get some pizza, continue reading. 

While I cannot say anything about the food at Victors for a couple of reasons: 
a) I don't really recall eating it as it was following a nap after an amazing giants game 
b) my friend are 6.5/8 slices of the pizza

I cannot say enough about their delivery service. While they initially quoted 45 minutes at 10:30 pm on a Saturday night, I do vaguely remember holding the warm box of pizza and delightfully chilled soda by 10:55. In my opinion, there's nothing better than great customer service, and Victors provided me with happiness in the form of pizza while I was a sad state and for that, they get 4 stars.
author: Jordan S.

description: Really like this pizza. Closest to NY style I've come across here. Soooooo good. Damn near perfect crust and good quality toppings and tasty pizza sauce. Always get the order right and their ranch dressing is the bomb! Fresh and fast. This is my go-to pizza delivery place.
author: Piper W.

description: I ordered 2 slices of pizza. It was great. I was craving for bread. It was a late snack. Maybe If I'm hungry next time I'll create my own pizza. I was in a hurry and just got the basic. Cheese and Pepperoni! The only part was being rushed while ordering, i didn't like that!
author: Lai S.

description: Best pizza slice on Polk St.
author: Giovan C.

description:
The biggest waste of money on a restaurant this year. If you are looking to spend the same amount of money for much better food quality, check out Luisa's pizza. I will never understand how this place stayed open so long with these prices for terrible food.

We got the clam bake pizza which was not fresh and had a weird taste, the rigatoni with Alfredo sauce and a side of meatballs which was bland, and the linguine carbonara which was the worst (pasta of poor quality and they put a lot of bacon hoping it would cover up the plain flavor). 

The only ok thing was the garlic bread with cheese and the sides of soup which was hot and hearty.

Honestly this place deserves a one star but delivery was surprisingly fast.
author: Richard B.

description: We got the garlic bread and the vegetarian pizza. Great for the price! They use FRESH chopped garlic and OMG it's amazing! Pizza was great too!
author: Dolly P.

description: Great tasting pizza and the best part that they delivered my pizza to my hotel room.  Will order again.
author: Isabelcristina C.

description: Service was excellent, always had a full glass of water. I had the spinach calzone, it was nice seeing a vegetarian option on the menu. The entree was very good, a little doughy in the middle(I actually like it that way) but it didn't take away from the dish. The crust was thick and crispy.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Our waitress was great, friendly and patient. 
Eggplant parm was delicious. Spinach Gnocchi was wonderful - I used the meal for appetizer for 3 of us.  my kids had pizza.
We would come again. Salad was just iceberg, I would rather have real greens.
author: Yolonda T.

description: Stopped by this placed and picked up a few slices to go and I was not disappointed. The crust was thin but not too thin, slightly crispy like the kind made from a wood brick oven, and the cheese proportion was perfect. Definitely a place to try if you're in this neighborhood.
author: Natalie J.

description: Really tasty pepperoni, sausage & mushroom pizza along with crispy fried wings. Delivered to Holiday Inn in about 35 minutes. Reviews were right on. Highly recommend.
author: K L.

description:
Ate some food from here for the first time in nearly a decade. There's a great big window with their pizzas on display, you cant miss it.

I've recently had the eggplant as well as the chicken parm. Both were great, and came with salad, vegetables, spaghetti and bread sticks. I've been lookin' for a place that could satisfy my need for Italian comfort food at a reasonable price and this is the freakin' place. Eat here, TONITE
author: Chris Y.

description:
$34 for a medium vegetarian pizza and an order of hot wings!! It's definitely the priciest pizza delivery I've ever had in SF, I'm not sure if there was an error in my bill or if the delivery charge was doubled due to the rain... I'm located less than a mile away so I doubt it was distance.

Despite the high cost, the pizza was tasty with lots of fresh veggies & it was heavy on the garlic (which makes me very happy).  The wings satisfied my craving but weren't super yum nor super bad. Hot sauce and ranch was provided on the side, so the wings stayed crispy!

I recommend Victor's for a takeout slice, but not likely for delivery.
author: Ariel E.

description:
If your looking for a place that reminds you of a small town family based Italian meal look no further. Simple and classic decor inside with fast and friendly service. 

Food: I tried a slice of their cheese based on other yelp reviewers. Thought it had good flavor, the right about of cheese and a crust still soft enough to dip into some sauce. :)

Round two was the eggplant parmigiana meal. I had the salad which was followed by a dish of pasta and then the actually main course. The portions were great, the flavor was authentic and exactly what I had hoped for. 

Pricing: Reasonable for SF. They also offer a 10% discount for the Yelp app. Whoot!
author: Diana B.

description:
Everyone who talks negatively about Victor's Pizza is a liar.

THIS IS THE BEST PIZZA IN THE WORLD and so satisfying! The secret must be in the tomato sauce or something. I have no clue but am determined to find out!
