Recently I went to New York and tried some pizza places... they only left me yearning for more VICTOR'S! NY doesn't compare. Nothing compares to the flavor of Victor's Pizza.
author: Carleen W.

description:
YELP removed my previous review due to their unfair practices. They stated i used promotion content in my review which was basically me offering alternatives. So i am reposting the review without the alternatives. Here is the original review without the 'promotional content':

"Overrated on Yelp. Slices are only allowed for take away. But they wont tell you that until you order and pay even after saying that you are ordering for here. Then they point you to the fine line in the menu. Also, they charge for using CC. Pretty sneaky management. Don't know what that is all about. The pizza is way below average. There are better places with better service for pizza all over Polk"
author: Karthick S.

description: Some of the best pizza I had in SF. The little lady and me stood at the ritz carlton for a weekend and ordered a late night pie. We were blown away by the delicious pizza. Its some of the best pizza around! Definitely stop by for a slice. We make it an every other week routine.
author: Gary M.

description: Just made an order in less then 30secs again and will end up the best pizza around.  Have done the custom slices before and was just amazed with how tall it grew and how fresh it was.
author: Justin I.

description: Amazing thin crust pizza, not doughy at all.  We were staying at the Marker and got the recommendation for the best delivery from a local.  They were right!  I would highly recommend this pizza if in the neighborhood!
author: Kathy F.

description: First time ordering from Victors, and it won't be the last. Large pizza was fantastic and minestrone soup was clearly homemade. So glad they deliver to my neighborhood and can't wait to try their pasta dishes. Highly recommend!
author: Tim L.

description: Just really good non pretentious pizza. Glad it's right by home! My husband and I agree it's the best pizza we've had so far in San Francisco. Will be back!
author: Brittany A.

description:
Pizza, mozzarella sticks, fries, and Caesar salad are what I vouch for. Not the best pesto pizza but a solid option for the area and late nights. For that I give it four stars. Calamari and chicken parm aren't that good. Noodles not simmered in sauce either. The chicken part is good but sauce is too acidic or tomatoey as another said ha. 

Delivery driver is whack tho. Left $4 for a $40 order the first night. I normally tip cash and needed to break a $20. He asked how much I needed back rather than giving me 10, 5,  and 1s. I said 16 and he tried to give and ask if 12 was OK when I said I can have the lobby break it. Then he magically came up with the missing scrill. Doesn't say thank you and walks off. Didn't really like him. Next night same guy but the order is 70. Food comes in paper bags that aren't easy to handle. Ask if there's ketchup and he says yes. Left a $3 tip cuz he doesn't deserve it but first thing he does is count the money. Then he scoffs and says it's not enough while waiting around a little top long saying I should call Yelp to add more. I told him it's all I had and walked away. Gaslighting sob made me feel bad about what I did cuz I normally tip well but the guy is a jerk. About to call Yelp to add more tip but then find no cheesey garlic break, spoon for the soup, or ketchup. Consider it the tip you don't deserve.
author: Amir F.

description:
A friend and I stopped in for a slice. We grabbed them with the intention to go. The restaurant was empty and they wouldnt let us sit down for 3 minutes to eat a slice of pizza. Very rude people working the register. (I understand if it was busy - but literally one table had people at it). Also - the pizza was average at best. 

Now I see why it was empty.
author: Jess K.

description:
Not too shabby.  I would only recommend the pizza as the side dish of wings we got were battered and fried - interesting choice when ordering the unassuming "wings".  The pizzas were large and easily filled up 4 grown men.  The combination and Cheese+Pepperoni were crowd pleasers to say the least.  the crust was thin but still provided a stable eating platform.  

They deliver too.  Keep up the good work boys.
author: Kevin J.

description: Best delivery pizza in SF. The Hawaiian with extra pineapple is my favorite. I live in Chicago and know good pizza. Trust me.
author: Laura P.

description:
Got here before 11pm on Wednesday night (8/20/14) to get couple of slices.  Went on yelp for recommendation. This had 4 stars.  

The service was super rude. The pizza was a joke: the toppings were thrown in top of a cheese pizza, uncooked! When we asked to put it back in the owen the guy got offended and more rude.  Not worth it.  Wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend to friends.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description: Great pizza with generous portions and equally stellar service. Try the cazones, they were surprisingly good. Will return.
author: Shannon E.

description:
When we were in the city this week, we ordered pizza from Victor's delivered to the Fairmont. It was delicious. It was so good that we decided to visit Victor's for dinner the next day. Bad call! my family ordered pasta dishes & I had the "B" calzone. My hubby & F-I-L had some kind of seafood & pasta, M-I-L had chicken marsala. Bad. Bad. Bad.

If you stick to the pizza or calzones you won't be disappointed.
author: Samantha J.

description:
After a night of bar-hopping, my girlfriends and I stumbled into Victor's.

The Victor's Special has tons of fresh toppings and the crust is perfect - crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside. 

The staff graciously put up with my friends and I and our drunken, loud, most-likely-annoying laughter. Being located on Polk Street, I'm sure they get that alot. But they were really nice about it.

They even have a bathroom way in the back behind the kitchen. Score!
author: Mariela D.

description:
The real rating is zero stars!!!!

Rude as FVCK!

So tonight me and my girl decided to get a slice of pizza before leaving the area. It was about 11pm. Anywayz I ordered and then asked if we can sit in the restaurant. This old ass bastards [who I think is the owner judging by the other posts] tells me [with all the attitude in the world], "No! That's why I asked if you were getting a slice. No slice eating in here. And besides I only have one waiter." I simply say "wow...okay". This guy was such a dick about it. And then when I called him on his attitude he tried to give me some other speech. To which I ordered him to just stop talking. And you know what he indeed stopped running his  mouth because I was done with him and his foul attitude. The service here sucks and is mad disrespectful.

As for the pizza, it's mediocre at best! The only reason they are probably still here is because of the prime location. 

THIS PLACE SUCKS! DO NOT EAT HERE...DO NOT GIVE THIS A-HOLE YOUR BUSINESS.
author: Natalie F.

description: Delicious pizza and authentic atmosphere. Everything looks great on the menu. Will definitely be back to try salad and pasta. I recommend the Victor combo. You will not leave any leftovers. Thank you!
author: Jason H.

description:
Ive eaten here on multiple occasions- each time i was extremely pleased with the food and the service. Everyone is super friendly and the food comes out  quickly. The pizza reminds me of a good ole comfort food. 

I love it here so much that one time my friends and i got pizza here AFTER our brunch down the street for dessert. 

Best pizza & great value!
author: Genica R.

description:
Great, quick service with tasty authentic pizza. I get pizza to go and it's always perfect and ready fast.
Cashiers are knowledgable and polite.
A neighbors treat!
author: John W.

description: My new go-to delivery pizza!  Wish it hadn't taken me so long to try it.  Flavorful, non-greasy thin crust (but not too thin) yummy pizza.  Good sauce, good toppings, good cheese.  It had some basil and maybe oregano on it which made it really flavorful.  Crust was nice and crispy.  I don't like the big floppy slices that you can fold in half.  Delivery time was good.
author: Holly M.

description:
Honestly, I have no idea where this place is. But what I DO know, is that when other pizza places have a 60-90 min wait for delivery (Patzi's, I'm looking at you), this place is always about twice as fast.

I've always been on the fence about this place - maybe because our regular veggie pizza order is like garlic with a side of pizza and vegetables. BUT, I ordered a cheese pizza with jalepenos the other night and they got it spot-on. Definitely up for giving Victor's another shot soon.
author: Lisa R.

description: The pizzas are huge but the meats are very salty, it's very overpowering. Overall it was a good experience, not the best though. Customer service sucked as we walked in but the young waitress was really sweet. It pretty ridiculous that you have to pay for refills. I probably won't be going back.
author: Pearl V.

description:
Due to a mix up of our own fault, we sent 2 separate parties (I was the second wave) down Polk to Victor's for our pizza party. While the sum of 1 extra-large, 2 large, and 1 medium pizza was waaaaaaay too much food for the 5 of us, thankfully Victor's makes pretty good pizzas so feeling over-stuffed seemed worth it. 

We had the all-meat pizza - pepperoni, sausage, and ham. it's as good as an all meat pizza can be. After a while it starts to taste repetitive and believe me, with our double order, it really was meat overload. 

The surprise was the vegetarian pizza. [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GjdLppkFQODOiV4DQZ5EyA?select=TCB7B7R2DN_tGIMFlbV-aw] The combination was great and the flavors of the different ingredients worked well with each other. The mushrooms and olives gave it a nice earthy and meaty flavor while the bell peppers, onions, tomato livened it up. Simply delish. 

If you're in the area and want to grab a pizza, Victor's is a safe bet. They also sell by the slice which is useful if all you need is a snack after a night of drinking. Just make sure you don't double-order like we did.
author: Jon L.

description: Using my very first Yelp review on Victors because it is the best pizza in SF!  And the best ranch ever!!  Yum yum yum!  Delivery is also usually very fast.
author: Ashley M.

description: Not only does Victor's Pizza offer delicious Italian food, fresh baked homemade bread and a nice wine collection but their music is legit. Long live the 80s! I'm a fan! Can't wait to come back
author: Veronica S.

description:
My review is solely based on their to-go pizza by the slice. I have ordered a to-go slice two or three times and each time it has been an average slice.

Overall if walking by I'd stop in but I wouldn't go out of my way for it particularly with all of the pizza places on Geary and Polk within 6 blocks.
author: Brian D.

description: Just ate here and it was worth it. Not too expensive good pizza, garlic bread with cheese was flavorful and fresh. The chicken wing hot and not too breaded. Quick polite service. Clean place throughout. Great place for something simple but good. Worth coming back to.
author: Alexander S.

description:
Bomb.com!!! My pizza arrived at midnight and it was amazing! Store fresh soft dough fresh vegetables so
Good!!! I'm from
Out of town and this place happened to be open late and deliver! I'll now come back here whenever I'm in frisco
author: Marni B.

description:
This place deserves 4 stars!

I am not a pizza eater, but the pizza they made is perfectly cooked! My boyfriend ordered a thin one with sausage and musrooms, it smells so good that I had to have at least one slide. 

Def. order again when the next time we stay close by.
author: Sammy C.

description: Walked in for an order and pickup of a small pizza. Was ready pretty quick (under 10 minutes) and the pizza was fine. It's a thinner crust, but not cracker thin. Okay, but wouldn't come here for a pizza craving.
author: Adamme K.

description:
"Hi! I'd like a pizza for Delivery"

"What kind?"

"Medium pizza with Olives & Onions"

This is a phone call order I've made to Victors Pizza about once a week for the past year and a half. I'm sure they all know my voice and have memorized my apartment address at this point. 

In my opinion, Victors Pizza is the best Pizza restaurant in San Francisco. I'm from New York. When I first entered Victor's hole in the wall Pizza joint, I felt like I was back home for a second. The familiar smells of fresh dough and tomato sauce. I like the little classic bell that rings when you enter and the small vintage feel of the space. I like that you can see them making the pizza from the restaurant front windows.  You can watch everyone working together in perfect beat to get the pizza's out. 

The pizza itself is phenomenal. Every time I order from them it arrives fast, hot, and perfectly cooked. You can visibly see the tufts of steam rising off the pizza when you open the box. The cheese and crust are never burnt. It's not greasy. (This is a BIG plus for me, I hate having to soak up pools of grease off the top of pizza slices with a napkin. This has never been the case with Victors.) The toppings are fresh. The sauce has a nice zesty herbal flavor. The bread is crisp. I even eat the crusts which I usually never do at other pizza places. These guys know what they're doing and they do it well.

 I read a complaint on yelp that they have an attitude, but that's not the case. They have never been rude to me. They're efficient and they are usually busy. What they're going to give you is an incredible fresh pizza with no hype attached. 

This is an EXCEPTIONAL pizza joint. A+ from me. You guys rock at what you do.
author: Daisy F.

description: Pizza was very bland, calamari was frozen, garlic bread was bland, the place looked a little grungy, overall pretty bad experience
author: Lucio M.

description:
Not sure how you mess up a cheese pizza, but Victor's does it every time. Regrettable pizza and terrible garlic bread.. would not recommend. Go to any of the other fantastic pizza places in the neighborhood for maybe a dollar more. 

The upside is that if you're drunk and you're on Polk Street, Victor's is right there.
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Went in the other day.  Nobody in the store. Pointed to the slice of cheese pizza I wanted.  Owner selected a different one, said he didn't like customers to select the slice they wanted.

Walked out.  Maybe owner ate the slice?  Who cares.  Won't be back.  

Go to Mustafios instead.
author: The P.

description: Pizza was pretty good, I just had a normal cheese pizza, nothing fancy. However I also ordered some mozzarella sticks and was disappointed that of the 6 sticks, 3 were empty of cheese! It was also quite expensive for my whole meal. But they did deliver quite quickly.
author: Sarah B.

description: For lunch I decided on spinach gnocchi with garlic sauce and minestrone soup. Service was prompt and friendly. I got a seat with a street view and enjoyed people watching for a while.  The minestrone soup was excellent, not too much pasta but lots of vegetables. Since this was my first time ever eating gnocchi I have no prior experience to compare it with and will go so far as to say that I really liked it.  I guess this will be the benchmark against which all future gnocchi dishes will be compared.
author: David S.

description: Excellent pizza! I never knew about this restaurant and I'm a native San Franciscan! Great old fashioned pizza with delicious sourdough crust. I just wish I lived closer.
author: Kaiki N.

description:
I have had take out and delivery.  The take out.. salad - id prefer if they put the dressing on the side. as by the time i got home i was wearing my dressing. yuk.

The order delivery - i ordered greek salad and got ceaser - they immediately replaced the salad at no extra charge. 

I love the food.  

The portions are perfect.

The salad they provide with the chicken parmesana is awesome.

The delivery guy is totally a hottie as well.  Ladies and gays pay attention!!!

I think this restaurant is old world for sure.. I find it much like a pizzeria you might find in greece or rome.  

Enjoy.
author: Gloria F.

description: Pizza with cheese only was very good with a delicious and crispy crust.  My son had pasta with pesto, which was also very nice.  It was very convenient to our hotel, and we got 10% off on yelp, which was great.
author: Raven N.

description:
I ordered a cheese pizza to pick up at a later time (for the super bowl).  It was perfectly timed so it was nice and hot when I picked it up.

The cashier was really nice and the pizza was good. The sauce is unique.. But good
author: Sabrina J.

description:
To me, Victor's pizza sauce is slightly bitter and tastes too much like dried herbs. But everything else about it is on point. Especially the sausage, which is the real deal and not that nasty rabbit turd looking stuff.

We've really come to love their chicken dishes. The Parmesan is huge and very good, and the Marsala is almost always outstanding. The Milanese isn't thin enough, but is nicely fried. Their wings are also nicely fried, but aren't sauced. Meals come with overcooked carrots and zucchini, mediocre pasta, and bread. You also get your choice of a generous side salad with meats and cheese (their ranch is perfection), or minestrone soup which I don't like on its own, but is fantastic when mixed with chicken broth.

I like their vegetarian lasagna (spinach, ricotta, and mozzarella) but not the overly tart sauce it comes with. The pasta with burro sauce is oily and flavorless. The meatballs aren't very good and the po' boys are awful. But seriously, the chicken dishes rock.

I appreciate how easy ordering is. They answer the phone and take orders quickly, and you don't have to recite your card number for them (the driver scans it). Our food usually arrives in around 30 minutes. If I'm just getting a slice, I'll go to Bellissimo. But when we want to do a regular meal (with pizza on the side, of course), it's Victor's.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Best pizza in the city along with Tony's (except you can get in here!).

Get a table, order a pizza and tip well. Life is good.
author: Janie L.

description: Great and reliable thin crust pizza. We heard from a friend that this was the place to order pizza for delivery, so we gave it a whirl. It was a cold and rainy night so we expected to wait a long time for our pie to arrive, but it arrived within the time frame they told us, still hot! We ordered a pesto pizza with roasted garlic and ate the entire thing. It was delicious. We ordered it for the second time a few weeks ago and it was just as good and SUPER fast delivery. Maybe it took them 20 minutes and again, it was still hot! Considering we are walking distance to more than one pizza place, and we have ordered here the past two times we were craving pizza, should speak for itself. PS. the Greek Salad is also delish.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Excellent service & great food. The environment is friendly, with red lighting creating a nice ambience. The food is fresh and seems to be handmade. Superb!
author: Eric V.

description:
I had the vegetarian lasagna, friends had the meat pizza and meat lasagna and we all loved our dishes. Both lasagnas were heated all the way thru which can be difficult for some restaurants to do.

We all shared the carrot cake, which could have been a little bigger of a slice but nontheless very good which they make themselves. 

We sat in the dining room straight in the back which had a wonderful atmosphere, other dining room looked a little to bright for my taste.

Server graciously added the 10% Yelp discount. I would definitely eat here again.
author: James C.

description:
I would normally give such an establishment 2 stars, but for being open at 10:30 on a Friday night, I gave an extra star for the convenience factor. By phone, I put in an order for chicken marsala. I wanted it just with linguine pasta, but it comes as a set meal with pasta and meat sauce, a side of vegetables, and a choice of soup or salad. I opted for the minestrone soup. The guy on the phone was a bit difficult to understand, but I did understand that it would be 15 minutes.

We arrived at the restaurant 15 minutes later, but still had to wait another 10 minutes for the food to come out. It ended up being $15.15 for so-so food. The chicken marsala was pretty good. The mushrooms were thick cut and yummy, the marsala wine was good enough to sop up with the complimentary bread rolls, but the chicken cutlets were a bit overcooked. The side of vegetables were WAY overcooked to the point of mush that a baby could have eaten. The pasta was decently good, actually. The noodles were actually al dente and the meat sauce had some good flavor to it. I didn't try the minestrone on account of being too full, but it looked like a basic tomato based soup with some mushy noodles.
author: Leslie H.

description: We were going to go to another restaurant, but this one was 4 stars. So, why not, one of the best pizzas I have had in awhile plus 10 percent off. Will come back.
author: Michael P.

description:
Finally; amidst all the horrible polk gulch and twitterloin pizza, a place that makes delicious NY style. 

I walk past all the time and figured it was just like the rest of these terrible take out/drunk pizza places. I happened to look in the window this week and actually stopped to look at their pizza. The appearance was enough for me to buy a slice. Granted it was early in the afternoon and the slice wasn't heated up enough, nor was it fresh, but i could tell their pizza had promise. 

I ordered a large with pepperoni yesterday and took it home. It was extremely good. The sauce was excellent. The crust was worth finishing. I could have easily finished the entire pizza. 

Finally! I found my pizza delivery spot.
author: Ernest O.

description:
I ordered a small pepperoni and mushroom pizza. The crust is so good and the cheese is nice and gooey! Everything tasted fresh. Their pizza is FTW! I'll definitely be going more often especially since I work only 2 blocks away! I definitely wanna try their pastas too!

I went at 12noon and it was not crowded at all. Service was decent.
author: Jean T.

description: Best delivered pizza I've ever had. They're open super late, delivery is quick, pizza comes still hot fresh out of the oven and they give you your side of ranch in a coffee CUP. It's a drunk persons dream come true -- tastes just as good sober too!
author: Lizzy U.

description: We got pizza from here after we had some drinks at a local bar.  The staff was very friendly and our pizza was ready in no time.  We got it to go so we could eat it back at the apartment we were staying in.  We just did the classic cheese and pepperoni.  It was good but nothing amazing.  I would totally eat here again though. It was a tad on the greasy side but very good.
author: Leala E.

description:
Absolute best pizza this side of Twin Peaks. Fast and sizzling hot from the oven, Victor's Pizza is my forever favorite sit-down or take-home Italian food spot. The restaurant is well lit, reasonably quiet and the entire staff is professional, happy and nice. As you select a table, ice water and menus follow you to your table. As soon as you place your menu down, an attentive server staff is ready to take your order. Drinks are served within moments with the best pizza to follow in less than 15 minutes. Their oven must be a blast furnace 'cause the pizza is hot and so quick.  The toppings are fresh with flavor.  Sausage and pepperoni seasoned perfectly. The cheese is real and the tomato sauce is awesome.  Forget the others, try Victor's and you'll be a fan for life. 

Nice people! Great food! And a San Francisco treasure......
author: Jim W.

description: So I was in town for the weekend and looking for some quick delivery, this place looked decent. 3 stars? Well first, when I called to order the two men that talked to me were rude. Second, when you order delivery forks and knives should be given, there were no forks, knives and napkins in the bag...I mean how am I supposed to eat the food? I'm at a hotel, which they knew, I mean really? I don't the the 40$ was worth it. Food was alright.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Saw some people eating a slice outside a store I was exiting. I asked them if it was good and where they got it. They said it was very good and just across the street, so I decided to pop over. I am so glad I did! It is  sooo delicious! Great sauce, great crust, great quality toppings, fast, nice yet practical people. Look forward to eating here again!
author: Jessica R.

description: This place is awesome! Authentic pizza, great atmosphere. I wish I lived closer so I could have it more often. Tired of the same old pizza chains. This pizza is definitely worth making a trip all the way from Sacramento for. Love it
author: Don F.

description:
I have gone to this place on many occasions, I have ate here and ordered delivery for the first time yesterday. Normally if you stop by and wanna grab a quick slice of pizza  and not sit in the restaurant this is a great place. However if you trying to sit, this is not the place. The customer service is rude and the rudest person is the owner himself. We ordered a couple boxes of wings and some pizza the wings were MEATLESS it was crazy it had almost had looked liked he had deliberately taken the chicken out himself. 

We called back in to ask about the chicken wings and offered 4 dollars off our next purchase, after we just spent 50 dollars on a horrible order after waiting an 1 for being down the street. He disagrees and hangs up the phone and says I DONT CARE. 

Well MR. Owner I do care and I am offended. As part of the Persian community, you truly are a Persian HATER, crazy since i know your persian. HATER
author: Dara S.

description:
Go to delivery pizza
Quick and easy - guys that work there are super nice.
Thin crust w/pepperoni, mushroom and black olive is the BEST
author: Tanvi A.

description: My wife and I really wanted some good Italian food and searched around near our hotel for about 20 minutes before finding Victor's. The food was fresh and great quality and taste. The service was very good also. Highly recommend the pizza!
author: Justin B.

description: I am a Chicagoan, so I am pretty picky about my pizza. Normally when I am out of town I don't even bother getting pizza. However, I was pleasantly surprised by this pizza place. The ingredients were fresh, and the crust and sauce were both great. I had a slice of the jalapeño and feta, which was super tasty.
author: M W.

description:
Seriously, GOOD pizza. 

I've only had the Victor's Special, it's about $20 for a medium with 8 slices and OH, SO GOOD. Wonderfully flavorful toppings. 

Open till midnight on weekends. 

Slices available to go. 

Down the street from Bob's donuts. 

Great sober-up food. Just sayin'.
author: Kiki I.

description: Beware of you order from a hotel they charged us 7 dollars for delivery in a 13 dollar pizza. That's not including tip. They were also kinda rude on the phone.
author: Greg M.

description: The sauce on the pizza, the sauce on the pasta, the sauce, the sauce, the sauce! Sometimes I grab a slice of za at the counter...sometimes I sit down in the back dining area and get the bolognese (sit in the quaint back area - not the space near the front windows)...ALL THE TIME, each and every time, I'm content and happy...I think this place beats so many other snobby over-priced Italian joints.
author: Adam S.

description:
Wifey and I were in the area, to try Bob's donuts.  But, we decided we needed something savory before indulging in dessert.  So, we happened upon Victor's pizza and decided to try a slice.

We're both purists when it comes to pizza.  No, that doesn't mean we only like Neopolitan pizza, or only New York style, or only Chicago style.  It means that we really only care for the simple cheese pizza.  Wait, that doesn't mean we're purists, it means we're child-like?  Okay then, call us child-like!

The slice was good.  The crust was flavorful and crisp.  The cheese was delicious.  I just wish it was a little saucier for the amount of crust.

So, yeah, the sauce to crust ratio was a bit off, but still a good slice!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Having a movie + pizza night? This is your best 'za takeout place for the occasion! We always order from here. Just cheese (yes, fine, call us boring- but it's delicious). Fairly priced, extremely fast, and really good! Whether we order delivery or get our fannies off the couch and pick it up ourselves, it is always fresh and piping hot. Honestly, I have no desire to venture elsewhere- this is my go-to spot!
author: Caroline R.

description: THE BEST PIZZA IN SF!...great ambiance too, has that old school Italian pizzera vibe
author: Erin A.

description:
I just moved in down the street and can I just say, I'm SO happy Victor's is in my neighborhood. I got a small mushroom and sausage pizza delivered (def big enough for 2, by the way -- finished this over the course of 2 days), and it arrived in 10 minutes flat!!!!!!!

Like others before me have mentioned, it may not be the BEST pizza in the world, but it's seriously satisfying! Generous toppings, and plenty of sauce and gooey thick cheese. I want to try their pastas and calzones in the future. So far I'm in love!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I can't believe I ever gave Victor's less than 5 stars. Frankly, their pizza is my gold-standard...what I compare everything else to and what I keep coming back to time and time again.

Here's the pie we ordered yesterday with extra sauce, feta, sausage and pepperoni:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GjdLppkFQODOiV4DQZ5EyA?select=YjsEFcrkAwhT5wrFU2uqvA

Look at that crust! It's just perfect. So nice and crunchy around the edges and even though it's thin it really holds up to the toppings. As I mentioned in my original review, they use the same dough to make their rolls (aka "breads"):

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GjdLppkFQODOiV4DQZ5EyA?select=9ikhQHIIF1sHG4LIVqvdSw

The spaghetti bolognese is my other regular order:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GjdLppkFQODOiV4DQZ5EyA?select=wgd2VNvV4eb_GQO7bflBjg

Amazing sauce. You will NOT mistake this for jarred. It tastes like it's been simmering for hours and is loaded with meat.

Here's a tip for you: When you call in your delivery, request an order of meatballs or Italian sausage ON THE SIDE and a few extra breads. You'll end up with at least a cup's worth of additional sauce for dunking the bread into, plus the sausage or meatballs for a sandwich the next day.
author: Valeria R.

description: This pizza is TheBomb.com!  Open late on the weekends too, which is nice.  I've been on the hunt for some solid New York style pizza, and have discovered that with Victor's.  For $4, you get a slice so big that you have to fold it in half to eat it.  The crust has flavor, they use the perfect amount of sauce and cheese, and the staff here is really friendly.
author: Zach S.

description: Delicious pizza! Fast and friendly service. Will definitely be coming back here when I visit SF again!
author: Rodimus P.

description: Best late night pizza in SF, hands down. They close around 1AM, depending on how busy they are. Call on the way home. Ask for a cup of ranch. Garlic bread is totally worth it. All the pizzas are incredible.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Alright! Some decent pizza delivery in this bitch-ass city. Was so tired of thick and bready pizza like Milans. Victor's has the perfect thickness, about a quarter inch. Even a simple cheese pizza will do. I went half cheese and half mushroom, pepperoni, peppers, and jalepenos. 

Had to dock a star for extra expensive toppings and the pizza wasn't smoldering hot like it should be. Besides that, I'm a big fan.
author: Grayson K.

description: The food here is authentic and incredibly delicious! We got the tortellini with the butter sauce and the primavera as well. It was better than I could have ever anticipated! I recommend this place to all of my friends. And, the prices are reasonable as well!
author: Jadeen Y.

description: After coming back to the hotel from the J-pop festival in SF, it was late and most of the places to eat at the mall in Japantown were closed so our group decided to order pizza. We Yelped this place since we wanted it delivered and I can't stand cheap pizza like Domino's or Pizza Butt. The guy who took our order could use a few lessons in customer relations but I wasn't looking to make friends, I just wanted a good pizza. He said it would be an hour which was a bummer but what can you do? Fortunately, there was a knock on the door after only 35 minutes so that was cool. Our pizza was a very good size and made with quality ingredients. The way they cut it was amusing because the size of the slices varied like crazy. Maybe it's done on purpose so dads can have jumbo slices and little kids can have more reasonably sized slices to eat.? Anyway, it's a very good pie and I can recommend these guys for pizza delivery without any reservation.
author: Steve O.

description:
Got a slice to go with a side salad. I picked some toppings which were added to a pre-made slice of cheese pizza and stuck back in the oven to heat up. All my toppings fell off the slice. There was not much flavor to it.

Maybe the dine is pizza is better but the to go slice was really lacking.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Solid pizza place. I usually get mushrooms and garlic, which is delicious, but most recently I got mushrooms, garlic, basil, tomato and pesto and it was amazing.
author: Amy S.

description: The cheesy garlic bread is off the hook. Be sure to order the minestrone and dip the cheesy garlic bread in the broth. We have been coming here for 10 years and it's our favorite hole in the wall spot. The staff are wonderful, the food is hella good and who doesn't like Econo wine.  Probably a lot of people but I'm low maintenance.
author: Seliena C.

description:
Probably the best pizza I've had in CA so far and I'm from NY. 

Specialty slice was stacked with toppings!
author: Mike E.

description: Best pizza in nob hill/tendernob area. Delivery is always accurate and exceptionally fast. I live in a gated building and the delivery guy will bring my order directly to my door. Pizza is always fresh and hot!!! I've had this pizza twice in one week before!
author: Alan T.

description: Very good pizza. The crust was delicious and I'm not a fan of crust simply because most crusts are average. I usually won't even eat the edge of the crust but I did in this case. I ordered the cheese pizza and it was perfect. Nice texture with the sauce and the cheese. And it was cooked long enough that the cheese started crusting! Perfect! Eat here! It's good!
author: Monica M.

description:
Victor's Pizza is another one of those restaurants which I frequent often because it is a short distance from my workplace, and they open late.  On a night like tonight when I actually got out of work early (10:30 pm instead of 11) it made perfect sense for me to go to Victor's for my late night supper.  You know how it is; sometimes going home and cooking dinner at midnight seems like such a big hassle.

I often order pasta at Victor's because their menu allows you to match your favorite pasta with your favorite sauce, but I went a different route tonight as I decided to try their meat lasagna instead.  Soup or salad comes with the pastas and fresh baked miniature loaves of bread.  I chose the minestrone because it has been brutally cold outside lately.

The big bowl of tomato-based soup was hot and hearty with big chunks of potatoes, carrots, celery and strips of soft pasta. Plain and simple their "homemade" bread is made with the same dough used on their pizza crusts.  If you like the pizza crust at Victor's you'll like the bread.  I happen to love Victor's pizza.  Like miniature loaves of French bread there is a nice outer crust with warm, soft, chewy but yet still airy bread on the inside.  It's perfect with the softened cube of butter that accompanies it.

The lasagna was one of the best I've had in a very long time.  A meat lover's delight is what it really is with lots of ground meat mixture sandwiched in between soft layers of pasta then covered with a thick layer of mozzarella that stretches forever, and finally smothered with a chunky tomato and meat pasta sauce with whole bay leaves mixed in.  The lasagna is fantastic.  The lasagna is delicious.

I didn't have any on this visit, but I've always enjoyed the pizza with its tasty, chewy crust, thick cheese and fresh ingredients that you can view at the front window or from the front counter.  It's perfect with an ice cold bottle of Peroni or just your favorite soft drink.  The wait service is excellent and friendly as well.

Take your food to go or eat in.  There are two different dining areas.  A darkly lit room has booth seating throughout while a brighter room has tables and chair seating.  I can't explain it though; I enjoy sitting on the dark side.  Maybe it's just different or maybe it's just fun to hold your lit cell phone up to your food just to see what you are eating.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I live a block and just ordered a large pep...it was so good. Delivery was supposed to be in 30, but it was there in 10.  $24 delivered to door for large pep and totally worth it.  I will never order from the chains again.
author: Kyle B.

description: Cozy neighborhood joint suggested by our hotel front desk. They do a brisk take out and pizza delivery business. We had great service and the food was okay too. The pizzas come in several pre determined varieties and you can also choose to build your own. The crust is properly crispy and chewy, the mozzarella stringy, and the toppings plentiful. I also ordered pasta with marinara and meatballs and it was okay...nothing special.
author: Bernice H.

description: First time in San Francisco but I felt like I was in NY!  Great food and fast.  We had the Minestrone Soup, Tortellini, Cannelloni and the Chicken Parm...all fantastic!  Homemade food at a good price.
author: Pat W.

description:
Basing this review off the pizza alone. Ordered takeout a few weeks back and was very impressed. Simple, no-frills, no B.S. authentic East Coast pizza in SF.

I thought Il Cesaro in North Beach was going to be the closest I got to NY/NJ pizza in SF...until I got a pie from Victor's.

Victor's plain pie (I refuse to say "cheese pizza") brings me right back to NJ. Good cheese to sauce ratio, just the right amount of sweetness in the sauce, and most importantly, a great dough consistency. Crispy on the outside; chewy and soft on the inside. 

If you're a transplant like me, a pie from here will remind you of home. 

The greek salad we ordered was also solid. Again, no gourmet bells and whistles but fresh ingredients and good dressing. I'll have to dine in one of these days and try their entrees.
author: Steve B.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in SF. My 5 year old son's agrees too, and he's a total pizza snob. It's mostly the crust that gets credit- it has the perfect give when you bit into it. I also like the simple old-school decor, the open kitchen and friendly no-nonsense service. And, relatively cheap beers from their lone Stella Artois keg sure hit the spot.
author: Andrew S.

description:
So I went here to get a slice of pizza. The guy working the register was a big jerk. I asked for a slice for here and asked for a water cup. He never told me that slices cannot be eaten inside the restaurant (which only had one table filled) Regardless I'm a paying customer and should be allowed to eat in the establishment. 
I pointed to empty tables and said it really only takes a few minutes to eat a slice, he then aggressively points at a sign on the table that says slices are to go only. I've never been to a pizza joint that forces you to eat on the sidewalk, especially when the place was empty! I then asked if I can have a box and he very rudely said no! you can have a bag! Well I drive a scooter, I need a box so it doesn't slide all over underneath my seat.

My advice if they are going to strictly enforce this dumb rule that slices are to go only, is verbally tell your paying customers this is the policy. I left feeling disrespected and second class. When I was in line I even saw a pizza pop out of the oven and asked him how much would a slice of that pizza be and he said "those are for customers" very cold. Like I could visually see a difference if this particular pizza is for slices or a party that ordered. Hopefully this place has enough paying customers but I wont be one of them.

He really was clueless on how to treat someone who's giving you money! Looking at the yelp map Escape from New York is close by too, I'd take a stoned out 20 year old serving me than a rude old man.
author: Lance S.

description: Tried the XL Veggie Combo and XL Cheese pizzas. Both are definitely large in size (as a whole and per slice), but despite being super hungry at the time, I only thought the pizzas were so-so. The crust is too thin for my taste, but the toppings were tasty, especially the tomatoes. I didn't care much for the cheese pizza, not cheesy enough for me. From what I recall, the Veggie Combo consisted of: onion, green bell pepper, mushroom, tomato, and olive. The regular Combo had sausage, pepperoni, onion, and olive. However, don't quote me on that, I could be missing something. The pizzas are not soaking with oil, and the crust is not burnt, but I would prefer a bit more thickness to my pizzas, especially if the slices are so huge - otherwise, they just flop when you try to lift one up to eat.
author: Christina L.

description: The people who run this place and very friendly- I've always gotten great costumer service. Their gnocchi pesto is my favorite and they're the best place to order pizza from. I love the redhead Italian waitress, she's beautiful and knowledgable about the menu/suggestions.
author: Argishti P.

description: SF native here. This is our go to pizza joint for the last 30 years. Don't tell anyone.
author: Steven M.

description:
What I Ate
- All Meat Special (pepperoni, salami, Italian sausage, and ham)

Would I Go Again?
Yes.  Victor's offers very solid thin-crust pizza.  The meats were all very juicy, especially the Italian sausage, and the pizza was topped with a spice that gave it an extra "kick."  The pizza was a little greasy, but I wouldn't say it detracted from the taste or my overall pizza-eating experience.  Victor's will definitely be added to my SF pizza rotation.
author: Ben M.

description:
$3.25 for a decent slice of cheese pizza, heated up.

Oh NYC how I miss your fresh $1 slices!!!
author: L B.

description:
Incredible!!!  Best pizza in SF!  Pizza in 45 mins!!!

I prefer the sausage and mushroom ot pepperoni and mushroom.   Either way my favorite pizzas have mushroom mushroom mushroom. 

My wife prefers the garlic and pesto pizza.  We first ordered the pesto and garlic and it was WAY too garlicky.  So every time after we would order it again my wife would yell in my ear as I'm ordering "TELL THEM NOT TOO MUCH GARLIC!"  It happened enough times to where I was annoyed at her doing that, so the following orders I would just ask for pesto.

In doing so, the first plain pesto (no garlic) pizza was really good.  My wife said it was her favorite.  She doesn't know that I tricked her so shhh.

My only knock on this place is no online ordering.
author: Jeremy E.

description: Great traditional, cozy ambience, tangy dishes.
author: Raina M.

description: Our first time eating here. We ordered hot wings and Victors special pizza. It was DELICIOUS. WE WILL BE BACK
author: Kimberly C.

description: Pizza was so good. The marinara and pesto sauce perfection. The service was fantastic. Love it!
author: Rick W.

description: Had a great pizza - Victor's Favorite. Sausage, pepperoni, ham. Served fast. Came here to celebrate a birthday for lunch.
author: Alan K.

description:
My family and I make a point to eat here whenever we're in the area. We've even made trips to SF from Sacramento for the express purpose of eating at Victor's. No, really.

We have only eaten the pizza, but it's the best pizza we've ever had. A couple local joints make something similar, but no one does it like this place does. The crust is thin and crisp, the sauce is neither too bitter nor too sweet, and the toppings are always top notch. The customer service is always lovely; what I don't understand here is how some Yelpers claim this place is staffed by "rude people." The head waiter (who has served us each time we've visited) has been nothing but professional and polite with us each time, and he remembers us well. Maybe it's because we don't get slices "to go" and try eating them at a table when there are signs that explicitly tell you not to. We always eat in. Maybe that's different.

Anyway, although there's nothing too special about the atmosphere or what-have-you, the food and service here are exceptional. We'll always be back for more.
author: Nani K.

description: Great pizza, pure and simple. The crust was the bomb! I usually leave the crust, but this stuff was delicious. Staff was very friendly and attentive too. I have nothing but good things to say about Victor's.
author: Heath P.

description:
Excellent late night slice... was about to head to my car hungry and tired, but this place's sign caught my eye, I noticed the man making pies and slices in the window, and there I was - two to go. 
Great sauce, and the sausage was tasty, although could have been torn up a bit more haha - would definitely grab another sometime..
author: Sam A.

description:
Solid food and solid pizza. 

On one side of the restaurant, you have the dimly lit semi-intimate eating space close to the kitchen. On the other side, you have a more brightly lit setting for people you'd prefer to dine with and know less intimately. The service is the same on both sides.

Resist filling yourself up on breadsticks because you can fit more food into your tummy if you do. It's the same stuff that they use for the pizza- crusty on the outside and soft and lovely in the inside. Mmm mmm mm. Perfect for dipping in lasagna sauce.

The soup is great, salad is simple but fresh, and I haven't displeased with anything I've ever ordered.
author: Loli L.

description: I know it's called Victor's Pizza, but you really should be getting the pasta.  I lived in SF in the late 90's and ate here all the time.  Every time I'm in SF now (1 or 2x/year), this place is a must.  I still dream about their seafood pasta.  Yes, I can see how people might feel mistreated by the staff, but what's a little abuse if the food is really good?  Don't be such a softie.
author: Jolie C.V. H.

description:
Pizza was decent, but over topped, so not everything cooked right. I ordered the Victor's Special, which comes with a lot of stuff, but less of everything would have been more, in terms of quality. I also ordered meatballs. They were good, but quickly dissolved into the bolognese sauce they were served in, so it was kind of like a pint of very meaty bolognese. Also, I was served two Bay leaves. I'm from the school of thought that you shouldn't serve anything that isn't edible  and bay leaves are not edible. Eat one and report back. Lastly, the fish and chips were terrible. Now, I understand, when you order fish and chips from a pizza joint, you shouldn't expect the world, but these were extremely sub-par. I actually think the fish came in a box. Perhaps with a logo of a man in a bright yellow poncho. 

On the upside, delivery was prompt, everything was fresh and hot, and the driver did not attempt to knock on my door, as per my request. Many delivery places get all three of those points wrong. For service I give it four. For quality I give it  two. So I met in the middle and they get three.
author: Andrew R.

description:
The ONLY reason Victor's isn't getting 5 stars is because it's cash only :( At least for delivery. 

Besides that, the pizza is the BEST I have had in the city so far. They are more on the pricey side for pizza but well worth it. Great ratio of cheese to sauce :)

I love a good, basic cheese pizza and Victor's seems to make it taste even better! Using the best quality of ingredients, this pizza melts in your mouth and warms up  your belly.

I haven't had anything else in the restaurant besides the pizza but I can't wait to try more!

If you ever in a crunch for an easy and yummy dinner, order Victor's Pizza! You won't be disappointed!
author: Whitney S.

description: I love pizza. I could eat it every day. I've tried a lot of different places in the city and to me Victor's is the best. Their sauce and cheese are amazing. I think they put extra herbs in it or something. I always get pepperoni and pineapple. The chicken parm ain't bad either!
author: Amanda P.

description: Victor's Pizza is my favorite pizza in the hood.  There's nothing fancy about this place, but it's just consistently delicious.  I've eaten in one time only, but I'm really all about the delivery on those lazy nights.  Whenever I venture to try another place in search for good pizzas - I regret and ask myself why I didn't just order from here.  I usually get a Sausage/Mushroom/Olive Combo or a Victor's Special about one or two times a month.  I've always found them reliable.  The crust is thin, light, and airy.  Really good stuff :)
author: Alvin J.

description:
I like pizza and beer.........if you like pizza and beer go here.

My sister brought us here while visiting her in San Francisco. You have to walk through the kitchen to get to the toilets! 

This place is great value, my girlfriend said it was the nicest pizza she'd had in San Fran. The beer came in pitchers and they had a special on.

Go here if you like beer and pizza!
author: Gavin D.

description:
My wife and I both agree that this is the best slice of pie we've had in SF. The mark of a great pizza joint is how they handle a basic cheese slice because there's no fancy ingredient list to hide behind. The crust is primo: thin, crispy, and moist. The sauce is rich and robust and they layer it on nice and thin. The cheese was generously applied and when we asked for extra garlic, they really layered it on there. 

The place is a little dingy and, like many of my favorite pizza places back east, the staff is a little soup nazi-ish in the customer service department. They lose a star for that, which won't matter to anyone taking a pie to go. For taste, this is the go-to for two east coast pizza snobs.
author: Bradley M.

description:
Good, competent pizza, good ingredients, open late, delivers.

I was glad they were available when I stayed nearby but I wouldn't go very far out of my way to repeat the experience.  Head and shoulders over the chain stores but only good, not great.
author: xx x.

description: Great old school pizza!!! You can taste the difference! Not like the conveyer type pizzas. Love the real oven char.
author: Ken H.

description: Would want to try this place again before I give it a real rating. The service was friendly albeit a little slow. But the calzone was HUGE and fantastic. I'd definitely stop here again :)
author: Meagan E.

description: Tasty food, and rockin' 80's music. The pizza was very good, and the pasta is unbeatable. Nice environment, had friendly, attentive staff, and the price was just right!
author: Rohit R.

description: This pizza was AMAZING! They had a great check-in deal too. A little pricey but definitely worth the extra change.
author: Ashley P.

description: This place has pretty damn good gnocchi. It's super soft which is how I like it. Impressive for a local little pizza place
author: Kirk G.

description: Stopped in for lunch on a windy, Sunday, but not rainy yet. We had a order of spagetti with marinara saunce and I got the canneloni. Bread and butter was complimentary, and our entrees came with choices of bread or salad. We opted for the salads. First, the salads had a bit too much dressing and our entrees had a bit too much marinara sauce and the spaghetti's noodles tasted a bit "rubbery." I guess it wouldn't be that bad if we liked dipping our breads into the marinara sauce. We just prefered to have less sauce and more noodles...75% noodles, 25% sauce would have been great. Maybe, we should just try the pizza next time!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
- Great crust (crispy on the bottom and not too thick)
- Quick and great service
- Not too crowded (actually not crowded at all; made me second guess my decision to walk in, but glad I did!) 
- Portions are pretty generous
- Got the pizza with mushrooms and basil

Still not as great as my old NY pizza places, but it hits the spot...  I'll be back!
author: Victoria K.

description:
The worst service I have ever encountered anywhere!! I don't usually write reviews and  usually won't say anything unless I have something nice to say but the little guy behind the counter is so rude that I would never eat here again. 

My friend and I walked in and ordered a pepperoni and combination pizza. We waited about 5 mins which is fine because they had to REHEAT the cold cheese pizza that was displayed in the window (which was also fine). We went to the back to wait and a few mins later I got up to check on our pizzas. I asked the little guy if the slice on the counter was ours and he replied "yes" so I grabbed it and began to walk to the back...I then hear from him "HEY, leave the pizza HERE!!" I asked if I could just bring it to her because she wanted to put some cheese on her pizza and he wouldn't even let me step foot in the back room and kept repeating slices only for take out! If the place was packed then we could understand the "rule" but the place was pretty much empty. When I walked back to my friend she told me the other little guy with greasy hair wearing a green shirt (wannabe jersey shore douchelord) told her that we can't eat in the "restaurant" because we ONLY bought slices of pizza and dine in was only for people who ordered off the "Italian" menu. Ha, good one "Italian"...........I would say a packet of Korean ramen with Ikea meatballs are more Italian than this place. Anyway......

After we both got our pizzas and my friend finally put some cheese on her pizza. My pizza just so happen to fall face down on the floor in which the little guy said nothing...which is fine too. I took it as a sign of the gods telling me not to eat the crap coming from this place! So, we ended up at a very good place down the street that makes a great chicken/lamb shawarma wrap! Lesson learned! When you see an angry little man behind a counter, just WALK AWAY!! It's not worth it!!
author: Lena W.

description: Great pizza! Great service! I'm in the area weekly and this is a stop I always make!!!! Delicious every time! Even the chicken wings are great!
author: PJ H.

description:
The other day I was throwing around some numbers with my roommates and we found out that we spent about $7000 between the 3 of us over the last 5 years here. I always get the Victor's Favorite, with its delicious italian sasuage and pepperoni. There is a good portion of garlicky sauce each piece and they dont skimp on the toppings. 

The crust is thin, and doesnt reheat very well in the micro, but I just put it on a piece of foil and cook in under the broiler or in a toaster oven. I ate inside a few times, but I would say stick to delivery. The slices are a god send on Polk St drinking nights but I bring them to a dive bar and get a decent beer.

I would say its my fav pizza in SF, but I had to give it 4 stars because they have steadily increased the prices, and now that I live a bit further away I find the pizza is a little cold by the time it gets here. 

They have no POS system so even though I've been calling hundreds of times I feel like a new customer each time. If you live near by and like thin crust pizza, I can't think of a better place.
author: Sean H.

description:
We stopped by for dinner and had a Victor's Super Supreme pizza (mozzarella, beef, onion, green peppers, black olives, mushrooms, ham, sausage and pepperoni) and a Peroni (Italian beer) -- ahhh, pizza & beer hit the spot - tasty!  Nice service too.  

Medium Victor's Super Supreme pizza+2 beers+tip+tax = $31
author: Maile N.

description: We have been using Victors for our Poker night pizza for some time. Great pizza, great price, quick delivery. Don't bother going anywhere else.
author: Nick L.

description:
YOU KNOW it's great pizza when.....

it got you thinking about it two days later. YOU KNOW IT'S GOOD. 

Like OHEMMGEE, pizza was poppin'. We ordered a small, pepperoni, cheese, and mushrooms to go and within 10 minutes, just shove those slices down our faces. #no shame. Cheese was gooey and made a "cheese bridge" as I like to call it and it reminded me so much of my childhood days eating at Blondie's pizza in Downtown SF. Crust was divine. 

Only downside is the wait was 50 minutes but it was worth the wait, I say. 

Will I come again?


HELL EFFIN' YEAH.
author: Lily W.

description:
A few days ago, I would have given Victor's a four star review.  I had dinner there one recent night, and everything was fine.  I was alone (in town for business), and was seated promptly at a comfy table.   Drink and food orders were taken (and served) promptly.  Food was fine.  I had the chicken parmesan dinner.  Salad was tasty with fresh veggies.  An unexpected side of pasta was plunked on my table at one point.  (It was not mentioned on menu, at least not that I noticed.  Unfortunately, it was served with meat sauce.  I do not eat beef and so this side went untouched.)  The chicken itself was served with veggies instead of pasta (the standard at many places) and I was glad for this as it made the meal a bit lighter.  The veggies (zucchini and carrots) on first glance looked liked they might have been boiled to death; but, they had a surprising amount of life/crispness left to them.  The (non-meat) sauce that accompanied the chicken was rich and flavorful  I had no problems with my meal or the service.

The problem came a few days later when I checked my charge card activity on-line.  At Victor's, I left a 20% tip, which, last time I looked, was considered perfectly reasonable.  The good folks at Victor's, though, apparently, decided it was not enough.  My statement showed a final charge that reflected a nearly 30% tip.  If these people feel I did not leave a high enough tip, they are allowed to call me cheap.  They are allowed to spit in my food the next time I eat there (which, clearly, will be never).  They are not allowed, though, to steal from me, which, by helping themselves to a higher-than-I-left tip, is what they are doing.  If they actually altered the charge slip that I signed to make it appear I authorized this charge in this amount, they are committing fraud.

I was tempted to give two stars instead of one only because I did enjoy my food and the waiter who took my order/brought my food/etc. (and provided perfectly fine service in doing so) had disappeared by the time the bill arrived.  A second waiter (perhaps manager?) brought my bill and charge slip.  I assume he is responsible for helping himself to a dollar and change more than I intended to leave.   But, I cannot give two stars.  Accidents, I can forgive.  Intentional malfeasance, I cannot.
author: Ella P.

description: Nice little hole in the wall kind of place. Pizza was excellent and pasta pretty good. Portions were generous and service was excellent.
author: Daniel L.

description: The first time you try delivery pizza from a new place, it's always a crapshoot. While we were in town for Oracle OpenWorld, I decided to give Victor's a chance. Wow! Some of the best crust I've ever had, with so much garlic flavor we had vampires on the run for miles around. The vegetables were perfect, not too mushy and not too crunchy. The meat was likewise cooked to perfection, and the spices were perfectly balanced. "Balanced" in this case means loaded with garlic. Yum!
author: Pat R.

description:
I figure, If I'm still patronizing a place since the inception of Yelp, they're deserving of five stars in my book.

The true test has been consuming Victor's pizzas while sober over a period of time and continually returning to them.  I don't think I've ever dined at the restaurant; I've always hit them up for delivery.  I'll briefly seek cheaper options for pizza in the area, but fear that it won't measure up if I order from another establishment.

For what it is, it's great--the food is consistently good, delivery is quick.  Is it the greatest pizza ever?  Hell no.  It's just your standard pizza.  But it's solid comfort food that hits the spot.  I'm always left satisfied.  And that's all I really ask for.

Stick with the pizza here.  You'll be disappointed by the rest of the menu.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Let me just sum this place up for Yelp readers with attention deficit disorder:

-Awesome slices if you are out boozing on Polk St. or just want something quick

-Delivery is fast, usually arrives before the estimated time

-Great pizza, great pasta. Gnocchi with meat sauce is my go-to pasta.

There you go.
author: Nick F.

description: Best pizza in the neighborhood! I lived on Nob Hill for years without trying them, walking past and not giving a second look. Then for some reason one night, I ordered a pizza from them for delivery. It was amazing! My only regret is I didn't give them a chance sooner.
author: Mike R.

description: If you're getting pizza, I'll give them a four. I used to order their eggplant parm all the time, like 2 times a week for 9 years, but the last five times has been awful. Makes me sad that my go-to isn't as good as it used to be- for that I'd sadly give them a two now. Just had pizza again recently and still pretty solid. Delivery is fast, and prices are still pretty good. If you can find a meal you like comes with pasta, bread and salad or soup so it's a full meal. Wish they went back to their old chef in the kitchen. Haven't tried the meatball sandwich in a while but that was killer. Meatballs are still pretty great and don't taste like filler like many do.
author: Traci H.

description: Gave it another try a month later, went into the restaurant and ordered the cheese pizza.  Much better than our earlier order.  Crust was much thinner and suited us better.
author: Rebecca H.

description: A solid 4-star pizza for San Francisco (Die Hard NY Native and Pizza Fanatic Here.). I probably have a slice here once a week on average. Honestly I typically go for a cheese slice, (New Yorkers will oblige my simplistic not overloaded pizza taste) and am always satisfied. The owners and staff are friendly and fast with the order and the pizza is always fresh and consistent. The toppings are good too. I've had a couple of their dinner dishes and they're a good option for a last minute "I don't feel like cooking, let's just get some take out" meals. Wouldn't seek it out per se, but really happy that their in our nabe.
author: Niall D.

description:
FOOD: I really enjoyed the pizza. I haven't found too many pizza places in SF that I like so it was nice to find a good one on Polk Street.

SERVICE: The waitress went out of her way to find a phone charger for me, which was awesome. Service was good in general.

ATMOSPHERE: Nice, casual atmosphere. Definitely had the feel of a neighborhood institution, which isn't surprising since my Uber driver who grew up in the neighborhood recommended it.
author: Phil S.

description: Great service, great toppings, and great prices.  The only downside is the crust is only so so.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Goodbye Uncle Vitos (not great anyways)
I have gotten pizza to go three times, and it has been great everytime. I have been going back to back so, they already know what I want. The pizza is quite large for just one person, but I end up eating the whole thing. The place is on a pretty busy on the street of Polk, and they have pizza by the slice for sale also. 
So the pizza is firm, but not burnt it is also not dripping with greese, and the cheese is melted. My order is a small cheese with pesto, and pepperoni (picture in that section) 
Take the California line Cable Car to Polk you won't be sorry you came. 

Note: I never ate inside, but there is seating if you want to stay or try something else besides pizza.
author: Nathan M.

description:
After almost 2 years of searching and much trial and error, I finally found pizza that reminds me of pizza from back home in North Jersey and NYC. In my neighborhood, pizza was a way of life. Most kids had a birthday party at a pizzeria at least once. In 6th grade home ec, we learned how to make pizza bagels in school.  Sadly, even the well reviewed pizzas in SF I've had have been on par with school cafeteria pizza.  No longer is this the case.

The crust is cruncy, light and flaky all at once. The tomato sauce tastes homemade and flavorful. When ordering a pie, my only modification would be to request for lighter on the cheese, and a bit extra tomato sauce. Then throw on some fresh garlic and basil for a pretty good Margherita. For single slices they're already made so this probably won't fly.

Now...if only you could get 5 garlic knots for $1.50!!
author: Bern H.

description: Just got delivery, so eating the Victor's Favorite twice in three nights. From phone call to driver parking, 16 minutes. That's worthy of an extra star to my original in-dining 4.
author: Anthony T.

description: Best Pizza ever. The service is terrific and the quality is fabulous. I'm a huge pizza foodie and this is definitely one of the best cheap eats for the best flavor.
author: Carlos M.

description: Pretty tasty for a late night option. Mediocre service.
author: Dexter H.

description: Idk what is going on with Victor's lately. We've come here since 1999 and never had a problem with them but tonight they put us on a never-deliver list because (after 10 mins of ordering what takes them an hour to arrive) we had to cancel our delivery for another emergency. I spoke to the manager and told him we've been customers since 1999 and they even catered events of ours in the past so to take this drastic measure is absurd. He becomes abrasive and hangs up on me as I'm talking! I call back to tell him that he has bad customer service and we'll never go back to them and will let everyone we know to do the same. The food is OK, this is Long Island there's a better Italian place around every corner. (I recommend Little Joe's if you're deciding) Don't do this place any favors they do not care at all about customer service or retention. I mean the manager truly has a terrible attitude, I regret ever being such a dedicated customer and recommending them to friends. From now on I'll list the other dozen Italian options instead! They won't last long like this and truthfully we've noticed this place's decline for years. I guess now we know why.
author: Natsai T.

description: My go-to for delivery. Simply the best (non artisanal) pizza in the area, miles ahead of the average slice joint on geary or polk. I've tried many, I keep going back to Victor's.
author: Hunter P.

description:
LOVE this place!! I live pretty close to all of the Polk bars- this is my favorite place to stop by on the way home. Food is delicious, people are nice and price is great. 

If you're ever in the area and looking for a quick bite to eat, definitely check this spot out!
author: Elaina W.

description: Despite hailing from Chicago, I'm a sucker for thin crust. The sauce is also thin, which is perfect! Each time, we get sausage and basil. It is probably the best pizza I've had in a long time. When we order takeout, they never take longer than 15 minutes. This week for sure be our go-to pizza place in Polk Gulch.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Victors Special with pesto sauce. Seriously the best pizza combo. Nothing better! We called in our order at 7:36pm and they rang us at 8:01pm saying they were at our front gate to deliver. Whaaa?! And for that...drum roll...my first review since I opened this account in 2007! ;)
author: Janette R.

description:
What the hell?  Why do they have four stars?  

This place is one of the worst pizzas I've eaten.  I don't like pizzas but I know a good pizza when I eat it.  

This was the closest pizza place to my apartment at the time, but I would gladly walk several blocks over to Escape from NY pizza over this joint.
author: Erika C.

description: This is some good ny style. Pizza. Extra cheese pep. It's not pretty but it tastes good! The salad is good too. This is a solid drunk meal. They deliver too!
author: Ashley C.

description:
I can't add much to this convo, but this pizza is consistently good, we order it at work constantly, and we never get sick of it yet.  We love the salads too, and anything we've ordered.

Our favorite is the plain ole cheese pizza because their mix of spices make it grat. 

~Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description:
Victor's pizza is awesome! The crust is as amazingly delicious as everyone says!
We arrived late to our hotel and came across Victor's on Yelp while searching 'late night pizza delivery'. We were worried they wouldn't be happy to get a call only a few minutes before closing time, but they were very friendly and helpful and within a half hour it arrived right to our room.
We will definitely eat here again next time we're in town, or maybe even again on this trip!
author: Eric B.

description: Oh Victor. Why did you let Gala go? He was so friendly and accommodating to customers! I've been going to victors for 11 years, and I'm not sure I'll be going back. Tonight I came in on a rainy 45 degree night. The pizza was good, but the room was freezing! When I asked if the door could be closed, our waiter asked the owner who said, and I quote, "no." It's not a pleasure to eat while freezing. My partner accidentally spilled his Diet Coke. They charged him for it without asking if he'd like a replacement. So sad!
author: matthew d.

description: Fastest delivery ever! Pizza is good, but it's also hot and fresh. I can't speak to ordering by the slice or eating in the restaurant, but they get my order always right and super fast! I order every week, without fail!
author: Giuliana K.

description: The best delivery in town! Fast, hot and yummy! What more can anyone ask for, especially when you're hungry. The sauce is on the garlicky side and as someone who is garlic- sensitive, it doesn't bother me. I like the thin NY style pizza. Usually order plain but have ordered feta, meat special and veggie- all very good. Yay for Victors.
author: Tamz O.

description:
This is a solid joint for a slice of pizza or a pie.  The ingredients are fresh and piled onto dough that is baked with a hearty, medium-sized crust without too much sauce or grease.  

Service is fast and friendly.  The ambiance and decor is simple, clean and small, but the food and smells fill up the room.  Parking is tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: Got two pizza's from Victor's for book club night. One plain cheese and one cheese with garlic and mushrooms. The second one was delicious! Overall pizza was really cheesy and crust was soft. Only thing is the leftovers didn't reheat well the next day.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Good pizza...but I love their pasta with bolognese. It is not fancy, but it is delicious and reminds me of my mom's pasta.
author: J. L.

description:
So... here's how the "to-go" pizza works here. You order a slice of cheese pizza, add the toppings you want for 50¢ apiece, wait a couple of minutes for the dudes behind the counter to attach said toppings to said slice with two measly pieces of provolone glue, and leave the premises $4 poorer. Excuse me, but that's what I call CHEATING.

I realize that people who order by-the-slice pizza can be demanding. "Awwww man, you're out of pepperoni? That's ridiculous!" and "I'm a vegetarian. I cannot eat this sausage lover's slice because it goes against everything I believe" are not phrases I'd want to hear on a daily basis, either. But come on. Pizza is not like fro-yo. The toppings are supposed to come with it, and it's not supposed to be that expensive. Word.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
I am so happy that I live in such close proximity to Victor's Pizza. I called for a pick-up and the guy told me it would be ready in 15 minutes. I got there in 10 and it was already done (which was kind of a bummer, since I like my pizza steaming hot). I go back to my apartment and feast on my Victor's Favorite, completely satisfied with my decision not to have a salad.

Good things
- Not greasy: There weren't pools of oil on my pepperoni slices, which is always nice.
- Good crust: It has a nice crisp to it and isn't too chewy.

A large pizza will set you back over $25 after tax, which isn't great but still a better option than Pizza Hut (but probably not better than Costco because the Costco food court is just too wonderful).
author: Shira C.

description: Walked in . Was told to sit anywhere so I did. I waited 20 minutes before I walked out. No acknowledgement from any servers. Bummer.
author: Carmen R.

description:
Excellent eggplant, great meat sauce, great Italian dressing. And the thin crust pizza was covered in very delicious ingredients.
Highly recommended!
author: Mike C.

description:
Victor's is #1. Their pasta is homemade which is super impressive! I'm not talking about just their sauces....the actual noodles are made FRESH! You will never ever have a tastier fettucine alfredo anywhere else. 

And their pizzas...perfection. It's just absolutely the best pizza in San Francisco. My favorite thing is going to Victor's with my husband, ordering a fettucine alfredo and a medium pepperoni pizza, making an impressive dent in our feast, and then having our leftovers the next night. The breadstick that comes with the pasta is devoured and the salad is devoured (I love that they aren't stingy on the dressing!) I leave on a carbohydrate high, practically skipping up to Nob Hill in delight.
author: Matea H.

description: The best pizza I ever had In my life,chicken parmigiano and linguine seafood  is a die for
author: Vee Vee T.

description: Very average pizza. I had the clams and my bro the chef special. Crust is thick, the topping didn't test much and salt didn't really help...
author: Ferhat A.

description: Terrible customer service. They had a totally empty restaurant and would t let us sit and eat our to-go slices. Pizza was mediocre at best.
author: Ragen C.

description:
Great food, good prices and the best service. Service is excellent.
Victor's is our place when we want a good meal delivered or to eat out.
author: Rob R.

description: Great food! I got the Chicken Parm and enjoyed it. Also, the Minestrone was great on the cold day. Pretty good service also, waiter was quick and wasn't overpriced. Would eat there again
author: Justin M.

description: My neighborhood spot!  Obviously can't touch tony's but solid good pizza
author: Jay H.

description: Co worker and I have made it Pizza Sundays and have victors pizza delivered to work. And this place is by far my favorite!! Victors special is our fav and is amazing!! 5 stars!! Yum!!!
author: Danger D.

description: We ordered pizza and calzone with an extra side of Marinara sauce.  All EXCELLENT.  They said it would be 40 minutes to deliver, it was only 30.  The food was hot, delicious, fresh, and delivered right to our hotel room.  The portions are very generous, and we loved the crispy crust.  The marinara is homemade and is nice and garlicy.  Highly recommend Victor's for good genuine Italian.
author: Deborah D.

description: The service was not the best, but the food was amazing! I order a fettuccine with meat souce. I highly recommend the place because of the food and the price, but do not wait sympathy from the employees.
author: Emilane F.

description:
Victor's Pizza is tied for top pizza in SF with Uncle Vito's. The Victor's special pizza in really good. It's on the pricier side, but for really good pizza it's worth the additional expense.

I saw a previous review where they mentioned the staff not being too friendly, and I would have to agree. However, most other pizza places in the same league as Victor's are similar in staff unfriendliness, so I don't take away any stars because of this.
author: Andrew M.

description: Hands down the best pizza in the area. Get the victors special. Get a salad too, they serve it with warm pizza dough bread. Excellent with butter. Pasta/entrees are good. Not like my Sicilian Granma made but there's no one that can make sauce and pasta like Nonna, still this decent Italian food. Sandwiches are good too. I usually get the Italian combo with minestrone which tastes homemade. Overall good food for not too much money and speedy delivery.
author: Timoteo K.

description:
Very good pasta and sauces.  Service and cleanliness need some attention.  Our booth had a sour smell thought it was the plastic menus from being wiped down.  The odor cleared and came back towards the end of our meal.   

I noticed several  Asian males hanging out across from our booth and walking into the kitchen periodically.  It was a distraction to have a table of non customers socializing  and not aware they could actually improve the place by working on cleaning the smell or hanging out at one of the many bars on Polk.  The owner must be proud a posse has a place to loiter among paying customers.
author: John S.

description: Veal was awful, seemed almost pre-chewed. Had to send it back for chicken which wasn't much better.spaghetti and minestrone was flavorless. The whole place didn't seem very Italian. Service was pleasant but overcharged us when the bill came back. We were the only ones in the place during prime dinner time. Should have been our first clue.
author: Paxy D.

description: Delish pizza.  Only downside is owner could be more friendly. Prices a bit high for slices, but closest thing to NYC style pizza in the hood!
author: Lorri H.

description: It was ready rather quick which was obviously a plus. The location is in a fun area. A little pricey but I would still come back! Any pizza is better than dominos so I can't really complain.
author: Tasha O.

description:
When I sat down in the booth I realized this place smelled strongly of butt. I mentioned it to my boyfriend but he didn't notice so we placed our order. 

My side salad arrived with 3 pieces of lettuce, a gigantic chunk of carrot, 2 huge tomato slices and a what looked like a Krafts single halved. It was drowned in enough Ranch for like 8 people. 

My Boyfriend suggested we bail. But I stuck it out.

I sat there eating my rubbery spaghetti while my boyfriend finally noticed the butt smell. We both knew we wouldn't be back.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Am giving this place a 4 stars, only because some of the other customers who mentioned about the customer service have spoken truth. Some of the waiters can be  hard headed and a little errr not so friendly. 

But wait, the reason am writing this atleast one person should benefit from what I call the best, and the BEST, "Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich" I have ever had. This is their most awesome piece in their menu and a must try. However the pasta which accompanies it, is a let down.
