I have been to some real fine dining Italian restaurants in SF and ordered the same sandwich, just in a curious mode and not one place makes it as perfect as Victors. There is a meat option too, eggplant replaced by chicken I guess, but I would push you to try the eggplant version.

Enjoy,
Deepa
author: Deepa N.

description:
I am from Pittsburgh (where there is a large Italian population and fantastic pizza) but currently live in LA (where even decent pizza is impossible to find).  So when I come to San Francisco to visit my girlfriend, I am glad to know that there is a solid, east coast style pizza right in her neighborhood.

We ordered the clam bake pizza this evening.  It was delivered on time and was hot and delicious.  the cheese and crust had a great texture.  The sauce was a bit sweeter than I prefer, but still not too sweet for most.  The clams were loaded with flavor the garlic was incredible.  

Since I have been spoiled by my favorite spots in Pittsburgh, I deducted one star.  However, I will definitely be ordering from Victor's in the future!
author: Joseph Z.

description:
One more dissapointing SF pizza place to put on the list of shame. Its definitly OK pizza. but thats it. 

The sauce is borderline gross.
The crust doesnt deserve to be anywhere near a pizza.

If I had a choice between digiorno and Victor's, it would be digiorno every time.

But, its still perfectly edible if you really need a slice.
author: Nelson S.

description:
Victors Pizza is an old school Italian Pizzeria located right next to the Tenderloin. My posse and me found it by accident at 11 at night after an evening of lounge hoping through the Tendersnob. 

The pizza we ordered (with salami, mushrooms, and brie cheese) was well made and tasty. Although not at the level of a deep dish at ZACHARY'S or knock-off PAXTI'S, it could easily hold its own against any thin crust pizzeria in SF. 

One issue I have with Victor's is that THERE ARE NO REFILLS on sodas! This is a shame. Fountain soda's are cheap and the soda portions at Victor's are small.... So bring a bottle of water if you decide to eat here. lol 

Also, if you're lucky, you and your party might be witness to some of the infamous Tenderloin street entertainment the area is known for... LOL
author: Black K.

description:
This is as good as it gets. I'm proud to crown Victor's as the awesomest of pizza on Polk. With so much competition, that's a big deal. 

Their cheesy garlic bread is SO worth ordering. And their mini calzones are bigger than you think, totally big enough for one person! 

Lots of vegetarian options, very good service. 

Note: if you order pizza by the slice, you have to take it to go. Seating is only for dine-in.
author: Jessica B.

description: My friends and I stumble upon Victor's Pizzeria while vacationing in San Francisco. We ordered Victor's special, mini calzone, gnocchi. Loved the homemade gnocchi and cheesy pizzas. The staff was friendly and nice. I will definitely come back next time when I'm in town. Highly recommended in Nob hill.
author: Lu K.

description: Clam pizza was superb! Clams were juicy and has loads of cheese and the crust is fresh and crunchy. Best ranch sauce I ever had and it's homemade! Yummy!!! Highly recommended this place in Nob Hill.
author: C C.

description: I have been going to this place for years. When I'm in the area I stop by. Everything I order is amazing. I highly recommend! The rolls are pizza crust, Yum!!!
author: Scott W.

description:
Marginal Pizza at best, but more  importantly, the place is run by a bunch of creeps.  Granted, they are probably pretty jaded by the drunk crowd without the copious amounts of bars nearby, nonetheless, they treat their customers like dirt and do deserve repeat business.  Lucky for them, there will always be endless crowds of drunken masses who need a greasy slice of mediocre pizza.

Oh and $5 a slice is ridiculous even for San Francisco.  Stick with Orgasmica.
author: Turner B.

description: Service, food and ambiance were amazing. Teresa was our server and she was so great!  We stumbled upon this place and I am happy we did. Will definitely be back. Oh and btw their music is awesome.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Meh.  Stick with the pizza.  I've always enjoyed it, and for some reason, I was craving pasta and thought I'd give it a whirl when I was having my pie delivered.  It was gluey and bland.  We took a couple of bites and threw the rest away.
Four stars for the pizza, 1 star for the pasta, 3 stars for the delivery. . . carry the seven and 2/3. . . . eh, three stars.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Nice and herbally! If you from NYC you might like a nice change.  Finally pizza is getting better in San Fran.
author: Chastity C.

description: Victor's Pizza. Officially the #1 pizza provider for my apartment. Super good pizza and they don't skimp on the ranch when you order it on the side. They are also really great pizza slices to stumble upon while being out and about on Polk Street. The one star deduction comes from the one time it took over an hour to receive our pizza, it was still hot though so...not a huge problem.
author: Melinda S.

description: Great service, great people, and most of all great pizza! I am always welcomed when I go here and the pizza never disappoints. They also have good chicken wings! Go here before or after bar hopping on Polk! #perfect! ;)
author: Jezelle B.

description: The pizza was so so amazingly good. Lots of cheese. And DID NOT ask for extra cheese. The pasta was so good. Over following with flavour. Very happy and impressed.
author: Amy H.

description:
Best pizza in town!
My friends and I are visiting for a few days from New York. We pass by this awesome pizzeria.
Pizza are thin crust and ingredient are all fresh. We order the Clam Bake Special and it's so delicious. Seafood are ingredient that's hard to handle on pizza and they just cook it the perfect way.
We also have the rigatoni in bolognese sauces. Pasta are cooked al dente, just the way what perfect pasta should be cooked. The tomato and meat are at the right balance with each other. We can clearly taste the freshness.
Will definitely come back when I am in town next time and recommend it to my friends.
author: Madeleine L.

description:
Brad C
is nominating jalepeno sausage pizza for a grammy because that sounds awesome right now...
about an hour ago via BlackBerry    Like  

Erin M
yum!
about an hour ago  Like

Daniele R
hahahahaha
22 minutes ago  Like

Brad C
with a performance that was hot if a bit cheesy... i would like to thank victors and the kind people at visa.
17 minutes ago  Like
author: Brad C.

description:
Have you ever been browsing Yelp and noticed that a place you really like is getting a lower rating than it deserves, inspiring you to write a review for said place IMMEDIATELY?

While 3.5 is a very respectable rating for any restaurant Victor's deserves more, next to Za on Hyde Street this is my favorite Pizza in The City so far!

Don't let the "I used to live in New York" Pizza snobs sway you, Victor's turns out an excellent thin-crust pie.
author: Mike J.

description:
I love my pizza and I'm always happy to try new pizza places just to see if they're different from others that I love. Victor's managed to pull off both amazingly delicious New York style pizza at a price that was, quite frankly, amazing for the quality and size I got. 

I came in to treat myself to a pizza lunch while doing groceries in the area and since I wanted to actually sit down, I ordered a small pizza instead of a slice to go (from what I can tell, the slices are only to go and not for sit-down, but I suspect you could probably stay at a table if it's not busy... don't quote me on that though).  

Quick, attentive, delicious and well worth the price, I was *really* impressed with my pizza and ate half, taking the other half to go.  Even warmed up at home, the leftovers were amazing. I think I'd happily make Victor's my local go-to pizza place in the area.  A whole lotta lovin' for these guys!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
IF its raining and...
IF you just spent hours holiday shopping and...
IF you're starving and...
IF you're with your besties and...
IF you're in the 'hood than...

Victor's could be quite possibly the BEST pizza you've ever eaten.  

If not?  Well, then...its still pretty darn good...

Victor's special...yum.

Ambience...lacking...but who cares...its pizza!
author: Susan L.

description:
The pizza here was the WORST I think I have ever had.  Soggy, raw peppers and underbaked  veggies, raw garlic, it even smelled funny. Victors is  very tight with the cheese  and barely enough red sauce to taste.  I felt very ripped off and so will you if you go to Victors
I trashed what they called a pizza after one slice.
author: John W.

description: If you are looking for a place to order late night pizza or having friends over this is the place to call. Super fast delivery, reliable and good pizza. You won't get disappointed
author: Amir Z.

description: I ordered 2 slices of pizza here and they told me $7 and some change. I just looked at my credit card statement and they $10 on my credit card. I don't care if the average slice per pizza came out to $5. The fact they charge a different price when you leave is real shady.
author: Ray M.

description: Sometimes I stare at the clock waiting for them to open at 11am. Usually deliver within 20 minutes.  Best pizza!!
author: Ken J.

description: Ok, to be honest, I've never been inside of this restaurant...ever. But, I order the same three things with frequency. Cheese ravioli with bolognese, eggplant parmigian, and veggie pizza: extra cheese, spinach, mushroom, artichokes.  Everything, every time, is perfect. The most consistent pizza spot I've ordered from in SF. Its not the best in the world, with clever pizza names, and artisnal delicacies, but its damn good.
author: Z P.

description:
Three weekends in a row, my Sunday afternoon was two mushroom pizzas from Victor's. Amazing American Style Pizza, the prices were great given how delicious the pizzas were. 

I'll never order from North Beach again.

Delivery was ridiculously slow (over an hour for two small pizzas on a non rush night) but worth the wait. Don't look for authentic Italian thin crust here, but for comfort pizza with great ingredients, VIctor's wins.
author: Zach S.

description:
V is for Victor! $3 cheese pizza slice & $5 specialty pizza slice, who can complain? This was great, fresh pizza. Definitely one of the best pizzas I've had. I don't know where the yelpers that gave this place 2 stars go for their pizza, but I want their inside information. 

It's a good thing I live an ocean away otherwise I would eat this everyday for lunch and dinner...and maybe the leftovers for breakfast. This would be a great place to throw a low key and inexpensive birthday party. I don't recommend their other dishes.
author: Kara K.

description:
We order for lunch at leat once a month at work.
Ordering 10 pizza's at a time and they never disappoint!
Good stuff!
The pesto pizza is killer!
author: Michael S.

description:
This is a really good place to take someone on a nice quiet date. Service is really smooth and comfortable. The same group of guys have worked there for like twenty years. Everything on the menu is good.

Whatever you do, don't sit on the right side unless you are entertaining your parents. If you are on a date, sit on the left side. It is dark, romantic, and decorated very originally (a.k.a. not re-decorated since they opened during the gold rush days). For the life of me, I do not know why anyone wants to sit on the right side unless seeing their food is the most important thing about dining for them.

You have to go to see what I mean. It is like two different restaurants.

Very quiet and private. Reservations are not necessary.
author: Miles G.

description:
I'm a fan of stopping by Victor's to grab a slice, even with the slightly creepy employees and slightly creepy interior (to be fair, I've never eaten inside, but it just looks slightly creepy).

I love that you can choose toppings for (HUGE by my standard) individual slices and not have to wait very long - major points! I put it through my oil test of holding the slice vertically and letting the oil drip off. Soggy pizza, not my thing. But there was minimal oil drippage, passed with flying colors!

A slice of cheese and a slice of mushroom came out to $7.05, but let it be known that there's a $10 minimum for credit cards, unless you get lucky like me and they let you by with a "well, just this once..."
author: Kim B.

description: Bread was like sandy cardboard. Antipasto a disgrace to antipastos. Owner overly salesy and his daughter had a bad attitude and rude manners. Never again.
author: Alias A.

description: Not a bad place at all. Good pizza, good beer, attentive staff members, cheap menu, seems to be a good option to stop by once in a while. I recommend the chicken marsala, calzone and seafood pasta. I also wanna mentioned that the chicken marsala had a quite buttery sauce, which is not bad but it could not be appealing to just everyone. My friend tasted it and said it was too much while I absolutely love it
author: Ramon L.

description: I used to have lunch routinely here when I worked off VanNess.  I still come back once in a while for the lunch special.  $3.10 per slice of hot, fresh traditional pizza.  This place is good, the pizza is prepped in the morning and cooked to order.  They have a fast simple pleasure way of getting in and out.  The restaurant is a little dingy and old but for take out this place is fine.
author: Chris P.

description: We are staying at the Buchanan hotel and got a chicken pesto pizza as well as a Victors favorite. Holy moly they were delicious! The PERFECT middle ground between thick and thin pizza. Loaded with cheese! The pesto was lucrative and the meat on the favorite was flavorful and delicious! We did pick up and it was ready in the time it took me to drive .6 mile.
author: J P.

description:
The mini-calzone is approximately 6 lbs. of cheesy, pepperoni and peppers-ful goodness. It's basically a small pizza folded in half with a dallop of sauce on top. My friend ordered this monstrosity, let me sample a piece, ate a good portion, and he still had enough for a meal (or more!) to take home.

I, being incredibly unhealthy that night, ordered garlic cheese bread for us to share and a Peroni. The bread had mystery green stuff on it (parsley? oregano?) and large chunks of garlic under a bed of what tasted like monterey jack cheese. It was okay.

You have to walk through the kitchen to get to the restroom and it took all my self-control not to run through as though I was being chased by bad dudes in some hilarious '80s action movie. (That's just a bonus Victor's Pizza anecdote for y'all.)
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I came here a while back and keep forgetting to write a review for this lovely place.
We were craving pizza and were no where near my usual favorite places (Zachary's Pizza in the East Bay) & Little Star Pizza on Divis. so we decided to check this little gem out and were VERY satisfied with the simple thin crust cheese and mushroom pizza that we ordered.
this place is very reasonably priced and quick! We were in and out of there in no more than what seemed to be 45 minutes! 
Definitely a place I'd come back to visit. The Crust was perfectly toasted, not too crusty or dry and not too thick or doughy. The tomato sauce was great with just enough tangy-ness and flavor too! :)

The only complaint I had was that it was WAY too dark in the back room. the only lighting in that room was the red votive candles that are on each table. Other than that it was a delicious surprise to eat at Victor's
I'll FOR SURE be back again soon!!
author: Karen G.

description: Pizza happens to be my favorite comfort food and as a kid, I grew up in Brooklyn, NY and have eaten in some of the best pizzerias in the pizza capital of the world. I moved to Marin in my teens, and  I've tried literally dozens of pizza/Italian restaurants in the Bay Area over the past 20-plus years. Victor's Pizza is the BEST pizza I've ever tried! It's a very bold statement to make and I thought about it for a very long time. But why hesitate! It really is the best! Half of what makes a great pizza is the dough. Their dough is the perfect thickness, texture and flavor. It compliments their sauce, which is very tangy and delicious with just enough seasoning without overwhelming. Also, the ingredients they use, especially the cheese, is top quality and fresh! If you love pizza, you'll love Victor's Pizza! The reason I gave it 4-stars rather than 5 is because I felt their prices are slightly steeper than a pizza should be. An extra-large with two toppings on only half cost me over $30! I also had a slice to go since I had a 40-minute drive ahead of me. It cost $4.25. That still won't stop me, but rather than visit as often as once a week, it'll have to be one a month, or so.
author: Joseph R.

description: A good friend who is from the east coast brought me here.  Traditional solid nyc style pizza. I'm from there, I should know.  I'd recommend the pepperoni with mushroom, light on the cheese and well done. This is the way my friend ordered.  Comes out perfect. Good value as well.
author: Michael A.

description: best late night pizza spot in SF. don't forget to order a side (cup) of ranch!
author: Lauren C.

description: Average pizza from an east coast perspective, with crappy hospitality from the owners. They make you eat on the sidewalk even though the place is completely empty. Unless you order an entire pie. Not the kind of a-holes i want to support.
author: H K.

description:
I was hoping this place would live up to Yelpers' claims that this could be a good NYC style za joint. 

Alas. The only similarity would be its thin crust. 

The limp little slice, smaller than your average NYC slice, fails the proper foldability proportions. The weak tomato sauce is a salty, processed tasting disappointment. Cheese- sob- I can't go on. So disappointed. 

For the record, we first ordered a slice and then decided to order a fresh pie and see if that made a difference. Nope. No dice, says this New York za snob.
author: Kim K.

description: While staying at the Holiday Inn, there are a gazillion choices of places to eat in a two block radius. How does one choose? 4-star rating, that's how. It's a well deserved rating. Walking in the aroma of Italy will embrace you. The atmosphere is simple, no frills. Everyone greeted us walking in. They have a small dining room, but has room for a large group if they're not busy. The front was very busy with pizza orders the whole time we were there. It must be good. I saw single guys, families, business people in suits. The server showed up in a couple minutes, checked on us throughout.  I appreciate the short menu: pizza, of course, a list of pastas and sauce choices, a section of entrées and house specials. There are several salad options and a short list of starters. They offer a handful of beers and wines. The table starts with fresh bread and butter. Water is served ice cold. Only one free refill. I appreciate this. We're in a drought and it shouldn't be wasted. We started with the garlic bread with cheese. So full of garlicky goodness on fresh bread. I ordered Spinach Gnocchi in garlic sauce. It is AMAZING  (if you truly enjoy garlic). Meals come with your choice of soup or salad and are roughly $15 per plate. I had minestrone. I don't usually care for minestrone but I have to say this is the only minestrone I've ever liked. Licked that bowl. We also ordered the chicken parmigiano. Before the meal, a starter of spaghetti arrived. The chicken was piping hot. The sauce is full of flavor. Dipped the bread in the sauce. Licked the plate. Two thumbs up.
author: Renee F.

description:
I like Victor's Pizza because the slices are small and thin, like me so I can eat 6 slices in one sitting.  

Correction:  I WAS small and thin.  *Burp!*
author: Amy C.

description:
this review is well over due..but I think its important to WARN as many people as possible.....

Let me walk you through what will go down as the absolute worst meal I have EVER had. Lets start with the bread that was clearly anything but fresh.  The wine (and it wasn't cheap) that tasted like watered down 2 buck chuck.  The Chicken parm that tasted absolutely HORRIBLE and I being a very novice cook could have done a better job blind folded.  The Gnocchi that the waiter (who was obviously unhappy to being serving there) said was there best dish since it was homemade...oh my god talk about mush city...

Worst of all the prices are ridiculous for how thrown together it is.  Don't I repeat DON"T eat there...run far far away.
author: shannon h.

description:
First off, delivery was amazingly fast.  I made the call at 9:13 PM and the delivery guy was at my door at 9:26 PM.  Granted, it was a Tuesday and it was later in the evening and it was a simple medium pizza order.  But, that's the fastest I've gotten a pizza in all my pizza ordering years.

The pizza was pretty good.  The thin crust was cooked just right and not at all soggy.  The toppings were fresh and tasty.  It was on par with a few of the other established pizza places I've tried in San Francisco.  I might have liked it more had I not had Little Star, four days earlier.  Now, that's some good pizza.
author: Grant W.

description:
They make really good thin crust pizzas. 

If you are in a hurry, this is the place to pick up a slice. A slice of cheese pizza goes for $3. Decent size. $0.50 per additional topping. Toppings were just placed on the already made cheese pizzas. So I wasn't thrilled with that. I like to have my toppings baked in with the rest of the pizza. Crust was crunchy and good. I'll probably stick with the regular cheese pizza next time. 

The place is a little dated and scary dark. I probably won't want to dine in there. 

Tip: Just pick up a slice and go!
author: Molly T.

description: I am 100 % Italian and i have been going to Victor's for years , they make the sauce and most everything here by hand the old way. I like to keep it simple and just get one topping my favorite is the sausage but whatever you get this is the real old school true Italian pizza place. Victors has been in business since the 50's. I used to live in San Francisco and all the Italians i new always went to Victors. Everytime im in San Francisco i get a few to take home. Best pizza around.
author: Bob T.

description: Had an all meat pizza and the flavor was amazing! Highly recommend. Waitress was very nice and the wait for food wasn't too bad.
author: Sheena M.

description:
This place was recommended to me by some locals when I visited last year for my birthday. Good choice. The food here was excellent. We got a pizza and it was damn near perfection...very tasty. The garlic bread had heavy emphasis on the garlic. I liked it...but it's not for the faint of heart. Huge chunks of garlic all over it. The food in general is amazing. 

I give it 4 stars because the service was really slow and they weren't very busy. There was also a mistake and my credit card was double-charged. I called them and got the matter resolved..accidents happen. Give them a try.
author: Kristin M.

description:
Wow. After reviewing the menu for 20 minutes, yes, we decided on splitting the meatball sandwich and the meat lasagna.  Yeah, that's right -- we did not even try the pizza.  Now I can NOT wait to try their pizza.

The meatball sandwich came with a huge side of pasta topped off with piping hot meat sauce and your choice of soup or salad.  The lasagna portion was incredibly large as well, and also came served with your choice of soup or salad.  The salad was good, nothing special, but the house-made buttermilk ranch dressing was PERFECT.  I've never had good ranch dressing in SF, but Victor's has it.  Reminds me of the ranch back home.  The cup of minestrone soup came served in a chinese take out box (weird, huh) and it was delicious.  We just needed to add a bit of salt.  

Everything was amazing, and this was definitely the best Italian takeout I've ever had.  I let the boy choose what we ordered, as I'll eat anything, but next time I definitely want to try a a pizza and the chicken parmesan.
author: Jenny W.

description: Lunchtime, or even when at a friend's house in San Francisco.  One of the best pizzas joints in the City.
author: Kianga H.

description:
The food especially the Pizza is just FANTASTIC. I think its is arguably one of the best Pizza places in the city 
The service is good , hospitable , more so when they know you as a repeat customer 
Highly recommended  - what are you waiting for , go there now ! :)
Ive had their meat pizza's their combo pizzas, calzonies, entrees and everything there is just fantastic. 
Their sauce has enough bite in it for flavor,their pizza is a thin crispy crust which collapses under the weight of all the toppings which are quite generous. 
I feel the prices are more than reasonable and they accept charge cards as well as cash. 
I always recommend this place to my friends or colleagues who want GREAT Pizza ! 
Viva Victors !
author: David S.

description:
Took my friends from Germany here, as this was the closest pizza joint near the motel that they were staying at.  Came here on a Sunday afternoon, around 2pm, and we were the only ones in the restaurant so at first that made me a bit nervous, but when our food came, those feelings of doubt went out the door.  

I let my friends pick what kind of pizza they would like to eat, and they chose the Hawaiian one.  Although I personally never order Hawaiian pizza (eh brah, nothing wrong with it, but come on cuz, fo us folks dat wen grow up in da islands, you no can say a pizza is "hawaiian" just because you wen throw some pineapple on top of one pizza. . . sorry, I felt the need to bus out some of my pidgin there, but it's true), I do have to admit this was probably the best I've had so far.  

The crust is really thin, so if you like that, this place is for you, no doubt.  The Hawaiian pizza we ordered had ham which was not in chunks but more like slices, which I prefer more, and small chunks of pineapple.  The sauce and cheese were just right.  

Friends and I debated if we should get the large or x-large, but since they hadn't eaten anything all day, we decided on the XL, thinking we'd have some for leftovers, but there was nothing to take back: it was so good all three of us ate the whole thing.  We didn't wait too long for the food to come either, which was nice.  If I'm ever in the Polk street area, I'd come here and try their pizza again.
author: Kahanalei M.

description: used to be amazing, now pizza sauce is a bit too sour for my taste
author: Logan G.

description:
Good pizza...BAD salad.  and when I say bad, I mean yucky, gross, nasty, no way no how will I eat that!  The romaine was actually tough (not sure how they pulled that off), the dressing had to have been Kraft bottled, and the croutons were the the little white squares you get in a box at the grocery store for $.99....Blech!

I'm so sorry Victor's, but with the good pizza, I thought you would have at least an edible caesar salad....sigh

So, yeah.  Get the pizza, if that's the place nearest to ya-  I like cheese with fresh garlic.  But that's it.  Don't deviate from the pizza at Victor's.
author: R D.

description: Just ordered a clam bake pizza from here, and it was delivered on time, with a smile, and was DELICIOUS.  The thin crust and sweet (but not too sweet) sauce is soooo good.  What a find -- this will be my go-to pizza delivery place moving forward!
author: Mel G.

description: First, this was a delivery order and the food came 30+ minutes later than was expected. Second, the food was nothing I would expect from a good Italian eatery. The eggplant Parmesan sandwich looked like fried zucchini. It wasn't even breaded. It looked raw. Between 3 people, we managed to pick some of the bread and cheese off the disappointing sandwich. The chicken Parmesan sandwich was mildly better. Decent enough to eat because of the hunger, but ultimately disappointing. The salads that came with the food were sad and not worth picking through the first layer. The side of pasta was barely picked at either. The worst part about this is this place was recommended by a friend so maybe expectations were set too high because my friend isn't the type to recommend something this bad. Next time I'll go somewhere else.
author: Chris Z.

description: Fast, easy, cheap, good. I once ordered a pizza from Victor's and had it delivered 9 minutes later. 9 minutes. It was delicious.
author: Daniel C.

description: I always order extra cheese, garlic and beef pizza at least twice a month.  There pizza and quality are consistent.  Service is always on time.  Keep up the good work!!!
author: Salman S.

description: Great crust and great sauce. Quick delivery, and they deliver to Zeke's! Bonus! Great pizza for a good price.
author: Zoe D.

description: Loved it!!  Officemate brought me a slice for lunch and was shocked to find it PILED with toppings!!!! From start to finish, BOMBA!!! ;-)
author: Lissette T.

description:
If you rate pizza against the gold standard of pizza --New York pizza -- this was bad.  The crust was a bit soggy in the center and actually a little burned on the outer edges.  The sauce was overly strong and the cheese tasted like any shredded mozzarella from a bag.

This tasted like any old pizza you could find anywhere.  I was bummed that I wasted one of my few dinners in San Francisco here when I could have eaten somewhere else... the glowing lights of the pho place across the street mocked me as I ate in Victor's.
author: Kelly O.

description: OMG this pizza this DELICIOUS. From Philly we have some pretty good pizza there and this place def competes. My fiancé and our friend got two extra large pies delivered for pre-NYE, it took an hour and 15 to get here but sooo worth it. It was still HOT as anything which is key. It was extremely cheesy and the toppings were perfect. YUMMYYY. I plan on eating the rest when we get home from partying and for breakfast in the a.m. before our flight back to Philly!
author: Anna B.

description:
We stopped here for a quick slice on the way to Cantina.  I had never been & was a little wary of reheating a slice of cold cheese with toppings tossed onto it.  I was wrong to doubt!  My pizza was incredibly tasty, and I wouldn't have known that the whole slice hadn't been just freshly baked if I hadn't seen it myself.  

I've had so much tasty pizza in & around this city that I'm not sure where it fits into the hierarchy.  On the whole Arinell vs. Victor's question, I do have to weigh in in favor of Victor's - Arinell is really good & bigger, but just not as flavorful (though more authentically NY style, if that's what you're after).

So yeah.  I have a new place to stop for a quick bite in the Tendernob!
author: Angela B.

description:
My pick for a lazy cheap date. I only sit in the dark side with the foliage hanging from the ceiling - it's one of the main reason I love this place. It's like eating in a warm cozy cave. The other side of the restaurant is for chumps and/or tourists. The servers are really nice and don't bug you, but they all say "cheers" a lot. Like all of them say it. Anyways.

You guys are crazy if you say the salad is gross, I LOVE it. It comes with two slices of cheese (I mean, where else would that happen??), carrot rounds, raw mushrooms. Also, I love a place that still actually serves you a salad with your meal. It's old-fashioned hospitality! Kids these days probably don't even remember a time when a salad wasn't priced ala carte.

The calzones are HUGE. I never order pizza. I like their pastas, usually gnocchi with pesto or the burro sauce is pretty yummy too. I come here often. I like it.

Polk St. sucks though.
author: Brittany L.

description:
There are some thing in life I will never get sick of: 

Burritos, wine, coffee, vodka, Harry Potter...

Topping this list is pizza. While most pizza joints at least mildly satisfy, finding a great slice, especially in this city, can be challenging. I regard Victor's as the best street slice in San Francisco. 

Yes, better than Arinell. 

I judge pizza on the quality of the crust, and Victor's has more flavor and better texture than Arinell's. Toppings are enough to provide excellent flavor and balance without being greasy or wet, and they cook it perfectly to a temperature suitable for immediate consumption...

So you can promptly go off onto Polk St. to satisfy your more illegal cravings.
author: Keane L.

description: Everything was served hot and fresh by the friendly staff, and the food was excellent.  The pizza was delicious and is definitely something I will order to be delivered in the future.  Modest looking from the outside, but very impressive.
author: Mark M.

description:
Amazing thin crust pizza...I definitely recommend the basil as a topping....so good. Crispy but not burnt and the sauce was very subtle and tasty. My creation : basil, sausage, tomatoes...to die for. I wil be coming back here 
.
author: Ra N.

description:
My boyfriend and I sometimes drive up from the South Bay for a weekend getaway in SF. Every time we're in town and craving a late night meal, we always look at each other and go... "Victor's?!?!?!"

My favorite kind of pizza toppings are hard to find, surprisingly - salami and pineapple! Places that make that always earn a high rating in my books, but this place even sells it BY THE SLICE. YUM.

Parking is hard to find here, and if you order slices to go, they don't let you sit and eat in the restaurant. Luckily, the slices are done in almost no time, so I've definitely jumped out of the car before, ordered, got our slices, and ran back to the curb before my BF has made too many circles around the block.

Oh, and also their dough is kept in drawers under the register. That definitely gives it character...

Pizza is my biggest weakness, and to get Victor's I'd jump up and sing "That's Amore" to, like, 10,000 people.
(When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie...)
author: Justine H.

description:
I have never yelped before.  I don't have time or the interest.  But today I had to say my peace.  I ordered delivery from Victors and the service was prompt I ordered two pastas and two sandwiches.  These came with bread, 3 salads, and 1 soup.  The food looked great, huge pasta portions and mediocre size sandwiches.  My roomate quickly scarfed his salad down.  I went to the fridge to get extra dressing because mine was pretty dry.  Immediately after pouring the dressing, 5 -10 fruit flies rose from the chinese food box.  I went to the next salad hoping it was mistake, but no, there was a dead fly on top of my the cheese.  

Disgusted I called to get my money back.  1st after admitting they had a fruit fly problem, they asked me if I wanted another salad!  Why the f would I want another salad after you just admitted having a fruit fly problem, and Im sorry but thats not a problem thats a reason to be shutdown!!!!!.  After which I demanded my money back, he asked if I was going to give the food back...  1.  If the food wasn't tainted I would have happily ate it because Im still hungry writing this....  2.  For you to talk to me as if this is some sort of scam to get free food is completely offensive, and of course after finding fruit fly's in my food Im not going to eat it you moron!!!!  So he told me he would send his delivery guy.

He arrived promptly again which was a plus because I was getting more frustrated by the minute.  When he arrived I opened the box to show him, and his reaction was why I am writing this yelp.  He had the audacity to tell me that some people mistake broken down mushrooms for fruit flys!!!  I about threw the food in the street.  How dare you question my interpretation of what a fruit fly is or looks like and mushrooms do not have wings!!  And what kind of idiot questions the customer after admitting to the problem??  Ever hear the phrase the customer is always right?? 

So Im going to sum this up.  If your looking for a large portion of over priced crap (putting it lightly) in a box  delivered promptly call, Victors.  They'll be happy to admit they have a problem with fruit flies and then demand the food back so they can resell it to some unknowing less observant individual.  Then they will promptly send some jerk off over to refund your money and insult your intelligence upon receiving the uneaten tainted food.  

Thank you Victors for inspiring this terrible review.  Im sure to some this will be very amusing.  But I am not, and I get no satisfaction from this and honestly Im pissed I had to waste the time.  I will never order from you again and I would recommend no one ever eat at this establishment if you have any value for clean food and proper customer service.  Still hungry.
author: Jason E.

description:
WOW. Since moving from NY to SF this is the first time I can honestly say I had pizza. No cornmeal crust or flavorless sauce topped with something that was frozen or canned, this was the real deal, Italian Pizza. Growing up with an Italian family in a predominately Italian area- there were many options for good pizza. When I moved to Cali I realized how much I had taken this for granted. I have tried many pizza places in the Marina some are OK, but  all have failed to compare. The pizza  form Victor's was truly AMAZING, the crust was crispy yet doughy on the inside, the sauce was flavorful and the toppings (1/2 eggplant, 1/2 sausage) were fresh and authentically seasoned. To top it all off- they told me it would be 45 minutes and to my surprise the pizza arrived 20 minutes later, BONUS. The only minor flaw was that they forgot the side of meatballs I had ordered. However, my only disappointment is that i did not get to try them, the pizza was totally worth the extra money. This is my new Pizza place for sure...

If you want true Italian pizza and are not afraid of flavor this is the place. Mangia!
author: Cara M.

description:
Best delivery pizza in SF. Really holds up to the travel time. Real East Coast style food, eggplant parmigiana, pesto gnocchi, meatballs, garlic bread, etc
Very fast delivery too. They always quote 40 minutes but it's usually more like 20-30
author: Mike S.

description: I really miss NY pizza, and Victor's has been around for years. I've always driven by and wondered, so I decided to try a slice. While the three slices remaining looked like they've been out for hours...I said "why not." The cheese pizza was good, it was heated thoroughly and the crust had a nice thin crunch, but it was missing the chewyness too. The cheese was fresh, and there was a nice amount of italian seasonings and other stuff on top. However, still no go for me. I think Escape From New York Pizza is better. I wanted to like Victor's, but I was just disappointed.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Seriously this place is the very best I can find in San Francisco. A couple of the guys at the front are always courteous and polite, which makes for a consistently great experience. I don't know what they do to make the pizza taste as fresh as it does, but it's very good.
author: Eli S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I do realize this place has a lot of good reviews. However, I can only review based on my experience- and it sucked.

A friend and I rolled by one night to grab a quick slice after I had just moved into the neighborhood. It took us a good 5 minutes to order 2 slices each. 10 minutes later, when they were finally ready, we got our slices and proceeded to grab a table when we were told that we couldn't sit down- apparently the tables are for "sit-down diners only." WTF? We're here to dine and we want to sit down- what does that make us? We just purchased 2 slices each and you wont even let us grab a seat to eat them in? Not to mention the fact that the place was empty. Literally. The place was full of tables and chairs and only one of them had a couple finishing up dinner.

Being from NY, I was kinda pissed that I couldn't enjoy a slice of pizza while sitting down- unheard of in NY from a place that advertises pizza by the slice (where it's understood that if you order a slice, you should be able to sit down and enjoy it if there are tables and chairs available). I told the guy behind the counter that it's not right, to which he basically gave me a dirty look and told me (in other words) to go fuck myself.

That's the people and the service.

To top it off, the pizza was shit. And I'm not just saying that because the staff were a bunch of assholes. Nor am I just saying that because I'm from NY and think our pizza's the holy grail of pizzas. I've been to a lot of pizza joints in cities all over the world, and this pizza sucked. It tasted worst than the old-school frozen pizzas that used to only be available in slices before brands like DiGiorno came out with somewhat edible frozen pies. The sauce tasted funky and the cheese was nasty. It pretty much tasted like homemade pizza straight out of the microwave.

PROS:
- None

CONS:
- Shitty service
- Even shittier staff
- And even shittier pizza

BOTTOM LINE:
Stay away. There are much better pizza joints around the area. There's probably much better Italian food as well.
author: Mr. P.

description: I was pleased with everything I had, including the pizza.  Great little casual Italian restaurant.
author: Conspicuous C.

description: They don't know how long it takes to cook the food. I waited 20min for something I was told takes 7-8min. SUCKS
author: Squally C.

description: Very good cheese pizza!  Of all the pizza places in this neighborhood, this is by far the best.  Lucky for me that I am in walking distance!!
author: Ann S.

description:
I walk by this place all the time.  It always smells great.  I can usually smell it from across the street.

I was in the mood for thin crust pizza and decided to come here after reading so many great reviews.  We ordered a pepperoni, mushroom, black olive and jalapeno pizza.  It was really tasty, but the middle was kind of soggy.  I was a little sad about that.  I had every intention of giving this review 3 stars last night.  BUT...I had a slice cold this morning and it was really good.  I gave them an extra star for that!

The staff was really cool and nice.  That's always a plus in my book considering how much crappy service and pissed off employees are out there these days!
author: S. Y.

description:
We went to have dinner with my parents and my wife, had 1 small pizza and 1 medium with 5 beers total. Check was 52 bucks. Really good pizza and cheap beer makes a great combo. Friendly and professional waiter who always helped and made the experience really good!
Will go back in the future. One of the cheapest dinners also!
4.5 stars!
author: Leandro P.

description:
Good food here, Tastey Greek salad , it has plenty of fresh lettuce and Feta cheese.
House wine is decent for the money; I"ve had the veal scallopini and the veal was tender and the pasta was good.  They bring you a small amound of  free bread; and its warm and tastey.
This place rocks my tummy tiger for minimal cash. 
Low key place. Good friendly service.
author: Bert K.

description: Great service, decent above average pizza. We got a medium for 2 which was helluva lot of pizza, and they let us have two different specials on each half for no extra cost.  It also came out pretty fast which was great. Pizza's like pho, gotta save the stars for the heavy hitters. This one aint a heavy hitter but definitely worth coming back for.
author: Henry Y.

description: I love living near Victor's. I've been craving pizza for weeks. Usually I don't get pizza unless it's great though. Today I was on Polk Street, in search of the elusive quick snack (Hey somebody, Polk Street needs an awesome deli that is between California and Sutter!). I remembered Victor's, my favorite pizza place in the neighborhood. I looked at the slices in the window. A woman walking out said, "best pizza in the city." "Yeah I said." I orderd a slice with mushrooms. The very pleasant guy behind the counter made the experience all that much better, but the best part was getting home and noshing it down. I love Victor's.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
First of all, Victor's Pizza is good. If they served pizza alone, I'd give them four stars.

But unfortunately we also ordered salad and pasta for delivery. The salads were a soggy mess stuffed into a Chinese take-out container. The structure of these containers and the fact that they do not send the dressing in a separate container made the salads quite inedible. And the pasta was so overcooked that it clumped together and wouldn't mix with the sauce. 

Perhaps Victor's should stick with pizza... For salad and pasta delivery, I'm returning to Amicis, which is consistently fresh and al dente.
author: J. Haley C.

description: Victor got it right!!Food is excellent.We have Italian food at home that is more expensive and crap compared to Victors homemade goodness.Great Job Victor.Will be back!
author: Jennifer s.

description: I cant believe more people arent commenting on the actual people that take your order. I live around the corner and every time i order from here i prepare to be yelled at. I would say 50% of the time i interact with these guys (in store or delivery) i get the soup nazi treatment, i know its the same for my friends and ive seen it happen to other customers in the store. The pizza is good but if you want to not get stressed out, do what i do and order from Village Pizza around the corner. I tried Victors again last night and got the "hey what do you want, what are you talking about, huh what, huh what" treatment again which is the last time. I am not a picky guy but ordering pizza should be easy. No more victors for me.
author: Ryan P.

description: I've had the pizza and fettaccine from here. The salad that came with the fettaccine was good. It had salami pieces, so that was a nice touch. The fettaccine was a bit bland, so I added a bit of salt and pepper for taste. As for the pizza, it seemed like they skimped on the toppings. We ordered mushroom and pepperoni, but there was hardly any of the two. On the upside, server we had was very nice and attentive.
author: Shanelle A.

description:
Couldn't be more disappointed! I might as well have had a red barron frozen pizza. Plain and simple; this shit sucks!

The pizza was all about crust. I like crust, but this was all about crust, no sauce and the toppings thrown on it. Definitely a waste of money! I cannot say that'd I'd ever go back, such a disappointment. Boo!!!!!
author: Joanna N.

description:
This place looked popular because there were a lot of people standing outside eating pizza. Turns out the owner won't let you sit down inside. 

This place doesn't seem to care about customers, and is resting on their laurels for being on Polk Street. The owner ignored me for 2 minutes and then grunted at me for my order. When the food was ready he just slid it across the counter without a word, and the pizza was definitely undercooked. I pointed out to him that the toppings weren't even brown yet and he continued to nudge the pizza towards me.

No wonder people are talking about food poisoning. I went home and cooked it for another 5 minutes.
author: Nic W.

description:
Ok, I have spent 3 years searching for an awesome pizza place. Im really picky when it comes to pizza. The sauce is too sweet, there isn't enough cheese, the toppings taste like mush. Don't ask me why but I have struggled with finding a pizza place that is awesome. Last night, I finally found that place for me. 

My sister and I went in to grab slices for ourselves as well as our friends in the car (we were on our way to the fllmore for a concert). Nothing too hard and we went really simple. Got back into the car and started eating. My god they were awesome. Right amount of cheese, awesome tasting sauce, crust was perfect. I was like YES! new pizza joint I can order from and super close to my house. 

I can't wait to call and order a pizza from them to deliver. Very excited!
author: Diana R.

description: Discovered this lovely Italien Restaurant in my Nob Hill neighborhood last night. Friendly, amenable table service. Excellent pricing plus large delicious portions of very tasty well prepared Italien Pasta plus gourmet salad or tasty Minestrone soup..And, your choice of about a dozen great wines or beer. The ambiance in this great restaurant should be experienced. And if you choose they do have takeout a5 415 885-1660.
author: judith s.

description:
Sausage and Meatball Sandwich Combo, $9.10
with mozzarella + tomato sauce, in a toasted sesame roll.

The sausage had great smokey flavor.
The meatball wasn't heavy condense kind, it was really fluffy a bit spicy and juicy meatballs.
Both sausage and meat balls were covered with nice tomato sauce and oven melted mozzarella in between a great toasted sesame roll.

Every single items was remarkably crunchy outside, juicy inside.
It was simple sandwich but so good!

This combo come with Fettucini Bolognese .
It was a perfect al dente Fettucini with great meat sauce.
The pasta and sauce are Victor's fresh made.
The place is known as a pizza place and that's all I had but I didn't know how good the other items are.
What a great surprise!

Everything here are Nothing Fancy but REALLY GOOD!

I thought I knew the place but I didn't know anything about the place.

The place is in nothing fancy neighborhood and nothing fancy decor but I just loved the well-done sandwich with fresh homemade sauces, meatballs and pasta. 

No wonder the place has been here for a while.
Sometimes you'll never know with just 1 visit.

Steve L. said, "Wow, this place has been here forever.  Use to come here late nights when I was in high school.  Sounds better this time than your previous review."

That's right. the place has been here FOREVER.
There is a reason for that.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Victor's doesn't need another pizza review, but I want to give a shout out to its wonderfully flavorful saute' mushrooms.  These are not the tiny sliced 'shrooms cooked in oil that one would expect but are large whole ones that are cooked and served in a very tasty mushroom broth.  There are pieces of minced garlic, green onions, and what looked like shreads of fresh spinich in the broth and it is served piping hot.   I almost threw it out because I wasn't expecting the mushrooms to be served in a liquid but then realized that it was a yummy soup.   There was absolutely no feeling of oiliness in my mouth after I drank the soup too so I think the mushrooms must have been cooked in the broth rather than saute'd.

I think the name "saute'd mushrooms" is a misnomer since they are anything but that.

Do yourself a favor and get some.
author: ruth r.

description:
My friend and I stopped in here for a quick bite before the show at Red Devil Lounge. Whoa, the Calzone was so delicious. We shared the "small" Ricotta, Tomato, Spinach and Mozzarella. The small is plenty for two people to share. My only gripe is that bottom of the crust was slightly burnt. But I just ate around the black bits. Doughy, crispy and lots of melted cheese and garlic. So delicious. The wait staff was on it. They never let our water glasses go empty and every time they refilled they always said "cheers". Dimly lit and very cozy. With over 300 reviews I can see why the people love it.

Tip: Pizza by the slice avail. for to go only.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I've only ever stopped by Victor's to pick up a slice to go so I can't speak to the service or ambiance.

Sausage and jalapeno is my favorite and they do it really well here. Order at the counter and watch them make your slice to order. It comes out piping hot and delicious. The only thing I'd complain about is the price - $4+ for a slice is more than I'd prefer to pay. 

They're open late so it's a great place to wrap up a night spent at the Polk Street bars.
author: Asheley W.

description:
Okay it's pizza. Even the worst pizza is still good, because, well, it's pizza. The sauce tasted like nasty too much dried oregano. or that sauce in a jar with "italian spices." Bleghghg

My vegetarian pizza slice was 5 dollars. It had way too many onions cut way to thickly.

Also, they won't let you eat there if you order a single slice. WTF?
author: Jenny U.

description:
Excellent place for the price. 

The soup was excellent, the pasta was pretty good, and the sandwich was excellent. The sandwich combo that everyone mentioned in early reviews, is a hell of a deal and if you're in doubt of what to order, go with that because you get a little of everything.

I haven't tried the pizza, but it looked very good.

The ambiance could use a bit of work. It isn't a particularly romantic place, at least one half isn't, and the other half was too cave-like.

But still, this was pretty good stuff. I'll be back here.
author: David H.

description:
Look, I'm a Chicagoan (by pedigree) and there are people on both coasts who make fun of those like me for our purportedly deluded ideas about pizza. But even though I'm in no way speaking from a position of endorsed authority, I'll say this has to be one of the best slices in this city, my new city.

Thin, crispy crust. Light sauce. Choice mozzarella. I like it with mushrooms, out of the oven and hot enough to burn your tongue, folded in half.
author: Peter B.

description: The staff is really unfriendly and caused us a hard time to find a table that at the end we had to leave with very unpleasent and rude comments of the staff even if we were just trying to find a table and sit down. I will not go back there again.
author: Fulya C.

description: Pizza is garbage. Chicken cutlets thick and dry. The pastas are runny and slimy.
author: Robert A.

description: We just happened to come across this place, as the original destination was not open. This is a small establishment but took credit cards, so we went right in. And what a great decision that was. Oh yeah! Very yummy! My husband ordered the Victor special pizza pie (basically a combination pizza) and I had a chicken sandwich, per the suggestion of the waiter. The pizza was one of the best we have had in a long time, very fresh vegetables. My chicken sandwich was on a garlic butter grilled bun, with chunks of garlic underneath the cheese. Delicious. I would recommend this place in a heart beat.
author: Shannalee F.

description: The pizza may e good but that does not excuse the terrible service.... Was staying in the city for a night and got delivery to my hotel. First the delivery guy calls and yells at me to come outside because he can't get out of the car. Then when I go down to get it he continues to be extremely rude and he stole our hotel room key. My boyfriend asked for it back and the delivery guy said "no, there's your pizza." My boyfriend had to convince the hotel staff to let him into the hotel because the delivery guy took his room key.. Called the restaurant to complain and the owner told me I was lying and lost the key myself.. Then he put me on hold for a good 10 min before I hung up. Long story short this business is sketchy and you should bring your money elsewhere. Avoid this place and all of its staff at all costs
author: Gina G.

description:
I don't get it.  I made a POINT to come back here when I was drunk to get the pizza, and I still didn't like it.

I've eaten here a few times- once for a sit down meal.  Ceasar tasted like it was made with pure mayo, pizza was soggy with the saddest little sauce.

A few more times were after some local drinking.  I love the concept of having cheese pizza ready on the fly and charge by the toppings you pay extra to have thrown on.

Unfortunately, still a soggy pizza with a sad little sauce.
author: Gabrielle J.

description: SO delicious! Definitely one of the best pizza places in the city. Have ordered a couple of times and sat in for lunch. Highly recommended
author: Shahde T.

description: What a disgusting place to eat.  After getting our hair done next door at Snip2Curl (fabulous btw) my teen and I decided to grab a bite to eat before heading back over the bridge.  What a mistake.  We should have just waited.  I ordered the meat lasagna and with it came a breadstick and a cup of minestrone.  The soup was just watery tomato sauce with pieces of carrots and soggy mushy OLD pieces of lasagna noodles.  I pushed it aside and held out hope.  What a disappointment.  The "lasagna" was in the same tomato sauce with the same MUSHY noodles and a few traces of mystery meat - NO Cheese on top - my teen ordered rigatoni with Marinara - how can you possibly get this wrong?  They did - her bowl was filled half was up with WATER - then the same soggy mushy and I do mean MUSHY pasta with the same nasty sauce on top.  The server was no better - quite rude actually.  I gave him a dollar tip - too many good places to waste any time at this disgusting place.  0 stars - the only edible thing was the breadstick!  ACTUALLY I WANT MY FREAKING MONEY BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Lenette P.

description:
My dad and I stopped here for dinner and we ordered Victor's Vegetarian Special. This will be a combo review containing both of our opinions. 

I thought it was pretty good. The crust was chewy but not squishy, and a little burnt around the edges which I like. The veggies were tasty, seemed pretty fresh, but the cheese was so ridiculously stringy that I almost choked on it. Not good. Despite this, I enjoyed my meal and actualy ate half of our 6-inch pizza, which is unusual for me because I have a very small stomach. I give Victor's 4 stars.  

My dad has been temporarily living in SF for almost three months (I've only been here for a day) and he says that it was probably the lamest place he's eaten at during his entire stay here. He says the pizza is mediocre and gives the place 1.5 stars.
author: Arman D.

description:
So I haven't tried the pizza here before. But I've tried their pasta....honestly, I didn't think one could fuck up on pasta!!!! It's noodles and sauce!!!! But they managed to do it. My friend and I couldn't figure out what was so off with it, we think it had too much garlic in it. I actually took mine home, tasted even worse reheated, I took 2 bites and tossed it. What a waste of money!!! Plus, who serves Corona's without carrying limes???

Although the food was horrible, the server (the Asian guy) was real nice. The people who work there are all very nice and polite. Maybe someday I'll get the stomach to try their pizza.
author: Megan L.

description:
Super fast delivery, and great pizza.  Not too much sauce, good cheese consistency.  Probably one of the better places to get a pie in the neighborhood.

However- I also ordered a Cesar salad, and the dressing tasted like yellow mustard. Not kidding, it was very odd. It was also kind of yellow in color. 

Bottom line, order the pizza, skip the salad. (unless you're really into mustard, I mean, to each their own, right?)
author: Amanda B.

description: Updating my previous review because I must let all know that those who have had bad treatment or food must be in the minority. I have been living in the area for over 20 years and have NEVER had bad treatment by staff in person, on phone or on delivery. The food continues to be high quality. The pizza is great, the salads are the best I've had and killer entree's such as Veal Parmigiana make it 5 stars.
author: Walter W.

description: Really really good.  There are like 7 pizza places within 4 blocks of my business.  I used to really like the one a block from me, but since they have new owners, the food has gone off the rails bad.  So I tried Victors and I am soooo glad I did.  Fast delivery, good amount of toppings, crust had just the right amount of brown crispy dough.
author: Dee H.

description: Great prices, service and fast delivery.  I've liked everything I've ordered including the veal parmesan, fettuccine alfredo and garlic bread.  Meals come with a generous antipasto side salad with fresh veggies like mushrooms and carrots but the best part has to be the homemade salad dressing.  Portions are large and the garlic bread has fresh herbs and garlic.  These guys take the time to use fresh ingredients and it shows.
author: Lisa K.

description: Victor's has ya, and they know it.  There are other pizza joints in the area that are open late, but this one is very conveniently located on Polk Street, so they can charge some pretty premium prices for what is very average pizza.  At least they are fast and efficient about taking your money, lessening the sting somewhat.
author: Dave N.

description: They get 3.5 stars I was tipsy from what I remember the slice of combo was tasty with real good sauce and enough of it. Nothing amazing but solid slice. The owner was nice he said even if a person doesn't buy food he Lets them use the bathroom
author: Karen T.

description:
So there's not that many pizza places that will deliver.  I've ordered pizza here maybe 3 times for delivery.  Lookswise, the pizza appears fresh, vibrant and yummy.  Tastewise, it's very bland.  The ingredients taste fresh, but there's just no flavor in the sauce.

As for timely delivery, they arrived as estimated everytime.  I give this place just an "Eh"
author: C A.

description:
As a 'Thank You' to the team that helped me put together the Glide Benefit, I treated them all out to dinner here, and we had a wonderful time.

While Victor's isn't the Polk street pizza hotspot, it does produce a great pie and when it comes to the combination of colored toppings, sizzling cheese and finger crumbling crust, it hit the mark.

Pizza in general has a way of bypassing the human stress genome to alleviate any and all problems and has one tremendous way of numbing the brain.

The people here are kind, outgoing, and it didn't hurt that they had a Wednesday night $6 Pitchers special.

Freshly made pizzas churned out of their oven on a San Francisco night can simplify life. 

In a very good way.
author: Mike K.

description:
It only resembled a pizza because it was round-Large w/ random chunks of mostly
 un-cooked Onion and Green bell Pepper, no tomato sauce very little cheese( If it is cheese) no flavor other than the salts in the pepperoni; All generously  piled on  a soggy  tasteless crust. Made  Heavy handed It was more like they were slopping pigs not cooking. No craft, no pride no merit  and what ever it was, it wasn't Italian. maybe Fast food... Berber style?
author: Andrew C.

description: ordered the meat pizza it was ok the sause was pretty good . my husband ordered the carbornara  he said it was dry and I agree it was somewhat tasteless. we got 4 sodas. it was overpriced $42 dollars and $3 dollars tip $45 . we could have gotten the same at uncle vitos plus 2 more sodas for $10 less. oh the minestrone that came with the carbonara was like a vegetable broth with bits of pasta no vegetable at all. the roll was very hard and solid. do not order meals here. not good. pizza is ok not worth the price though.
author: Nellie J.

description:
A solid 3.5

Now if I was giving out my Yelp rating based solely on the pizza alone my rating would easily surpass the 4 mark. This pizza is magical folks ( and I don't mean magical tasting when consumed drunk). No, this is thin crust piled high with toppings and fixins eager to be consumed. I had passed by this place for years, occasionally ducking in for a slice or two to go before heading out to the location of my next bout of drunken shenanigans. The slices to go only clause never bothered me as I find pizza a highly transportable food. But one evening not too long ago I broke down and actually found myself dining inside. 

A friend of mine and I have been having some boy problems and were up for a pity party table for two. Seriously, a bitchery-pitchery session* can only be capped off with something hot and gooey. We went for a half veggie, half meaty large or extra large and a pitcher of beer for optimum comforting purposes. Yeah we'd take a slice of each and fold them over like some ridiculous over stuffed sandwich. Yeah holy yum yums, we stopped complaining and started shoveling in uber fresh toppings. The veggies were crisp, the meat was thick, flavorful and spicy and somehow the crust was not soggy to the point of flopping all over the place. 

My main pet peeve was the ambiance and decor. Honestly, the tables and chairs reminded me of a parish hall ready for a spaghetti dinner and yeah, it was distracting to look at the huge vacuum located right behind my friend's head. The waiter, though polite enough, seemed really indifferent to being a server. Really if my friend and I are going to drop close to $50 on pizza and beer for two is wrong to expect a wee bit more? I'd definitely return but I think I'll stick with the to go route. 

*bitchery-pitchery session: where two or more females get together to complain, whine and commiserate on what's been going on and going wrong over a few beers
author: Veronica G.

description:
I never eat Pizza (except when I am in Italy)
My friends do.
So they got a delivery from Victor's and of course I had to try.
Except from the fact that my stomach did not appreciate that much cheese I thought it was ok, not as greasy as American pizza can be, more like Italian pizza. Not quite, but more like.
It was a lot vegetables and not just 7 pounds of cheese that usually taste like uhh well...nothing.....
A big big plus was that the vegetables were crispy, a lot of the times they are just overcooked and taste like water.

Even though this was not a real Italian pizza, it was damn close and I might even one day order one myself....

Btw all Swedish people seem to have super fast metabolisms except me, my friend ate an x-large and could still drink like 12 beers and be skinny as hell, sometimes life is just not fair, but then again, I really don't care!
author: cecilia k.

description:
yum! came here in dire need of some late night pizza and victor's hit the spot. pizza had thin crust but it was still doughy enough to really get a great bite. the cheese was great and stretched out like when you see delicious cheese pizza on tv.

service was friendly and fast. talked about how the giants are failing miserably. in and out and delicious!
author: Liz M.

description: Victor's is kiiind of a hole in the wall and the lighting is entirely too dark for what it is (read not romantic) but it has charm and it does the trick. A couple friends took me out for some cheap-eats and good convo. I ordered the "small" calzone which was anything but tiny portioned. That monster fed me for three meals! Tasty, though and worth the calories.
author: Julia N.

description: A must go if you're in the city! If you're a meat lover looking for a good hardy pizza Victor's Special is the way to go. Otherwise the pesto chicken is amazing too.
author: Alexis L.

description:
I am far from a pizza connoisseur - in fact, I only eat cheese pizza. But I loooove cheese pizza. And I love places that deliver (delivery is one of the best things about San Francisco). Enter Victor's.

I originally tried it because I needed a pizza delivery place that had good reviews on Yelp. Victor's was it. I have ordered from them several times now and find that the taste of the pizza is really inconsistent - a couple of times, it's been so salty that it's been nearly inedible. That said, when it's been good (and it usually is), it's been REALLY good.

The turnaround time for delivery is also wicked fast. I'm tempted to bump them up to four stars for that reason, but I can't past the salty pies. Really, it was that bad.
author: Randi W.

description:
Pizza yummy! Authentic enough to have New York natives agree its pretty darn good! 

Late night grab and go slices, quick bite for lunch. I personally like the Greek salad, but wished it came with a breath mint afterwards. 

The Decor is kinda old and tables slant, bath room scares me... But the slices are worth it!
author: Jaimie D.

description:
I haven't been to Victor's in years, but thanks to yelp realized it was right around the corner from the crazy line that I was dropping my 14 yo daughter off at for a concert at the Regency. 

After checking yelp to find the nearest location for some good thin crust pizza by the slice we parked right outside Victor's, ordered a couple of slices and sat down in the super dark dining room to eat our pizza.  Jeez, why so dark?  What are we hiding?

Ah, who cares?  Pizza was delicious, absolutely thin and light as air, sauce was perfect, not too sweet, not too tart and there was just the right amount of cheese.  So good I had to order me a second slice.

Love it when you get to re-discover an old gem.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Had a craving at work for pizza and wanted to be nice to the guys so pizza for everyone. Jump on yelp instead of grabbing the yellow pages. 45 minutes and 20$ later an extra large pepperoni pizza pie. 

New york style pizza with out the pool of grease when you crease the slice. Tasty with herbs and stuff in the cheese. Great sauce and plenty of cheese. 

Ive had better, but if I'm ordering for work some of the better places can get pricey.
author: Roy L.

description: Good pizza, fast delivery. Definitely not close to NY style like some of the other reviews have stated. The Combo had good sausage. Worth a try.
author: Bri R.

description: I stayed at the Holiday Inn on VanNess and Victor's delivered two nights to my room.  Great food, quick delivery, everything was perfect!
author: Jim F.

description:
Between the three of us, we got the small Victor's Special and the Zorba Favorite. As most of the yelpers that yelped, the crust was really good. If you don't like crust on a pizza, I wouldnt' really go here. 

The price wasn't as cheap as I'd like it to be but it was decent. the Zorba Favorite had feta cheese on top which made it a bit different than other pizza joints.
author: Sophie S.

description: EDIT FROM QUICK TIP!!!! The quality of this food is VERY inconsistent. I've had reason to change my mind and NOT recommend this place. The garlic cheese bread was straight up NASTY!!! I took a friend with me and was embarrassed by the food. He had a slice and the sauce was a miss as well. It's not worth it.
author: L W.

description:
The pizza here looks good, smells good, tastes decent, but...

HUGE -3 stars for the signage that says "SLICES TO GO ONLY."  WTF is that about?  I want to eat my slice while it's hot and fresh, and here they have a whole restaurant full of empty tables, and you're telling me I can't sit down and eat my slice?

Forget it.  Not worth the bother.  I'll go to Za instead, where the pizza is better AND they let me sit down and eat it.  Imagine that.
author: Marco C.

description:
If a piece of pepperoni pizza from Victor's was put in front of my face, then yes, it would be hard to stay away from it. Actually, I guess that's not really saying much because I would probably eat most things put in front of my face. -insert inappropriate joke here- Let me rephrase. 

This is not the kind of place I would veto if the crowd I'm with is in agreement (unlike Papa John's which I would obnoxiously protest). However, it's probably not a place I would order from if I had the choice. The pizza was solid, and I'm sure if I had been drunker when I was eating it, this review might sound a little different. 

The salad (salami, mozzarella, and olives) was yummy and filling, but it was like they poured enough dressing over it to fill up lake Michigan. The leaves were crying out to me "help us! we're drowning!" It was really more like a salad soup.

Finally, who delivers pizza and salads with no napkins or forks? C'mon, really though?
author: Kelsey E.

description:
This place delivers FAST. Nice thin crust, toppings are always well placed - this under-appreciated as every slice gets just the right amount of toppings!

Thanks Victor's for many a night of filling my belly with good eats.
author: Annie T.

description: I first stumbled across Victor's after I had a doughnut at Bob's and was still hungry. Victor's is a dark, unassuming restaurant tucked into the mass of restaurants and stores on Polk St. I've been here both to grab a quick slice and to sit-down for an entire pie.  Their thin-crust pizza is pretty good if you're in the area and craving pizza. It's on the pricier side, but it's alot better than most pizza places on Polk St.  However, if I was in the mood for thin-crust, I'd definitely make the trek out to LIttle Star.
author: Monelle A.

description: ive been wanting to try new places for delivery in SF so i decieded to give Victors's a try. The food was disgusting the soup was almost all water and looked like diarreah, they forgot the bread and the seafood pasta i ordered was old ,cold and they didnt give me enough to feed a child. yhis place is the shits
author: Kyle J.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco, almost made me forget I was on the west coast. I haven't really been wowed by the salads or pasta, but this is a pizza place and as such I will judge them solely on that. 

Crunchy and tasty crust, this is an integral part of the pizza as when you get a soft doughy crust you end up with a crummy pizza. Real sauce and cheese that actually tastes like fresh mozzarella, not the weird tasteless "mozzarella" you get so often. The toppings are all great... I'm really just repeating myself, so I'll save myself the typing and just say it is worth a try.
author: Pierre C.

description:
Rainy Nob Hill night.
Victor's delivered in all
senses of the word.
author: Andrew T.

description: We were just visiting SF for a weekend, and wanted some really good pizza after being out in the rain all day sightseeing. Yelped pizza, and discovered this place, which looked good from the other reviews. Indeed it was. Tasty, thin and crispy pizza, that was delivered really quickly by a not so interested waitor. Not a very ambient place, but I guess it's a bit better if you want take out. It is a bit expensive though. Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Kristin V.

description:
jersey shore!

i had to mention that because this place felt like it belonged on the show.  there's a bunch of guidos all over the place.  they serve homemade italian food.  they shout "fuhgeddaboutit!" from across the room! j/k on that last one but yeah this place couldn't be more guido'd out.

there's a sign that says the place has been open since the 60's and the interior agrees.  while the interior design might not be too appealing, the food really is!

loved the pizza.  thin crust with dollops of mozzarella and fresh toppings.  crispy and muy delicioso.  we had a couple of pizzas for appetizers and i thought that i'd have room for an entree so i got a fettuccine with italian sausage.  after eating 2 slices of pizza and some of their warm homemade bread, i didnt even touch my entree.  i ate it for dinner and it was really, really good.

minus one star for the wait...we did wait longer than i would've liked to which really surprised me since there were only 2 other tables to serve.  

overall i liked this place and would definitely come back!
author: Ray R.

description:
I never had a thing for thin pizzas--until this year and until I started going to Victor's to get a slice or two on my lazy, chubby pizza days. Yes, I was a skeptic, always wondering "how sanitary is their pizza with the cheese just sitting in the window all day?" "how old is that cheese?" "is that the same cheese I saw in the window yesterday?"

But Victor's is great!! I usually get either just a slice of cheese if I'm being a cheap bum or pepperoni, sausage and mushroom if I want to indulge. Yum! I think I want some Victor's right now, but that's probably not a great idea after four Thanksgiving dinners in the past few days and two grilled cheese sandwiches for lunch. 

By the way, Victor's is usually quick about getting you in and out of there. Especially if you're just getting pizza. The workers are pretty friendly too. The only thing is, they only accept credit/debit cards for anything over $10, so you better get your butt to an ATM before you go for a slice..
author: Maureen B.

description:
food tasted really good going in (would rate it top 2 pizza places in sf)

but got food poisoning from the pizza the next day. so did a friend. argh . prob overdue cheese

still trying recover
author: Bobby B.

description: Had one last delivery pie while cleaning our old apartment this weekend -- just writing to confirm that their pies are indeed great.
author: Greg J.

description:
I'm torn because I've had a number of different experiences here, so I'll break it down and you can decide. 

First time: Sat down in the restaurant and ordered a pizza. It was OK, crust was thin but not as delicious looking as the "by the slice" pieces but since you're not allowed to sit inside with the "by the slice" pieces we opted to order.

Third time: Ordered delivery to R Bar - absolute WORST experience. the crust was extra doughy and thick, almost not cooked all the way. This tasted worse than papa john's and everyone that was sharing it at the bar was cursing me for ordering such crap. 

Lesson learned - only eat their pizza if you're grabbing a slice to go. NEVER EVER order delivery.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Keeping things simple, Victor's Pizza is an old school pizza restaurant with thin crust pizza.  Its also available by the slice. One day I noticed something called the Victor's Special slice on their menu.  I tried it once and was hooked.  Its a solid combo slice with pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers, onions and olives.  Basically, the works.  

In fact, I have one in front of me as I am writing this review.  And Its getting better with each bite.  Right now I am throwing some Sriracha hot sauce on it.  Boom, I got myself a nice little meal right here. I do prefer a thin sliced pizza. 

Victor's is the best pizza in the nob coorridor.  Just don't go there for the pasta and then come on Yelp and complain and complain.  Stick with what the place is named after, pizza. I sadly admit I used to eat at Pizza Pino since it was also nearby.  Then one day I realized I was crazy for eating that cardboard pizza.  So when I am craving pizza in the nob hill corridor area, its Victor's for me.
author: Georgio N.

description:
Victor's invokes looks of disgust and envy..

Scenario: It's Friday night at around 12am. You are strolling down Polk Street, shoving your slice of Chicken and Garlic Pizza down your throat.. like you haven't eaten in days -- intenseNOMNOMNOM, and you walk:

a) by a crowd of overdressed people.. they stare at you in disgust (mostly from the girls).. 

reaction: NOMNOMBITCHES! i would throw this at your hair but it's too tasty! 

b) into a crowded bar = OMG.. that smells soooooooo good. 

reaction: NOMNOM ALLMINE! (but you can go to Victor's)

Victor's Pizza envy is the best! 

In fact, I envy you if you're near there right now. My stomach is gurgling and Victor's is all I can think about. I always think I can eat more slices, but 1 does it for me. Price is reasonable. The crust is perfect and not too thick. Toppings perfect amount, and garlic breath ( = LOVE ).  

Future weapon of choice: Garlic Breath. 
How: Add as many H's in between words..

Me: WHAAAAT AHHHHRRRRE  YOUUUUUU STARING AAAAHTT??
