*crying inside* so hungry... *falls over... twitches*
author: Donna H.

description:
We came here at like 9:30pm the first night. We were exhausted and starved, and we really just needed something edible and close to the hotel. We were able to decide on Italian, and Victor's was the best-reviewed place to show up in the area. Dillon and I got the lasagna (meat for him, veg for me), Mike got a meatball sandwich, and Luke got some sort of stuffed pasta. I think I was the least happy with my food, and that was only because I've had some really amazing lasagnas in my time. It was decent, but not great. Heavy on a rather watery marinara. Not really a remarkable place for pasta, but decent food at a decent price. We probably should've split a pizza.

The really irksome thing was the other customers. I had the feeling that the people seated behind us were regulars, and they were very pointedly listening to our conversation and discussing it loudly, without talking to us. I know I also partake in the art of eavesdropping and judging, but come on. At least have the manners to be somewhat polite about it (can't you just wait till we're out of earshot?).
author: Caroline C.

description:
Stopped in here a couple of times in the past. 1st experience was okay. Nothing memorable. 

The last time was a couple weeks back with a large group of friends. Kudo's to the team for putting up with us. And bigger kudos to the wait staff that got picked on by some lame douchebags in the back of the room and had to pick up after one idiot that fell over drunk in his chair, knocking shit all over the floor. How they refrained from teaming up and dragging those fools out the door I don't know.

Service is just service though, although I feel bad for the guys I felt worse that night from the undercooked toppings on the pizza. Raw onions, peppers, olives, sausage, pepperoni & salami are not my idea of a good meal. That mixed with a couple of drinks made for one of the worst nights in recent memory. Thanks Victor; please cook your food.
author: Nick V.

description:
Pizza is good, fresh ingredients, crispy crust. Agree with the other review that said the simpler toppings are better.  I ordered the vegetarian, and it seemed to be a bit too much. 

Pasta was still unremarkable, so I suggest you stick with the pizza and forget the pasta.
author: Kay H.

description: Slipped in for a slice the other night. This is indeed, one of the best slices in the City; light, thin crust, nice blend of herbs, good toppings, and fast service bring it as close to New York as possible here in San Fran.   How can you resist a great slice after a night of drinking? Authentic looking joint too.  The only drawback is that slices are for "to go" only and you aren't really allowed to sit down.  There's plenty of people watching on the street in Polk Gulch that time of night, so that's not a huge problem.
author: Rick H.

description:
Before I discovered yelp, I was one of those people who was happy with my neighborhood Round Table Pizza, all you can drink soda, and MSG.  That's all that existed in my old, suburban-type neighborhood in the city. 

Now, I live in an edgier part of town where drag queens stand on street corners, block you from passing, and shout, "You're not all that," if you break their mid-morning high-heeled stride.  Since I have a soft spot for any woman who has to stand all day AND night in those frickin' high heels,  I usually shout back words of encouragement, "Hey, sexy!  Looking good!  Be safe!"  I've even thought about donating my lingerie collection from ex-boyfriends.

Ok, back to pizza.  As a former MSG addict, I thought there could be no life after quitting MSG cold turkey.  Your taste buds feel limp and less alert.  Just like Bob Dole missing his dose of Viagra.  Victor's convinced me that I can be chemical free, and yet, enjoy the cheap thrill that RTP used to provide me. 

What I like in a pizza is consistency.  Not more toppings one day and less the next.  In the past four years that I've been a customer, Victor's has maintained the same level of quality.  It is not a deep dish type of place, so your crust will be thin and somewhat soggy from all the tasty toppings.

Another plus, no Asian flavored pizzas!
author: Naomi N.

description: Just got a pizza deliverd and havent even finished eating it, before I sighned up on yelp and had to write a review! JUST WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!  Perfect crust and ultra fresh ingredients. Fast delivery, reasonable price and friendly service, both on the phone and at the door. My food was a 5 star. Perfection at its finest. I would definatly recommend this place.
author: Mr. Q.

description: New York style pizza?  Really?  Maybe if I ordered it by the slice it would have been better, which seems to be the case for pizza here in San Francisco.  I have been on the search for a good pizza place in San Francisco, and I'm sorry to say that so far I haven't found anything that rivals the pizza of LA.  But, I will still remain optimistic.  So, I went into this place, hoping once again to be delighted that I had finally found a decent pizza place in the city, only to be disappointed.   I split a medium pizza with my friend, half pesto sauce and half tomato sauce, with veggies and olives.  The pesto half was pretty bad.  I could barely taste the pesto, but instead just overly salted olives producing their own sauce as they mixed with the liquid from the pesto.  The tomato sauce side was ok.  I don't think I will be going back.
author: Madison M.

description:
good dough and crust, but thats about it. Basically, I ate salty oregano and cheese bread. 

Things to notice in finding bad pizza restaurant:

The owner speaks with a borat accent, while compensating a angry customer over the phone (NO LIE!)
The pizza maker is mexican, and the help is asian
The restaurant is dead at 10PM on a Sat night

Again... Yelpers... I couldnt be more truthful with everything I just wrote! I know I have high pizza/chinese standards cuz im from the east coast... but dont even waste your money on salty oregano cheese bread!!! Your better off at domino's.
author: Matthew Z.

description: The pizza is so-so.  It's a whopping $3.25 for a small slice at that.  It compares unfavorably to NY pizza.  One extra star was provided for the lovely neon sign.
author: Soy L.

description:
Very, very cheesy pizza!  

We went on New Year's Eve for a quick bite to eat and there was no wait.  Victor is very generous with his pizza toppings and the pizza itself was not bad.  Heck, I'd even eat it again!

Why only three stars?
-0.5  tacky table cloth
-1.5  humongous bug spotted crawling on the wall.  Ack!!  I know all restaurants have bugs but please confine them to the kitchen where I can't see.  Let me eat in ignorant bliss.
author: Helen B.

description:
Ugh, San Francisco. What to do with you?

Maybe there are too many gays, Latinos, and Asians preventing you from making a great pizza. Maybe I'm a pizza snob. Maybe you're "above it." Who knows. It just doesn't matter because I'm tired of excuses with you! 

On my never-ending quest to find some good pizza, this place falls between mediocre and so-so.
author: Brian K.

description:
My company orders pizzas here all the time because they deliver in a "timely matter"- this means when they say 30 minutes, it will arrive in 30 minutes - never let us down once.

I LOVE their veggie pizza- i just ate 3 slices the other day!
author: M W.

description:
Some how I find myself here every time I get drunk.. The food is good, well isn't any food usually good when your feeling good? 

They get only 3 stars because they charge $2 for their ranch, and if you know me I eat more ranch then I actually eat food. but i do have to admit, their garlic bread is to melt for...
author: Ashley M.

description:
This place reminds me of some of the pizza parlors in New York City.  Older, ethnic men from somewhere past the eastern shores of the Atlantic Ocean behind the counter making pizza and dishing out gruff greetings.  If you want only a slice of pizza, then don't make a move toward a table because slices are served for to go orders only.  

The tables are for the high paying customers.  On that note, there is a section of this restaurant where you could get whacked and no one would be able to tell because it is really, really dark.  

Initially, I thought "the pizza here is good," and I started to make a comparison with other pizza joints on Polk Street.  Then, I realized that within the ambit of the area that I traverse on Polk Street, there are no other pizza joints except this one.  The price is right, cheap.  Take your slice to go and into S.N.O.B a few doors down where the staff is friendly and you can enjoy a nice glass with your pizza.
author: Richard R.

description:
Great NY style pizza and it's cheap!

Need I say more?  How about this:

They sell by the slice and they're open late!! 

The place is pretty cool too because if you dare to dine in, there is great people watching.  Drunks, homeless, hipsters, crazies and trannies!  

Seriously, this place is pretty good.
author: Larry A.

description: The owner victor is one of rudest operators I have come across. After we were delivered our wings which were cold and burnt  we called back and told him the issue. He argued that this is how the wings come and there's nothing he can do! Very disappointed. Also note we are 2 blocks away an it took them 90 minutes to deliver.   Also pay attention to how much change they give you back..my gf caught them shortchanging her 2 out of last 5 times!!
author: Anthony D.

description:
Yum!
Solid Italian restaurant-not fancy schmancy..but my god they serve HOT piping HOT pasta..and pretty good slices to go!
Friendly staff and quick service and great booths.....I think I'll run down there right now actually...........
author: Chris D.

description:
Excellent and fast delivery pizza in Nob Hill!!! Great flavor with even a plain pizza pie. The crust was perfectly thin, firm, and had that right amount of crisp that would make any NJ native feel right at home. Please try this pizza is you are looking for some good anytime grub. 

GOOD JOB!!
author: Paul B.

description:
Every so often, i craveeeee & indulge in pizza.  I tried the Hawaiian pizza with ham & pineapple & the supreme vegetarian.  I prefer my pizza to be thin.... i mean extra-extra thin.  The crust here is a little thicker than what i prefer, about a good .5" thick....that's way too thick for my tastes.  This place is not bad.

The slices here didn't provide me my orgasm like Cheeseboard or Orgasmica usually do.  In other words, i left disappointed...
author: Sheryl S.

description:
I love Victors Pizza, whether I dine in and order a full pizza, get delivery, or grab a slice on the go from the front. All of the ingredients are very fresh, and the pizzas' crusts are definitely to my liking. 

My favorite pie is the veggie specialty one. However, I would suggest to keep away from the tomato topping because it makes the pizza very soggy. The Victors special is also a good choice for meat lovers!
author: Buster B.

description:
Good Pizza

Got the basic with fresh basil (dunno if they charge extra for that)
Ordered sorta late 930ish? on a Tue
Delivery came to 16.75, gave delivery person a cool Jackson and said thanks
Ate till belly full, went to sleep
author: G K.

description:
"Victor the director flips a script like Rob Reiner." --MF Doom

"Compared to Victor's other pizzerias are knob shiners." --MF Trav

Victor has tapped into the citywide tunnel network employed by King Lee's Chinese restaurant and described so perfectly here: http://www.yelp.com/biz/king-lees-chinese-restaurant-san-francisco#hrid:NK7dPb2ZCPb8Hnpo9IQBYQ Their pizza is routinely delivered to my place in 20 minutes or less, which I think is almost a little ridiculous. I tend to eye the delivery guy suspiciously, as if he's going to hand me a box of half-cooked pizza dough and raw ingredients and make a run for it. I wonder if Vic's, King Lee's, and other speedy spots I'm unaware of share the rapid-delivery tunnels amicably or if there's a whole "Mad Max" situation going on right under our feet. "Food" for thought! (Double snare. Cymbal. Blech.)

The other great thing about Victor the Slickster's is that it is consistently good. Victor comes to play every single game; there are no nights off. It's predictable in the best way possible. Just a strong, straightforward pizza. 

You should probably know that it is a thin-crust pie if that is a factor in your pizza selection process.
author: Trav W.

description:
I know Victor's probably doesn't need any more 4 star reviews...but I'm going to do one anyway.

By way of background...I'm from NY/NJ/PA area.  So I know red sauce pasta & pizza joints by heart, since I grew up around them.  I also know good red sauce joints from bad red sauce joints.

Victors is a VERY GOOD RED SAUCE JOINT.  

What the crew here does isn't something you see or taste that often...especially in San Francisco.  The pizza, pasta, and bread, here isn't packaged in a particularly fancy way, and the prices are rock bottom.

But the level of technique and attention detail that these guys put into their food is incredible.

BREAD: they fresh bake their rolls.  You can taste the difference.  I also had the pleasure one morning walking to work and seeing their guys working the morning shift (before opening) baking & preparing bread and pasta dough.  THIS IS VERY OLD SCHOOL.

PASTA: these guys are doing fresh made pasta, with the nice chewy texture that comes with it, every day, and at bargain basement prices.  You can't beat this.

Pizza: this is NY/NJ style pizza without the marketing & pretension you'd expect when someone tries to reproduce it here in California.  Even heretical forms of pizza (Hawaiian pizza with pineapple and ham) are done beautifully.  

The Red Sauce: the heart of their pizza and pasta dishes.  Get anyone of the marinara dishes, taste the sauce without touching the pasta.  Notice a kind of subtle sweetness?  This isn't from adding sugar to the sauce.  This is from using sweet tomatoes -- maybe canned San Marzano's.  I don't know where they got them -- but I'm glad they use them.

The only negatives, needs a wider beer selection.  I know they trying to keep it real.  But there's more to life than Bud..and Bud is evil.
author: Stan C.

description:
New York must really be a shit hole if pizza is the only thing worthy of praise in the Big Apple.  No one here gives a coiling turd about the way "authentic" New York pizza is supposed to taste.  If you want New York pizza, then take that shit back east.  

Whatever your subjective standards are for trek-worthy pizza, I have yet to find a more perfect pie in San Francisco than those served at Victor's.  The best pie is the Victor's Special - sausage chunks so big it would make Jenna Jameson blush.
author: C M.

description:
Pizza...GREAT!...basil, tomato, cheese, awesomeness...mmmmm

Service, great...nice guys in the restaurant.   Guys at the counter...all business...hmmm.  Not gonna mess with that.  They can act however they want with pizza like that.  

I drank soda out of a can...I was fine.  My wife drank water out of a glass.  Let's just say she had a hard time making it back over the bay bridge...I'm hoping it was an off night...but she was really, really sick....
author: Ryan S.

description:
im split

ordering a whole pizza from them is very yummy :)

ordering a slice (they do this a lot for lunch) sucks - they take an old cheese pizza slice, throw things on it & reheat in the oven - there is definitely a large gap in the taste & quality 

if you do it, order a whole pizza - you wont be disappointed. slices probably vary
author: Rah F.

description:
I love the script these guys use on the phone.  Once you've called enough, you can actually start to answer the questions before he asks them.  Has anyone else noticed this?

Him: Victor's Pizza
Me:  I'd like to place an order for delivery.
Him:  What would you like?
Me:  Medium Pepperoni
Him:  Address
Me : Blah, Blah, Blah
Him:  Cross Street
Me:  Grant
Him:  Apartment Number
Me:  #1
Him:  45 minutes
Me:  Thanks

*Question marks deliberately left out because that's how he "asks."  : )

And what bad can you say about a place that always says 45 minutes and usually gets it there in 25?  Good pizza, super cheap prices, predictable service and the surest way to get rid of your hangover.

**Update - happened to eat at Victor's recently on a Wednesday night and to my oh-so pleasant surprise, pitchers of Bud are $3.95!  We had a party of five, ordered an extra large pizza, 2 pitchers of Bud and a bottle of Sierra Nevada, the total was $32!**
author: Jessica B.

description:
The category:
Cheap eats

The seven-word skinny:
Italian portions that won't empty your wallet

The review:
Victor's has an incredible "bang for buck" factor both in terms of taste and price.  They have great East Coast-style pie that comes in four sizes and the ever-important slice format.  More importantly, their pizza is many steps up from the greasy cardboard that gets passed of at after the bars close on weekends, and you can still scrounge around for loose change to pay for it.

While pizza is their specialty, their pastas are also a great value and quite tasty.  Their salads aren't mind-blowing but it's a nice way to fill out an delivery order if you haven't eaten your vegetables since you left home.

I've ordered takeout and delivery, and I've dined at the restaurant.  The decor is nothing great and the service is acceptable, but if you just have to eat right then and there, it's mildly better than stubbing your toe.

The good:
The pizza, the portions and the delivery.

The bad:
Dining in leaves a lot to be desired, closes at 11pm so no religious slice experiences at 2:05am, delivery fee, slices are only for takeout

The notable:
They're pizza is consistently good and keeps well - microwave or toastmaster the leftovers the next day and you'll still be satisfied.

The Junius pick:
Victor's Special Pizza

The person you're dating:
Should be brought here if it's in the bag and he/she eats a lot.

The significant other/spouse:
Should be brought here if he/she eats a lot, because it's already in the bag.

The last time I was there:
March 31, 2006

The number of times I've been there:
15 or so.
author: Junius H.

description:
Great slices to-go... don't try to sit as they're quick to point you to the sign saying that slices are to-go only!

zesty sauce, thin crust, just the right about of cheese and toppings.

note: i recently ordered a whole pie, and while it was very good, by slice may be better.  By the slice, the crust is really thin, and doesn't get all moist on the bottom from all the toppings, steam, or whatever causes it.
author: shaun l.

description:
Thank you yelpers.  I now have a new favorite local pizza joint.

(let me preface this by saying I'm a NorCal native, so take that FWIW)

When I first moved here a few years ago, I tried Cybelle's on Bush (from a co-worker's reccomendation), and it was pretty frickin good, so I stuck with them for my periodic pizza needs. 

Later on, I discover yelp, and based on the "OMFG THIS IS REAL NY PIZZA, AND I'M FROM NY!!!!!" reviews for Vito's, I try them.  OMFG IF THIS IS REAL NY PIZZA, NY PIZZA SUCKS.  Seriously, if this "reminds you of 'real' pizza from back East", I'd be reluctant to eat pizza out East.  Maybe it was the bad luck of the draw, but nothing about it made me want to try it again.  

Further on down the line, I try the Front Room, and it's pretty decent, and goes in to the rotation with CoB....until a few times later, and they dump the entire bin of cheese on my pizza, so there's literally a centimeter of cheese on the damn thing.  I like cheese and all, but that was just damn gross.   OK, one goof, but same thing the next time I try them.  Aaaaand they're out of the rotation (and apparently going out of biz too...)

Back to my CoB staple, then after reading the yelp raves for Victor's, decide to give it a try.   Get the pizza delivered in under half an hour, and hesitantly start chomping down on my first slice.  A few minutes later, I look back in the box in horror, realizing I just inhaled half a large pizza.

Damn that was good.

Perfect thin (but not too thin so it gets insta-soggy) crust, not too much/little sauce/cheese, decent quality toppings, and some spices thrown on top of it too for a nice little touch.  Sure there's no fancy shmancy website to order online, no printed menus with their delivery pizzas, no computerized big brother tracking system so they can look up your address from your phone #, no foo foo virgin albino  mongolian yak cheese topping, but it's still a damn good pizza.  If this is what a "real NY pizza" is, booyah.

---update 5/07---
Okay, I've ordered from here a few times now, and it's never been as crispy good as that first time.  WTF.  One time, I ordered a pie with spinach, and it was soggy.  Fine, my bad for trying to be healthy.  Back to standard toppings the next time, and it's not soggy, but nothing really special.  Order again, and same thing.  I'm starting to think that first time, I was luckily the first (and/or only) delivery, since it was OMGWTFBBQ perfect with a crispy (not burnt/crusty/crunchy/dry) crust, and on subsequent times, it took longer to get here.  I guess it's back to the old toaster oven reheat for the good semi-fresh crust.  Minus one star for lack of consistency.
author: T C.

description:
So far the best pizza I've found in SF (Little Star IS good but overrated).  Good crust, good cheese, a little light on the sauce and not always crispy enough.  Pizza should not be impotent like Bob Dole.  It should be gravity defiant like a 14 year old boy reading the last few pages of the Gaurdian.

Anyway, what else can I say?  It's no Zafiro's: http://www.yelp.com/biz/mGMQSmTzDaL3aqdIDhDTXA

But this is not Milwaukee.  Take what you can get California...
author: Eric X.

description: Victor's gnocchi is awesome! The texture is cooked to perfection and the Bolognese sauce is absolutely fantastic! The place itself isn't the most updated one but it seemed clean and the stuff was very friendly. I am a fan!
author: Oyo S.

description:
All my days and all my pizza advetures .....

Yes I have finally found a joint that comes close to comparing to my moms old style home cooked pizza ( which she does't make anymore, which is why i have to go on these hunts)

All I can say is delicious!
author: Veronica B.

description:
From a New Yorker's perspective:  This place has their pizza half right.  It's the most important half.  This is the half that most pizza places in the city does not get.  Because of this, I'm a fan and will probably get pizza from them more often since it's 1. close by and 2. the crust is perfect.

The crust is perfectly New York --- the right crunch, the right flavor, the same char, and it folds perfectly.

Unfortunately, the cheese and the tomato sauce are a bit off and the flavors fall flat.  The cheese, in particular, taste like the sort found on cheesy breads in elementary school cafeterias.  I agree with a previous reviewer regarding the oregano --- they need to cut down the amount they put in their pies.

The fake plastic grapes, however, are pretty awesome.

****Update****
I had the pizza again and I was pretty disappointed!  The crust tasted like every other crust from any other place in San Francisco.  Was my first crust a fluke??
author: Guava C.

description: You want a great calzone?  Here's your place!
author: John W.

description: OMG. my most fave pizza by far! Every ingredient is FRESH, I could eat this for days!
author: Regine G.

description: Always a great place to grab a slice when out on Polk street :-)
author: Conor L.

description:
Wouldn't recommend taking advantage of their delivery service.

- They told me 40-45 minutes but actually took 90

- They don't seem to be aware of the concept of insulated containers and so the food did not travel well at all.  Maybe it would have been edible after 45 minutes of cooling in the backseat of the delivery car but after 90 minutes my fettucine and sauce was a cool, solid mass.

- They also seem to be unaware of the concept of waxed cardboard boxes.  They use some weird kind of unlined cardboard for the boxes holding the food and it actually porous.  Porous as in soaks up the liquid out of the sauces.  


It seems like the food would have been decent and maybe even somewhat tasty if it hadn't been so damaged in transport so I am giving them 2 stars instead of 1.
author: lisa g.

description:
This is on our list of acceptable office lunch spots.  Pizza is ok, so are the hot subs.  Other italian dishes really shouldn't be ordered.
Stick with pizza and you'll be fine.  
Insofar as atmosphere, it could use a serious face lift.
author: Nick G.

description:
Victor's pizza is SO good!  
Ingredients are really fresh, the crust is so thin and yet so crispy, and their sauce is perfectly seasoned and really comes through.  Prices are really reasonable, the service is always fast and friendly.  We have been coming here for years, 5 years at least. Every single time we come here, we comment about how the inside looks like the inside of a old fashioned Midwestern pizza joint in one of those small towns with a population of 200. OK so the table cloths in the right hand dining room are kind of endearingly ugly and the left hand dining room is really dimly lit (I love it) and the whole place kind of reminds you of an old lady's house.  So what!
The food is delicious and I have never been disappointed.  Plus they deliver and it's fast! I love this place!
author: Nilu r.

description:
Aw, crap.

I came here for lunch and had a great Italian po' boy, but I'm saying "Aw crap" because now I know after reading all the damn reviews here that I should have had the pizza.  

Lesson learned:  Yelp first, eat later.
author: Evan G.

description:
I don't understand why anyone would order from anywhere other than Victor's. Perfectly thin crust, slightest hint of Italian seasoning and yummy cheesiness. Also very affordable compared to just about any other pizza delivery place in the City.

Oh AND if you dine-in, the restaurant offers a plethora of yummy handmade pastas in a fabulously American-Italian kitsch environment...

highly recommend.
author: Carissa R.

description:
Aside from the "tacky tablecloth's" Victor's is pretty damn good pizza.  I don't ever eat tablecloths, but if I did, I would have rated it a little lower.

Generous with toppings, large portions and inexpensive to boot.  Win, win...  Win!  Don't confuse this place with any of its North Beach competition, though.  Crap wine and tiny selection of other booze makes it perfect for carry out.  I wouldn't call the inside "creepy," but its definitely not a first date kind of place!  

Fun late night and quick.  Probably one of the best in the neighborhood so give it a shot!
author: Sean O.

description:
Since my boyfriend is a local (as in born and raised SF, though most of SF are transplants anyway... what's up with that?  anyway, i digress) he took me to Victor's after we had lived here a while.  His dad lives in the TL and he spent his tender years eating in the "light" side of Victors- aka not the dank, semi-romantic hole on the left side.   So, for a twist, we ate in the "dark" side.  Mmmmm, the dark side.

Their bread is wonderful.  Freshly baked and squishy on the inside just like I likes it.  Any of their marinara sauces are also delicious, though if you're picky I'm pretty sure they use low grade ground beef in most of their dishes, so avoid the meat dishes- although, if you miss the cannelloni, well that just sucks for you, cause it's damn good. We brought our own wine and there was a minimal corkage fee. 

Then we came here for lunch with his dad and ate on the "light" side.  Fun for the whole family!

I really like this place.  It's a nice contrast to all the rest of SF's restaurants that 
a) are overpriced, 
b) spent all their money on decor so go out of business in 6 months, 
c) are filled with mindless drones whose shoes cost more than would feed a homeless person for a year
d) hire snooty waitstaff that ignore you
 
the list goes on...

Victor's is like... a crystal in the rough.  I'm giving it 5 stars in my mind, but 3 on Yelp so it doesn't get crowded and yuppified.
author: Kayla B.

description:
Next time I'll give the pasta a go, but or now I can say excellent pizza, perfectly thin crispy crust, reasonably priced, prompt service, and good Italian sausage (not those little salty rabbit turds you find at sub-standard pizza joints) so definitely hit this spot when you're in the neighborhood. 

If you're long-legged, avoid sitting in the 2-person booths that line the wall on your right as you walk in, your knees'll hit the table leg and your dining partner's. 

Charming fake grapes!
author: Tihani K.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the pizza here.  I'd rate it about 3 1/2 if I was able.  The thin new york style pizza had a nice taste crust, and good sauce...the cheese wasn't great, but over all I recommend it, especially for the neighborhood, where there isn't much else.
author: Adam W.

description: Delivery is ASAP.  Pizza may is acceptable and may be a bit greasy, but in this neighborhood, there aren't may options.  If I'm lost, let me know.
author: Mark R.

description:
their service (alone) will give you diarrhea.

i went in and ordered two slices to go.  i asked for red chili peppers to go.  they didn't have any.  instead, one of the guys unscrews a shaker and throws a big pinch on the side of the pizza.  the idiot then folds the foil over it, covering the entire slice with the mound of chili pepper.  

keep in mind that there were about 6-7 guys all hanging around the front.  so of course, he shrugged it off and set me off with them.  i thought at first that i could just scrape it off when i got home (i didn't ask them to reheat it).

when i got home, it was already soaked in by all the grease.  the entire slice was shot to shit, so i threw it away.  i called them to complain and their only resolution was for me to dig the slice out of the trash, walk back, and they'll replace it.  but i had to dig it out of the trash.

fuck that.

so i go to eat the other slice and guess what?  it gave me the runs so badly that i could've qualified for the chicago marathon.

fuck those guys.  tip for all those that plan on eating there: make sure you pick up a pair of adult diapers at the walgreen's down the street first.  your thong will thank you.
author: Sonny R.

description:
Great thin crust pizza. Me and the wife are on our nob-hill/T.L cheap eats tour and yelp led us to this little gem close to our house. After not being all that impressed by two local pizza joints, this is so far my favorite. 

We ordered the zorbra's special (sp) and a greek salad. The pizza  has pepperoni + feta + other ingredients that I am forgetting but what really stood out was the crust, which was thin and crisp and was incredibly tasty. (sure I grew up on pizza hut)  The salad was fine for pizza joint fare (I have gotten food poisoning from pizza joint salad before so maybe I set the bar pretty low) but nothing to write home about. 

Over all my favorite pizza in SF to this point. I will update as I try more places.
author: David M.

description:
I remember Victor's Pizza tasting better when I used to come here as a kid, but what hasn't changed is the stock bread they serve with the food. 

On a side note, the slanted bathroom is interesting.
author: Dan F.

description:
Just went there this evening to confirm whether I like the joint or not?
I like the place.  Although, the pizzeria does have a distinctive smell.

You have to go through the kitchen to go to the head.  This does tell you if the kitchen is clean or not.

Had a basic sausage and mushroom pizza.  I enjoyed it.
author: Randal P.

description:
Went into this no-frills pizzeria recently to share a pie with a good friend. There are 2 dining areas to choose from and we chose to go the one on the right side of the main door which is slightly elevated. It has ample room and it's not too loud which is a good thing. The loudest thing was really the "buzz" of the crowd around us.

The pizza (Victor's Special) came pretty quickly and the beers were COLD! For a pie that came out quick, it came to us nicely cooked on the bottom (sometimes and issue with pizza when you rush it). The toppings were very fresh and still a little crispy (veggies) and the meat still soft enough so it didn't break in your mouth...NICE!

New Yorkers (me) love pizza and this place delivers the goods!
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Very solid performer and reasonably priced.  Not my favorite pizza in the city, but good enough to have lured me back a few times.  A great joint to drop by after a visit to, say, McTeague's Saloon (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mcteagues-saloon-san-francisco)!  We like the Victor's Favorite, which comes with a nice balance of pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, and salami.

Haven't tried the delivery, so I can't vouch for it.  Lots of space in the dining room, though.
author: Daryl E.

description: Came in like 5 minutes before close and they were still really awesome. Even though I bought slices from a pizza that could've been made hours before I arrived, the pizza was impeccable. Nice little joint.
author: Thaddaeus V.

description: We went here because it was Sunday and alot of the other pizza joints around where we were staying were closed. So we tried them out. Not bad pricing, we got the 14'' Victor's Special and it was less than 20 bucks and loaded with toppings. It was alright, we certainly wouldnt go out of our way to make it back there on our next trip but if you live in the neighborhood or youre staying nearby then it may be worth checking out. The service was pretty bad once we ordered. I had to get up and go to the counter to get a refill because once the waiter dropped the pizza off he never came back. Overall I give it a "Eh, no major complaints."
author: Jordan M.

description:
I've lived on the East Coast, including a stint in NYC, for most of my life.  This place comes nowhere NEAR the pizza back home.  But, it is San Francisco, so I cannot judge the pizza here too harshly in comparison with other pizza places here.  The slices are a quick, albeit average, meal.  It is annoying to have slices to-go, but if you request a beer, they will let you sit down and eat your slice.  

Just a note, it is weird how I like the Fly's pizza better than any other place in this City.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
Three of us ate lunch here and two of us had to send back our original requests because they had so much garlic in them that you couldn't taste anything else.  I subsequently ate here with another friend and, once again, the garlic flavor was huge but not quite overwhelming enough to send back.

I think that the chef's taste buds must have been dulled to garlic by decades of daily use.  He should have his kitchen staff give their opinion on dishes with garlic before he prepares them.
author: Paul Q.

description:
I had some coworkers in town, and all were craving pizza after a long day at work. I had walked by Victor's many times when I lived in the hood, but had only been there once, and that was later in the evening. I thought it would be a good, SF-type place to bring my crew.

How right I was! The food was great and came quickly...be warned, the garlic bread is very garlicky, and may be too much for some folks! We mowed down our pizzas, and the one person who got the pasta pretty much licked the plate clean. 

Some of the best pizza I've had in SF...I recommend getting it well done so the crust is just a little crispy. YUM!
author: Annie F.

description:
nice furniture ugrade, keep it coming.

Victors special is just yummy.
author: Razza M.

description: Was in the mood for good thin crust pizza and this place really hit the spot.  Wife and I split a Victors Favorite which was mushrooms, pepperoni, Italian sausage, and salami.  The pepperoni and salami were big slices and tasty and the sausage was nice and spicy.  The sauce was tangy without being overpowering, and just the right amount was added.  The crust was thin, yet held up to the toppings, and the outside crust got nice and crisp in the hot hot oven.  My wife had a view into the kitchen and saw the pizza being made, excited that they just weren't thrown in until a buzzer went off, instead the cook checked, prodded, and repositioned until it was done to perfection.  Only complaint was that the soda refills aren't free.  I know how cheap fountain soda syrup is so I'm always a little irked at places that charge for soft drink refills but that won't stop me from coming back.
author: Jonny S.

description:
Horrible service over at Victor's. You know you can't sit in the dining area unless you buy a whole pizza??? After the bar, I don't want to wander down Polk eating my pizza. I want to sit down, chow and be on my way. Just seems a bit odd if you ask me.

The pizza wasn't terrible, but nothing great. Sayonara Victor.
author: Defne A.

description:
Exactly what I want in a pizza joynt. Tasty 'za, fast delivery, and the driver actually came all the way to my door (don't ask). The guy on the phone was also quite polite, asking if he could put me on hold and actually waiting for a response before doing so. Ha!

I've just had my morning leftovers, and they were all I'd hoped for.

I'm a fan. I have a feeling I'll be calling often.
author: Erich N.

description: Very good, large portions, had pepperoni pizza, chef's special salad and garlic cheesy bread. Fast service too!
author: Julie S.

description: Best NYC-Italian pizza you can get delivered in the city. Tip- Get a large whatever, ask for no oregano and ask to cut it into 8 slices. You will not be disappointed. Crust is perfect. Who cares if they have "attitude", SF GET OVER IT AND JUST ENJOY THE FRAKKING FOOD!
author: chad l.

description: This place is dirty and unpleasant.  The pizza is not bad so I'm going to at least give them 2 stars.  I guess the way to do this place is delivery though I don't like in SF.  It's not a place for kids as there is filthy garbage on the ground and in the corners of the dining area.  There might be better items on the menu I haven't tried.
author: John W.

description:
I've tried a lot of Pizza in the City , by far this is the best . period !

Me and my girlfriends wanted slices but slices where only to go  , so the waiter told us to have a seat and share a small Pie that  would only take 10 minutes to make.
Even tough they were busy  our pizza came as promised !
Outstanding fast service (asian guy was very polite and fast )
pizza omfg !!!
We will come again 



i will come back
author: Kate M.

description: Great place tucked away on Polk St.  Pasta is home made.  I suspect the sauces and soups are the same.  Service was fine.  Good beer selection.   Probably a great place for friends to meet over beer and pizza.  Definitely not a sports bar.
author: S C.

description:
OMG, my friends LOOOOOVE Victors. We ate there, sat in the Zona Romantica, and, Meh, I've had better.  And, I really, really, really wanted to love it to death, but, still, meh, I've had better.

PLUS, not sure if it was directly the fault of Victor's but, ugh, I had terrible stomach probs for a day or so afterwards.  

I don't really think I will ever ever go again.

Sorry guys!
author: Jim K.

description:
Inconsistent.  If I were just rating Victor's on its gnocci, I'd seriously consider five stars.  The gnocci bolognese was fantastic.

I was not as impressed with the pizza.  The toppings were fine, tomato sauce was reasonable, but the crust didn't do it - not quite what you'd call thin, a bit doughy.  Similar marks for a few kinds of salads we've tried there.  As someone else has pointed out, the italian dressing is pretty good.

Their fettucini alfredo was just bad.  The sauce was super-thick and tasted more like flour than anything else.  Service seems friendly, food comes out quickly, bills not quite as fast.
author: James B.

description:
This is a great pizza spot on Polk.  We usually get a plain cheese pie and it's never a disappointment!  The eggplant parmesan is very good here, too.  I'm giving 5 stars because the pizza is to drool for and the table service has always been perfect, even when they're busy.  There is one waiter who recognized us by our 2nd visit and knows our favorite dishes and drinks.  

Although some people complain about it, I like that their pizza by the slice is to-go only.  It means people who are out to dine don't get too disturbed by loud groups of drunk people.
author: k.a. Z.

description:
My favorite pizza in San Francisco... Actually, my favorite pizza anywhere in the world! I no longer live in the Bay Area, but any time I happen to be in town, I make sure to stop by. This is also the place I always recommend to friends visiting the city.

A plain cheese pie is my favorite; I love the subtle garlic taste. Great, soft crust, yummy and fresh mozzarella cheese, and tasty sauce! I recommend getting it "easy cook" too, since a few times it was a little burned for my taste.

I've eaten at Victor's many times, and the service has always been fantastic as well. It's a good spot for dinner before catching a show at Great American Music Hall or after a movie at the Van Ness AMC.

For those who like history, this restaurant has been around for decades, which is not an easy thing to do in a very competitive SF restaurant market!
author: Lisa G.

description: In SF on business and needed a late night snack. Delivery was fast and the pizza was delicious!! I highly recommend.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I really liked the pizza here. The beer selection, however, is not quite as "robust" as I would have liked it. The pasta? Don't even bother.

My only real problem is that it's so out of the way, me living in the Sunset. Oh well, there's always Pirro's.
author: Karl K.

description:
The first time I ever had Victor's my friend paid. He said that the cannelloni from victors was kinda like crack, and so he figured my first one should be free. He was right after one bite of the most delicious cannelloni ever, I was hooked.
Victor's delivers, but only to a limited area, and unfortunately we are out of the area.  So sadly I do not eat the cannelloni of my dreams as often as I would like however this is probably in the service of my health. 
I love Victor's so much that I had my last birthday there and it was perfect, one of the best.  They have the perfect little side dining room that is perfect for larger parties. To make a reservation for a large party, just call the morning of the dinner and they will take your reservations, otherwise, Victor's is no reservation, first come first serve, yet unlikely to be a wait.
The food was amazing as usual. The service was on point, even for our large rowdy and loud table! The prices of the entrees are so reasonable, and everyone was super stoked on whatever they ordered. 
The decor is super cheesy and awesome; we were graced with the amazing addition of Christmas decorations for that extra WOW factor. The Snowmen were the highlight of the evening. 
Victor's also has great pizza and awesome calzones. If you live in their delivery area Order up some Victor's ASAP. If you don't, call in an order for pick up or just dine in.
author: Kelle K.

description:
I DARE someone to just walk by the front door of this place and not get the craving for pizza or Italian food. Even if you are already full of something else.

It's a small joint, absolutely the perfect little hole-in-the-wall pizza place you could imagine being in NYC. One side of the restaurant is extremely plain with typical plastic upholstered chairs and regular lighting. But step into the area to the left when you walk in and you are again transported to a little old-school Italian joint. Which, I suppose, is what this place is. The left side of the restaurant is very dimly-lit, in red light, with tiny little booths but the atmosphere is just great for the city. 

Oh and the food. Yeah, the reason you actually come here! 

I am an east-coaster and can say that this pizza IS all you need to try in San Francisco. The crust is absolutely perfect and the sauce is the most unique I've ever had. It's like their own special signature. I don't think I'll ever be able to find it anywhere else. Its worth it!!!!!
author: Clair C.

description: I have since discovered a better place then Victor's and must now downgrade this shop.
author: lily l.

description:
Great slices when stopping in on your way home from drinks. 

Sit down meals are good, too. I've only had the pizza but was pleased. Wait staff was friendly and prompt, but it's never been too crowded when I've been there, so I can't speak to its peak-hour-performance.
author: Lara L.

description:
Viva Victor's!

Man, I love this place----especially after a long happy hour drinking session. 

I literally stumble upon this place every time I'm drinking in the area and last night I first stumbled into Mykonos thinking it was Victor's. . . good thing I didn't try to order a pizza. . . I soon realized my mistake (well, okay, let's be truthful---my friends realzied MY mistake) and headed over to Victor's for that wonderfully thin crusted pizza. Damn. .. their crust is sooo good. 

My friends and I ordered a 1/2 veggie (very fresh and crisp veggies) 1/2 mushroom, sausage and black olive. Ya know what I love about thin crust? I love hearing that crunch when I slice into it with a knife----and that's exactly what you get when you slice into a Victor's pizza. It was wonderful! We also had a nice bottle of Babera d'Asti---which at $24 was a good value and went well with the pizza.

Don't pass by this place without stopping. I don't know about the pizza by the slice, but the whole pizzas are great!
author: David R.

description:
An all-around great place.   The service is spectacular, the staff is very nice and the prices are reasonable.

If you'd like a pizza this is the place for you!
author: Ashwin K.

description:
I've got a soft spot for Victor's. 

I know the food isn't the best, but there's something about the totally unpretentious vibe of this place that I like. 

Their pizza may be better than the rest of the menu, but recently, on a cold, stressful day, I came in and ordered spaghetti with meatballs. Comfort in a bowl. 

I enjoy watching and listening to their waiter (it's always the same guy, every time I go in). He's brusque, no-nonsense, and seems like he's been working in restaurants like Victor's his entire life. He's all business, and I find that refreshing. 

To sum it all up: Victor's is a total throwback. It vaguely reminds me of the kind of EYE-talian restaurants my parents used to take me to when I was a kid. The kind of joint with chianti bottles and fake grapes hanging from the ceiling. Old-school, more than a little funky, and nothing fancy.
author: Jasmine W.

description: I have been getting take out/delivery from here for years. Note, I have only had their pizza.  My favorite pizza delivery hands down. They have an extra large (18-inch) pie, yay! Thin crust, New York style and the sauce has some zing. We usually order the extra large, double pepperoni, well done. $20, give or take a buck. They serve pitchers of soda, gotta love that. No, none of this is healthy, but whatever.  Well priced and consistent. Feel bad I have not reviewed before, it's a solid, local pizza joint. Family run and the guys are great. Try not to let the fact that they are not Italian bother you, they know what they are doing with that pizza oven. They also have slices...
author: Camille g.

description: cheap and easy, boring, but the only place like it on polk in SF.
author: Denise C.

description:
Great pizza in this little no-frills place on Polk. The service is sometimes a little slow for my taste which is why I don't give it 5 stars, but that's probably because they do it proper Italian style :)
If you like pizza you must try this place.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
As my dining companion noted, too much oregano.

But the crust is crispy and delicious.  One slice is enough.  If you are in the area then get a slice at Victor's.  Way better than Village on Van Ness.
author: Pouria Y.

description: We got the special.  One slice to-go...it was awsome.  Just how I like my crust, crunchy on the bottom and lots of toppings on top.  Very happy with my selection.
author: Sean W.

description: A little bit more expensive than some of the cheap places but well worth the extra few bucks. Great pizzas made fresh and comes out piping hot. The crust is perfect thickness and the toppings are abundant. I love meat so I got the Victor's Favorite. I swear I ate half of the extra large myself; it was that bomb!
author: Ed L.

description: Was craving a crispy crust pizza on a rainy Friday Eve so slipped into Victor's which was conveniently located to where I needed to be a short time later...What a great surprise! At 5:30 I was able to grab a dark cozy booth and ordered the Victor's Special.  Service was delightful...fast & friendly.  The Pizza was delicious--Hot & Crispy Thin Crust! The House Salad was delcious but make sure you like Vinegar if you order the Italian dressing! I loved it.  I'll definitely go back--even if I have to drive a little out of my way to get there.  Great Waiter...Handsome & Charming and very attentive at all times.  Very reasonably priced.  Thanks Victor's...I'll see you again soon!
author: Elayne L.

description:
Mostly delicious pizza.  Sauce is a little garlic-ky, but delicious.  No thick pies here.   

I love the shadowy interiors of the "main" dining room.  Love the booths with lumpy seat springs.   Feels like nothing has changed since they opened in 1954.    Love the neon outside.   It's a proper old-tyme joint.    When I miss NY (like right now), this place makes me feel comfortable.   But usually I'm too lazy to waddle over there, so I call.   

ONE suggestion Victor's:  you gotta do something about the chicken parm, its lousy.  You have a long way to go, but with a little effort I think you can do it.
author: purple z.

description:
Nice pizza joint and the food is really tasty and the service is good as well. We ordered the small clam and garlic pizza and it came out really quickly, which was nice because we were starvin' like marvin! In my opinion, the 12" is just enough for two people.. but you can order more, they have pasta and other items too.

It was very delicious- especially being fresh out of the oven. I'm sure the clam was excellent and I love me some garlic but there was a little too much in the pizza vs. the clam and we ended up with icky garlic breathe until the next day.

It's close to my house and i'm happy to know that they deliver. will visit again!
author: Natalie N.

description:
I'd have to give it 3 stars. 
- 1 for the creepy inside (the booth was broken and the table cloth was tacky.
-1 for the super cheesy cheese. We had mushroom and pepperoni and it would have been 50 times better had it not been slathered in cheese. I would definately try it again and just order it with light cheese. :)

Also. might try it for take out
author: Annie M.

description:
Good pizza and great price! The crust was delicious. My friend and I ordered a medium veggie pizza and we ate the whole thing. Mmm. Our craving for pizza and beer was fulfilled.

The wait service was good but not very attentive. Oh, and be aware that they recently remodeled and the seats in the booth (that seats 4) does not accommodate average/skinny people. Only anorexic people can sit in the booths but I doubt they'd be going to a pizza joint in the first place.
author: Stephanie L.

description: had quality problems in past so i stayed away from their pasta dishes.  until this evening.  ordered pasta with meat sauce.  opened container and layer of water on bottom than noodles and then sauce.  did not drain pasta after cooking.  called to victors.  they sent out another order.  still with some water, but not as bad.  watch your delivery orders.  or make sure when ordering you tell no pay for bad food.  help stop this madness in our city. jmo
author: jerome m.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting the Bay for New Year's and Victor's was right by our hotel. We were just walking around and decided to eat here. The pizza it was so tasty and the prices weren't bad either. Service was okay, but as long as the food's good - it's ok.
author: Kristine W.

description: Best pizza in the city, so far that I've had. Thin SOFT crust that doesn't go soggy. Not too greasy. Not too salty. Goes down light and fills you up right - not too heavy on the tummy. Just try a slice of plain cheese and you'll quickly become a convert. I used to live on Russian Hill and still go out of my way to order pizzas from Victor's.
author: Karin B.

description: Fast delivery, cheap pizza, delicious. If you don't feel like cooking, then Victor's the place to call.
author: Bryan C.

description:
Pizza - 8/10. You can taste the freshness in the ingredients. The sauce is unique and tastes spectacular.The crust is NY style..almost close to what you get with wood burning ovens. 

Delivery - 10/10 . It's just great when you get a pizza delivered piping hot just like it is in the restaurant. 

I would give it 5 stars but 30$(including tip) for a large Victor's special delivered is a little on the expensive side. They do not have any coupons or specials. But I guess when the quality and service is this good you can pay a little more.
author: Kaushick N.

description: A total hole in the wall that you probably wouldn't even realize was that big if you were strolling down Polk.  Celebrating more of Julia's bday, a few of us decided to hit up this place.  The atmosphere is great for a nice relaxing dinner - this would be a great place for a date.  It was intimate and cozy but not too much so.  We started off with a delicious caesar salad and Meredith and I split a mouth watering pizza.  Julia had a calzone that was huge and she loved it.  It was a great dinner spot and was so reasonably priced.  Good bang for your buck!
author: Arica V.

description:
My favorite pizza in the city, and the closest to East coast pizza as I've been able to find.  The price is great and the staff is quiet but very nice.

I usually sit in the cave that is the back room, and I like the dark, but I don't think it would kill them to turn a light on back there during the day.  

I'm sorry to say it, but I just don't think a West coast pizza place is going to get 5 stars - but Victor's is damn good eatin' nonetheless.
author: Chuck C.

description:
As a consumer of Victor's Pizza for years (I used to live a five minute walk away), I can confidently say that their cheese pizza is the shizzle!
Simple, sprinkled with fresh italian parsley and hot upon delivery.
I love that they will still deliver to me out by USF in 20 minutes (25 max)!
author: Heather P.

description:
Whoa, this might be it.  I've been searching for the best crust and most authentic pizza in the hood...this might be it.  This place rocks, son!  

Went there last night after hearing so much about the pizza... enjoyed a Greek salad and a pepperoni/mushroom pizza.  Big portions for a fair price, and the best crust around!  Next test is delivery.  God, I hope they deliver to my house.
author: Louis M.

description:
Love love the pizza here.  My husband's from NY and says this is the best he's found here in the bay area so far......geez them New Yorkers are so picky!....but hey, I like it too!  The cheese actually melts nice and gooey....YUM!!!  The place doesn't look that great from the outside, but it is definitely a hold in the wall that I would recommend.

I ordered their pasta for the first time.  I ordered the linguini pesto and I was very impressed to learn that they make your sauce to order.....it is a little refreshing to know it's not drizzled on from a big batch of sauce that's sitting in a pot all day.....especially pesto or alfredo.

We will definitely return!
author: Michelle S.

description: I've been Yelping for a few years now, but this is my first review. Victor's is by far The Best pizza in the city. Go with the Pepperoni, sausage,  jalapeño, and extra sauce. Take it home and throw it in your own oven for an additional 5-7 minutes at 475 degrees. Take it out and enjoy your extra crispy masterpiece.
author: Joey V.

description:
a serious good spot for some late-late night munchies after a night out in nob hill. they are open super late and serve up great food. i had heard so much about the pizza, but that will have to wait for next time.

i was set on ordering either pizza or pasta, until i turned the menu over and saw the sandwiches. not just were they super cheap(under $10), but each sandwich came with soup or salad and pasta! my minestrone soup was very good. the pasta was also delicious especially with the home-made marinara which had a very distinct taste to it. 

i had to take my sandwich to go because i was already stuffed from the soup, bread, and pasta. i definitely enjoyed it the next morning. it was delicious and packed with flavor. i forget which chicken sandwich i got, but i doubt you can go wrong with any. the bread used was garlic bread and it made the sandwich that much more tasty.

the service was great and you can't do much better past midnight. this was definitely not my last time going here.
author: Andrew T.

description: Can't beat fresh pizza and made the right way. Our first time here, I'll be honest, we were drunk and it was the only thing open late at night. Ok, only I was drunk. I was pleasantly surprised because of the quality and the sauce. We got Victor's Special and we ate it up. Now, we're back and this time all sober and still enjoy the atmosphere, and most of all, the pizza.
author: Joel S.

description: Really good pizza, and probably the best in the area, but pretty expensive compared to Dominos/Pizza Hut/etc. But then again it's a local place and the pizza is delicious. You can grab a slice, order to go, or have them deliver to you. The inside is pretty dark and not very remarkable.
author: Jackie C.

description: Remarkably good pizza for San Francisco, especially if you reheat it and make it nice and crispy. The sauce is nice.  It's a little expensive, and a far cry from NYC, but you gotta do what you gotta do.
author: Andrew K.

description: Dig the slices - I'm a west-coaster and don't get what all the fuss is about NY style pizza (Chicago deep dish - I get).  Anyhoo - they've got tasty slices.  But, the review is really for the eggplant parmesean sandwich.  The thing is, it's really that they don't use gigantic hunks of bread that end up smothering the eggplant - they are reasonable slices of sourdough with tasty melty cheese all over.  Yum, Yum!!
author: Mac M.

description: Good neighborhood pizza joint.  Like their over stuffed sausage and mushroom pizza, for a carnivore treat.  I heard they may get a little greasy at times so depends on the cook.
author: Jim J.

description:
Best pizza in sf.. Hands down

Friendly service 


Amazing for hangover sunday

or hangover monday!
author: Ray W.

description:
TB had been here before and suggested that we (moi, Hubster, Hot Rob, Mighty Micah) go here for dinner before our viewing of The King of Kong, Fistful of Quarters at the Lumiere.

We had to wait for Hot and Mighty (hmmm, that sounds bad) so we grabbed a table in the half empty dining room and ordered beers and garlic bread. There are two dining rooms, one was very dim and had leather lined booths, the other (the one we were in) a bit brighter with odd pictures on the walls and what seemed to be folding tables. Waiter was really nice and never rushed us, pretty attentive too. 

Good garlic bread, sliced into small pieces (basically bite sized) plenty of garlic but not quite enough butter or cheese for this heifer.

When Hot and Mighty arrived they ordered more beers and placed our order: Rigatoni w/Marinara and Meatballs (me), Lasagna (Hubster, his staple), Cannelloni (Mighty), Meatball and Sausage Sammich (Hot) and Cheese Ravioli w/Pesto and Sausage (TB).

Some got salad, some got soup. The soupers complained of luke warm soup and the saladers were disappointed in the lack of salami even though there was cheese present. The obviously homemade bread was warm but I can't account for taste since I didn't have any. Hubster liked it though.

The servings are hefty here, it looked like I hardly made a dent in mine but had to unbutton my pants at the movies all the same. I sampled a bit of TB's ravioli and the pesto was really good, very garlicky and green. Hubster demolished his lasagna and I didn't even see Hot's sammich before he ate it all. Everyone seemed pleased with the food.

Took a while to get the check but that was really the only downside of the meal. Everything else was super.

Lots of take out orders during our 2 hours there and quite a few families came in for dinner.

The bathroom was through the kitchen (which I hate, always afraid I'm going to slip and fall) and it was a bit dingy and dank, nothing too bad though.
author: Christine K.

description: We went to Victors after seeing many good reviews on Yelp and I'm very happy to report that I'm glad you all gave this place such great reviews.  The service was extremely fast and all four of us were quite happy with the pies that came to our table.  The sauce tastes fresh and bright.  The vegetables were chopped and diced recently and the Coke and beer was cold.  What more could you ask from a pizza joint.  I just wish I lived close enough to get them to deliver to me.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I love delivery.  And this place was pretty good.  Thin, crispy crust and generous toppings.  I ordered pizzas for a meeting and everyone liked it so much they demanded that I keep the menu for next time!

I got the Victor's Favorite, the Zorba, and two custom (fresh tomatoes and pepperoni; eggplant, basil, garlic, basil, tomatoes, and pepperoni)  All of them seemed to disappear quickly between the 12 or so people except for the custom one with eggplant.  Whatever, I thought it was really good.  And I'm the decision maker so they can just deal with it.  Or I'll bring it home with me for my beggar.

Overall, it was pretty good.  Not the BEST pizza I've ever tasted, but then again anything that gets delivered has been out of the oven longer than something you eat at the restaurant.  I'll be returning.
author: Mari C.

description:
Good Pizza gives it three stars...We ordered a pepperoni and mushroom pizza, mushrooms didnt taste like dry cardboard...i was satisfied

The extra star is for the delivery
They said that it would take 40 minutes to deliver...it only took 25 minutes!  Now i dont know if this is just a tactic of lowering my expectations...but i was totally shocked at how early the guy rang the buzzer.

I have yet to see what the actual place looks like...but this will surely be my go to spot for delivery.
author: Gladys D.

description: One of the best pies in the city, but the atmosphere is utterly lacking.  I still try to hit Victor's whenever I am out on Polk Street.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Love it! Love it! Love it!
I was introduced to this place by my brother.  On a Wednesday we where ready to catch a Giants game and came here for some pizza and beer.  We had the Victor's Special.  Thin crust, flavorful sauce and veggies where crunchy and not over cooked.  Very good texture and flavors all around.  Now on Wednesdays not sure if my brother planned it but Victors has Budweiser pitcher beers for only $3.95 .  Now that's a deal. Instead of going to the game and buying $7.00 cups of beer. We had 3 pitches! I couldn't do anymore besides I was pretty happy during the game.  Victor's is a good find for pizza in the city.
author: David P.

description: Good place for a hand-tossed pie. Nice amount of fresh toppings, not as pricey as some of the other places in the area.
author: Jon M.

description:
I think Victor's has the best pizza in the city. And I love the low lit, checkered tablecloths, with authentic family style italian food. Delicious, delectible, and worthy of both eating there and getting take out frequently. I agree, part of the charm is the neighborhood appeal, but also the possibility that the mafia may be cooking back there in the kitchen.

What I also love about Victor's is they understand the LOVE of garlic. Lots of it. To the point that it's more like garLICK. The pastas are also most excellent, in that endeavor.
author: Risa F.

description:
Excellent Food! The food was extremely tasty and with prices in line with what most italian places charge.

The garlic cheese bread was too garlicy. I understand it's called "garlic cheese bread" but it was too much. we even had it sent back and the 2nd batch was too much.

Their beer selection isn't very good but the wine selection is nice. They don't offer refills on sodas like Diet Coke but water is plentiful.

Overall, not so bad but the refils policy is kind of a downer.
author: Adam C.

description:
I ordered from Victor's when Uncle Vito's is closed. It's not my favorite pizza, but Victor's was a saving grace for me when I had to provide pizza to NYC author Peter Straub and crew -- they gave Victor's the highest compliments, and they are used to NYC pizza. 

As I said, though, they aren't my first choice for pizza.
author: Darren M.

description:
Over a year in the city, and I am still on a search for decent pizza that would deliver in SoMa...  The previous chapters of the saga are depressing but feel free to peruse my other reviews.

Enter Victor's Pizza. Being a netizen, I was a bit disappointed in no readily available web page but quickly found their menu on menupages. We decided to go simple as to run a consistent comparison among joints: a medium cheese pizza with feta and garlic bread. Called in at 7 PM on a Friday night; promised wait -- 45 minutes. Actual wait -- about 45 minutes, high five. Next pleasant surprise: our order was $19 and change; I ended up overtipping the dude out of pure joy.

Onto the food: the garlic bread has GENEROUS amounts of garlic and is made in small slices from baguette-type bread, nice and crunchy. Victor's:1, Competitors with giant soggy garlic bread slices: 0

Pizza: nice size with feta spread evenly and not chuncked up. Zesty sauce, a bit on a salty side (which I love), the crust could have been crispier which is probably less of an issue if you dine in.

Verdict: not out of this world but definitely the best delivery pizza brave enough to venture all the way to Folsom street.  Extra brownie point for being reasonably priced!
author: Gina M.

description: Great pizza.  The old-school small booth seating is a plus.  Good root beer.  Service ok.
author: Michael W.

description: We ordered a tomato basil pizza to share for two girls.  It was perfect as we both got to pig out 3 slices each.  The pizza is super cheesy and you'll be able to tell because it will be hard to get a slice on your plate without cheese going everywhere.  I have lived 3 blocks away for like 3 years and just yelped this spot.  I will probably go again if I have a pizza craving and don't want to venture out.
author: Vicky C.

description:
Still need to try the pizza (obviously), but the sandwiches are damn good. Tried the italian combo and the meatball and both were hot and fresh. It also came with a great salad with tons of ingredients and a side of pasta with meat sauce. This place is legit, can't wait to come back for the pizza...

Update: the pizza is good, but the Chicken Parm is even better...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Dear Victor,

Why you gotta throw a brother out right after he gets a slice?

Is coo though cause you always come over real quick when I call.  Nice n hot with some fine ass crust.  Saucy.

- C
author: Codester H.

description:
I stopped by on my way down to the Buccaneer-I needed to get something in  my system before I got sloppy drunk, and I figured a piece of pizza would do the trick. Plus it's so close to my house,  I had to stop in-I'd passed too many times.

I ordered a slice of cheese and mushroom to go, so did my friend. We waited about 3 minutes when our slices came out-we grabbed and started walking without looking down at the slice-BIG MISTAKE. About a half a block down I realized that although the mushrooms were plentiful and fresh, they were also raw. Raw mushrooms on a thin crust pizza-not so good. I beelined for a trash can and turned over the slice-all but about 10 shrooms immediately fell off. 

For a cheese pizza it wasn't half bad-really thin and crispy crust-just the way I like it. For a mushroom pizza it sucked.
author: Leesa P.

description:
I went in for a margarita pizza over the weekend and got something that had cheese but no basil. I looked at the pizza, then back at the waiter: 
Me: we ordered a margarita pizza...
Waiter: nodding at the pizza - Si, margarita pizza.
girl: maybe the basil is buried in the cheese, see it's kind of green around the edges...
Me: ok...I guess...

The pizza was pretty good, the cheese was nice and flavorful and it was nicely seasoned. The crust was a little doughy, but decent enough. As a bonus, it's pretty good the next day as well. It isn't quite as good as East Coast pizza, but it's pretty good by California standards.
Now if only that girl hadn't broken up with me the next day, I don't think it was the pizza's fault though.....
author: Russ C.

description:
This has been a long time favorite of mine since before I lived in SF. Great pizza, any topping you want, by the slice is AWESOME. 

Somehow they are able to make thin crispy pizza that doesnt have alot of grease....

I love Victors Pizza.....

An friend's Mom used to come here back in the early 70's and I guess not much has changed...I live near Alamo Square, and I go out of my way to go get Victor's.....that's how good it is.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
OHH how I wish you could give 1/2 stars on Yelp!  BLAST!  

I would've given this place 3 1/2 stars.  I came here awhile back with my man and it's really good.  The pizza is tasty and as I recall they have specials, like salad and pizza together.  The place is small and not dirty per se but definitely not clean.  I like my restaurants like SUPER CLEAN.  But at the same time, its not like this place was disgusting.  I guess I just have high standards.  I should've looked at their score from the department of health.  I'm sure it was fine.

Anyway, the pizza was good and super filling.  The waiter was really attentive and friendly.  We were the only people there so we had a lovely conversation going.  I would definitely come again, but its not my favorite place in town.
author: Angela S.

description: As good as I remember it!!!  I started going to Victor's when I was an undergrad at Cal. I moved away and then moved back to SF so I didn't go to Victor's for at least 15 years.  The pizza and salad are as good as ever. Fresh toppings and crisp crust are their strengths.  4 solid stars.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Best pizza place in San Francisco, bar none. Nice guys, great food, great portions.

Have ordered from here multiple times, guys are always helpful on phone, salads and great extras. Pizzas are top-notch thin crust beauties loaded with toppings. See pictures below for the Victor's Special, my favorite, comes with 7 toppings.

Great for delivery.

Eat-in is nice as well, great pastas and romantic seating in the dark room or light room for big groups. Cheap beer on tap. Try the Burro sauce.


This is the type of pizza place that doesn't exist anymore in this crappy commercialized and renovated world folks, go there.
author: Jeff H.

description: rude service mediocre pizza.  disappointed to say the least as i live close by.
author: Alison M.

description: waited 1hr and 15min for delivery. ordered fettucine alfredo and got bland goo w/ noodles. the soup was put into a chinese take out box. c'mon really?!?? didn't come with any napkins or utensils. only thing that was decent was aloe juice i got from lee's sandwiches!
author: Del O.

description:
Okay, so I love pizza in general.  That's not to say my standards are low, but that I have a deep and undying appreciation for the whole range of pizza possibilities (cracker thin crispy crust to stuffed pizza pies).

I love Victor's pizza.  The crust is on the thinner end of the spectrum, and the cheese is delicious.  The ambiance is super casual - no frills, checked tablecloths, dim lighting.  

Minus one star (trust me, I really hate to do this) for having apparently inaccessible bathrooms (someone correct me if I'm wrong, but it looked like you'd have to go through the kitchen and down a flight of stairs in the back).
author: katie m.

description:
My personal favorite for to go slices. Yes, the topping are fresh, and often don't get cooked all the way through. But I can live with that. And I do. Gladly. 
The thin crust. The garlicy sauce. The cheese. All top notch.
author: Chadwick M.

description:
I love Victor's! 

I'm a devout carnivore and their all meat pizza never fails to deliver. It's all about the quality of the toppings people and Victor's comes through in spades. 

They never take to long to deliver down to me in the TL and they also have  some pretty tasty Italian fare to offer for delivery. 

If they were just a little cheaper they'd get five stars from me but hey this ain't no shit Domino's pizza so don't expect the 5-5-5 deal I guess right?
author: Tommy P.

description:
I like the Victor's Pie.  Solid and I order it on occasion but there are a few pizza's I prefer around the city and a few that I don't necessarily prefer but that deliver much more quickly and for less loot.

Last night was craving Lasagna and decided to order from Victors because I was too lazy to walk to Parma and pick it up.  When it came I wasn't sure if it was supposed to be soup or lasagna.  It was basically just a big tray of meat sauce with a couple of noodles mixed in. 

That said it wasn't bad, a bit greasy and a bit garlicky but I took it down and was quite content afterwards.  Girlfriend got the eggplant parm which was a bit better than the lasagna.  It was a super indulgent meal and I probably would just get a pizza next time but all and all it was decent.  

Unfortunately it didn't take care of the lasagna bug and I still have to go to Parma.
author: Eamonn T.

description:
Good stuff- I had the meat special.  I rounded up as I really want to give them a 3.5 star.   The crust was a bit burnt.

I regularly get my pies at Vito's- but will likely hit Victor's more.   

I have yet to hit Goat hill...but both Vito's and Victor's have nothing on Orgasmica.
author: Rob C.

description:
was looking for a pizza delivery place the other day and saw great reviews on yelp for victor's.

ordered a large half-hawaiian and half-pesto & sausage.  the pie was pretty good, thin crust, and hit the spot.  also, the pizza was large enough to feed me for THREE meals (which is a lot more than i can say about a lot of other pizza joints in SF).  but that's not the best part...

the best part is that the whole process of ordering, delivery, and payment of my pizza TOOK ABOUT 30 minutes.  in the city, that's crazy!  also, the large pizza, after tax and tip, was UNDER $30.  overall good experience with victor's.
author: dan a.

description: I would have to say this place is one of the best pizza joints in the city. I like that fact that they serve thin crust and they use freash quality ingredients. At times the wait can take a while but it is well worth it. A must try for all the people who love pizza and dont like eating that franchise pizza crap.
author: Art N.

description: Mediocre pizza, served with a bad attitude at $3.50 for a cheese slice. Never again!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Victors has been my "go to" place for pizza for almost 20 years.  Great thin crust and nothing dominates the pizza.....it is all good.  All meals have plenty of food and are delicious.
author: Arthur S.

description:
For some reason everyone has always raved on about Victors pizza. It's ok, but I feel like what makes them stand out are their pastas combined with their delivery and lack of a website/online delivery operation, regardless of their popularity. One of the unique slices to get on Polk, if you crave limp 'herbish' seasoned pizza then go for it. (Here I'll sprinkle some dried oregano on my boot.... bite?) It is good and most of the time will be crispy, but for crispy cheaper tasty slices I'd go to the nearby Pino's. 

Their Cannelloni is great as is the gnocci. The service is good.
author: Eugene G.

description:
Victor's has been around since 1954!
Haven't tried the pizza (I will one of these days) but the Chicken Marcella is delicious,( cooked in a sweet wine sauce, with  mushrooms and fresh al dente vegetables.) Comes with a choice of soup or salad, and a side of pasta. Nice and attentive waiter too.
author: chris m.

description:
When I first moved here I was relieved to find a place that serves fairly authentic east coast pizza. 

They have yummy slices and great sammys. For ordering out you get a great deal with your choice of sandwiches, soup / salad and their fresh cooked rolls (make sure to ask for these). They have these little rolls that are flour dusty and super crunchy you heat them up with a little pad of butter.

The staff is always super nice here and courteous. I love their window where you can look in and see them cooking the pizza pies.

I don't eat here as much as I used to, part of which has to do with the realization you can't really get real east coast pizza in SF, but Victors is proper. I recommend it!
author: Andreas T.

description:
A slice or whole pie,
Pitchers are cheap on Wednesdays,
Hot tasty goodness.
author: Brian J.

description:
I'll be honest, I don't like pizza all that much...especially the NY style. I know it's awful to admit, being a New Yorker. I don't fold my pizza, either. 

I DO, however, love Italian food, and have a tendency to always order the same couple things - Eggplant Parmigiana, Penne ala Vodka (impossible to find out here!?), and stuffed shells / manicotti / ravioli.

I have only tried the Eggplant Parm at Victor's, and it is so good I don't think I'll ever even bother with the other stuff. A perfectly filling, juicy portion with just the right amount of cheese and sauce (I don't like TOO much sauce), and it always tastes super fresh.

Num Num NUM!
author: Heidi G.

description: Best of both worlds - slice pizza efficiency up front and restaurant in the rear.  $3 for a cheese slice and they serve beer.  It's thin, crispy, and they add oregano which I like as well.
author: Jeff J.

description:
this pizza is incredible. the crust is thin and crispy, the cheese is melty and gooey, and there is a nice amount of oregano on it. there is also a great ratio of crust to cheese to sauce. mmm.....

i can only say i am kind of sad i found this place because it means i will be consuming 2 huge slices of pizza after every visit to hemlock. as if 3 glasses of racer 5 didn't have enough calories in them already...
author: Rachael S.
