description: On one hand, it's nothing special, just your average 3$ NY-style slice of pizza. Except it's so much more. Because that alone is so delicious, and even harder to come by in San Francisco. Sometimes it's nice to take a break from wild nettles on one's pizza.
author: Mark A.

description:
1.  I haven't tried the pizza
2.  I have tried the gnocchi (delicious), the eggplant parmigiana (scrumptious), the beef raviolis (yum), noodles with pesto sauce (fantastic), and their bread sticks, which are made from homemade pizza dough (I likey)
This place is great.  Where else can you get a fresh, homemade meal that comes with bread and soup or salad for $10.95, that's big enough to provide food for two?  Love it!!!
author: Raegan T.

description:
Great pizza! 

Top two personal faves in SF are still

1) Giorgios
2) Victoria's Pizza

But this will be #3 until I find better.

Positives: Thin crust, non-greasy, GREAT herbs that I have yet to find on other pizzas. Reasonable. Never crowded. Good service.

Negatives: Kinda icky bathroom, crust doesn't really have any flavor.
author: Kristi D.

description:
I visited Victor's pizza on a rainy day on my way home from work, based on a recommendation from a friend.
I stumbled in and asked for a slice, and right away he laid out the details.  It's was something like 2.75 for a slice of cheese pizza and 25 cents for each topping.
Perfect.  I'm a pineapple and onions topping only girl.
So for $3.25, I got a slice of pizza, which was heaping with my favorite toppings, was the perfect temperature, and extra cheesy.
Not to mention I was on my way again in 5 minutes.
I will definitely be swinging by here again.
author: Tara F.

description: Meh...not impressed at all. Unfriendly service and I've had WAAAAY better pizza and service at Bellissimo. Came here for something new and because of the reviews. Ordered Veggie special. Veggies were uncooked pretty much cold and raw still and overpowered by a lot of raw garlic. Won't return.
author: Chauanh D.

description: I write this review after having two different pizzas' from other places in the city that were both substandard. We had coupons and though why not give them a try. It was a bad mistake. I think Victors makes the best pie in San Francisco. My girlfriend and I regularly order from Victors when we want our pizza fix. I wont eat the crust from most places. It is usually tasteless and takes away from the overall pizza. Victors crust is great. Make sure to get the pizza well done. It adds some crunch to the crust.
author: Brian P.

description: Finally a pizza place in SF that I can say makes an ALL around good slice of pizza. From the crust to the dough to the toppings, Victor's has it all. I ordered delivery, and when you do you expect your pizza to be on the warmer side and the crust to be a little soggy from sitting, but I was wrong. The crust and dough has the perfect texture between crispy and chewy. The toppings are fresh and plentiful. I would rate Victors a 4.5 star if I could.
author: Nick C.

description:
i am with the prior reviewer Megan L., this place isn't good. I had a pasta dish, and the odd taste Ms. L. mentioned below is clam sauce mixed into the tomato sauce, either due to neglect or bizarre recipe, which creates an acidic and spoiled garlic flavor. Bad sauce. This is a crap faux home-style Italian restaurant that's just been around a long time, it hasn't been good a long time. 

I had one piece of pizza a while back, and it was OK, but I wouldn't go here again in light of the many alternatives on Polk Street within two blocks.

Lastly, the bathroom is an accident waiting to happen, and they must be paying off the city inspectors because it is a complete fall hazard more than 20% grade within three feet.. It was also filthy and the kitchen was not clean which you will see if you walk to the bathroom.
author: Andrew Z.

description: DELISH! Love this place! Yes, the crust is amazing, but the toppings are also fab!!!!! The Victor's Special (I think that's the name) is combo perfection. And they deliver and it's HOT when it arrives. We ate in one time and my only complaint was the wine list: pretty boring and expensive. But still......great spot.
author: Kristin B.

description:
dear victors pizza ,

I always order delivery from you and stop in every few weeks for a few slices during the day and sit and enjoy. Last night when it was cold out I spent over 20 bucks ( more than ordering a regular sized combination pizza) and your place was empty yet you would not let me and my friend sit and eat inside because we ordered slices. 

In fact you were rude that we even wanted to sit while waiting.

This has cost you any and all of my future business.

Why chase off customers during economic tough times?
author: g m.

description: decent pasta and salad, haven't tried the pizza, but I hear it's good.  I had the seafood linguine in a pink sauce, which was pretty heavy.  the clams were from a can, which was disappointing, but the shrimp and scallops (Small bay scallops) were good.  I'd go again, but don't expect gourmet.
author: Sage S.

description: Been here a few times and I can safely say after the last time that this is the worst pizza and worst service.  They served me a cold slice and told me to eat it outside.  Can't beat that.
author: A K.

description: GREAT delivery, great food, tastes like homemade!!!! garlic bread is unreal!
author: David R.

description: I was hungry; salad was good; pizza was even better; service was just as swell. You aint going wrong with Victors!
author: Vivek N.

description: Pizza is delicious AND they deliver!!! This is the BEST delivery I've found in the city (mind you, I'm East coast and picky)! I don't recommend the meatball sandwich for delivery but maybe that's just me. Salad was good though & I was shocked that the meatball sandwich came with a side of pasta, so whole other dinner was included! Love this place - thanks to my friends for recommending!
author: Gwen V.

description: Best NY style pizza in SF, says this New Yorker. Really quick delivery (usually.)  Cozy, divey place to eat in. People that work there are uniformly nice. Non-pizza is decent (really good for a pizza joint, but not as good as a full-on eye-talian restaurant.)
author: bill d.

description:
All I have to say: Victor's Special.

Get it- Now.

Yummy Yummy in my tummy.  Too bad I just discovered I'm allergic to milk.  No matter- I'll make the sacrifice for Victor's.
author: mos d.

description:
Victor's is super yum.  It is my new neighborhood favorite pizza.  I love the bread they give you with your soup or salad.  I think the secret at victor's is they have awesome crust.  It is seriously some of the best crust I've ever had.  This is definitely a birthday dinner destination, they cater well to large rowdy groups of people.  And, like my old neighborhood favorite pizza place, Bella, they are always kickin' out the soft rock jams with KOIT!  Gotta love it!
The beer night special is hard to beat, and they have peroni and moretti in bottles.  The house burgundy is not my favorite ever jug wine, but it'll do.
author: melissa r.

description: ordered victor's specal pizza and finished the small one in one sitting becuase it was that good!! Will come back again when i am back in the area
author: Jose R.

description: Awesome pizza that comes out quick, hot, and tasty! I have been going to Giorgios on Clement St. for over 20 years. I decided to try Victor's out as it was rumored that it was owned by a pair of brothers. The pizza is practically the same. They have the same things on the menu. My favorite is the Victor's special. It's jam packed with goodies and isn't overly salty. The meats and veggies are really fresh!
author: Bobby D.

description:
Great fucking Pizza! 

Thin crust with just the right amount os sauce and cheese. And the crust tasted so good. I wish I had known about this place a long time ago.
author: Noah K.

description: We came in here for a rushed pre-movie dinner.  The service was so wonderful, I'm inclined to give them 5 stars on this alone.  My friend and I ordered the eggplant parmigiana sandwiches, which I don't think I'd recommend, but the pasta was great (tasted home made) and the salad was fresh.  We ate our weight in bread as well, and came out of there so stuffed it was hard to waddle back down to the movie theater.  I'll come back to try the pizza.
author: Laura S.

description:
I moved to SF just a few months ago and have been looking for a great pizza place to remind me of the new york style pizza you can get in college towns across america.  After I graduated from college, I didn't think it would be difficult to find another place with pizza just as good as the local joint in my small college town - especially since I was moving to Chicago, a city famous for it's pizza.

Well, I was wrong.  I was so displeased with Chicago style pizza and their many failed attempts at doing NY style pizza.  I was praying that I would be able to find a good place once I moved to SF (I should note that my move from Chicago was not due to their lousy pizza - obviously).

Victor's Pizza has proven that one can get big wonderful slices of heaven even after college (so long as you're not in Chicago!)  My only request when I order from here is that they go easy on the oregano b/c sometimes I find it overpowers the delicious cheesiness.  Thank you San Francisco and Victor's!
author: Julia J.

description:
This might be a long review so feel free to get comfortable.  I have been stopping by Victor's for a slice of pizza for a very long time.  Granted it's not the best pizza by the slice, but it's does the trick.  They also were nice enough to accommodate a large group of us for pizza weeks ago.

So why the one star you ask.  Well here's the story:

My friend and I had tickets to see a show.  Unfortunately, work and traffic got in our way and we were unable to attend.  But that wasn't going to stop us from at least trying to have some fun.  We decided we both wanted Italian, something within walking distance and some place where we could have some wine.  Victors was the obvious choice.   We were told to sit anywhere we like.  We chose the darker side of the restaurant where there are these little single type booths.  Now I'm fairly petite but these seats made me feel enormous.  My friend and I quickly changed to the booths in the middle of the restaurant.   Sure we giggled for a bit about the fact that those booths were ridiculous in size, but we were ready to get our food on!  So we order.  I order the rigatoni with bolognese sauce.  She orders the gnocchi with pesto.  We both get a salad (the waiter informs us that a soup or salad comes with the pasta). 

First we get the salad.  The salad is smothered in dressing.  OK fine...it comes with the meal I say to myself.  Then the entrees arrive.  I ask my friend, because she took a bite of her gnocchi with pesto first, how it is.  She just shrugs her shoulders.  I take a bite of my entree.  My first thought is "this is the complete opposite of al dente".  The noodles were so over cooked it wasn't even funny.  The sauce was terrible.  And  I couldn't even taste any meat, except when an occasional big chunk happened to get stuck to one of the mushy noodles.  So I ask my friend "can I try a bite of yours"...."please do" she responds.  Now the moment the gnocchi entered my mouth I could tell it was on the super soft side.  But within seconds it disintegrated in my mouth like sand.  At this point my friend and I look at each other and say at the exact same moment "this has to be the worst pasta I have ever had".  I"m not joking,  Trust me I wish I was.  Then the garlic bread finally arrives.  Now if I was a vampire slayer this bread would be top on my list to protect me.  But alas I'm not, so I'm not looking for dragon breath just a nice loaf of garlic bread.  Victors failed on everything we ate.  If and when I go back I will only order the pizza.  Never have I tasted such awful food in my life.  I still can't understand how you mess up pasta that badly.

But what bothers me most of all was that the prices are absolutely ridiculous!!  They charge way way way too much for horrible food.  This restaurant should seriously be featured on that show "Kitchen Nightmares".
author: Amanda P.

description: Even though you're only permitted to buy their slices to go, this is perfectly balanced pizza. Victor's peeps use just the right amount of cheese, a delicious blend of Italian spices you can actually see lurking on your slice, and a crust that lends itself to that New York fold business -- if you're into that sort of thing. Hubba-hubba.
author: Gregor G.

description:
It was 11:10pm. 20min before closing time. I must have upset the chef for ordering some pasta for delivery. I order angel hair pasta white wine clams and steam vegetables. I believe he/she had forgotten to drained out the water when he boil my pasta before putting into a pan to add the wine and the clams. When my pasta came, it look like it was still sitting in the water and gooey super soft steam vegetables, that's totally bland. Have you ever made a cup of noodle and left it sitting out side till it turn cold when the noodle turn all soft and gooey like? That's what my pasta look and taste like!,,, 
The guy who had pick up the phone when I call was nice, and the person who brought the food was great, but the food made me wanna puke, I took two bite and put it in the fridge hoping I can try to finish it tomorrow. 
The next day came, came home from work I pull the clear box of pasta out my fridge, It had turn into a block of gooey dough, i wish there's a way I can post the gooey dough picture up here so everyone can have a better picture of what I'm trying to say. I'm not the type that would throw away food just because it doesn't taste right. I'll update this and let you know how many day it's gonna take me to eat all this. 

Note to self: NEVER order food when you know restaurant is about to close...
author: tahni c.

description: I had forgotten all about this little Nob Hill gem until I was reminded by my hermit neighbor who, despite staying up all hours of the night moving furniture around for no particular reason, is quite the pizza fanatic (delivery of course). Anyhow...Victor's is a solid, straight forward, and predictable pizza. I love the crispy crust as it's not too thin and not too thick and doesn't resemble the tase of cardboard in the least (which seams to be the common theme in SF pizza's). Their pizza sauce, which couldn't be anything other than homemade, has a really good zest to it. I'm a huge veggie fan myself so the real test is if the veggies arrive crisp and fresh or mushy and brown and I'm happy to report that the viggies passed the test. It's not quite 5 stars in my book, but you better believe I'll be ordering from Victors again in the very near future.
author: Kristy M.

description: two-bite size garlic bread....extreme garlic 'n' cheese sensation...perfect start and munch....before diving 'n' grabbin' slice for entree....victor's special pizza....thin toasty crust....decent proportionality from cheese to toppings....good pizza eating...sandwich meals with salad (or soup) 'n' pasta...mega meals enough to share for two....warm or cold sandwich pickings....victor's offering balanced simple selection....delivery delivery delivery availability.....
author: Hen A.

description:
so, i placed an order for a pizza with uncle vitos last saturday at 5:30pm ... 7:00pm rolls around and still no pizza. i thought, this is weird ... usually uncle vitos NEVER screws up an order of mine. so anyways, i call at 7:00pm and ask the guy where's my pizza?! he replies, there's lots of traffic around union square. the driver left 15 minutes ago. i'm like, ok. and then 7:30pm rolls around and still NO pizza ... it's been 2 hours since i placed the order. i call back uncle vitos and he goes, the driver didn't know how to buzz you, so he went back and made other deliveries and we tried calling you but there was no answer ... i asked him what number he had, and yes, he wrote down the wrong number!! i was like, forget it i'm going to eat somewhere else ... and then he had the nerve to only offer me a 10% discount on a future purchase? geez, thanks a lot. 

ANYWAYS, the point of this story is not to rip on uncle vitos because i know mistakes happen and they've been extremely fast in the past and they've been good to me ... my point is, i decided to venture out to polk street in search of food. i found Victors ... and this place is awesome. i ordered a greek salad (decent) and a large pizza (half cheese / half pepperoni). the pizza was actually pretty similar to uncle vitos in taste. it was pretty damn good pizza and the service was also great. i'm glad uncle vitos screwed up cuz i would never have discovered this gem. you can never have enough good pizza options in this city.
author: James J.

description: My favorite cheese pizza by the slice.  The sauce is neither sweet nor tangy...just perfect tomato sauce with herbs atop crispy thin crust.   Don't bother getting toppings. Adding toppings before reheating does not meld the topping and cheese together.  All my jalapeos fell off as I was walking and eating.
author: Wakako U.

description: Pretty much the worst pizza possible.  I think they actually had rat droppings in the oven itself.  It was disgusting, and they were incredibly rude as well.  There is no reason to go here.  The best you will get is food posioning.
author: Mason G.

description: Generously portioned delicious entrees for $11-13 including soup or salad and excellent bread. Worth a visit if you're in the area.
author: Ed M.

description: some of the best pizza in SF for sure. classic spot with wonderully thin crusted traditional italian pizza. and the checkered vinyl table cloths rock, what do you want, linen? the slices here are just OK, the real winner is the fresh pies to be had in the small left side dining room as you walk in. the bathroom via kitchen is also a real treat. service is all you need from a classic italian spot. great booths. besides Tomassos, i have to say there is not much north beach competition like the other reviewer noted.  good quality, east coast,  thin crust pizza is just lackingin SF. the only spots are Tomasso's, Little Star, Za, and Victor's. and if you're in the haight, Escape from New York. that's it. and please don't start whining about Zachary's in berkeley, that's not pizza.
author: casey c.

description: Victor's never disappoints.  I most recently had their Zorba Special with olives, salami, and feta cheese and I really loved it.  Salty and savory and just delicious.  Have also had the Victor's Special with green peppers, sausage, onion, mushrooms, etc. which is also good.  Quick and efficient delivery - pizza arrived 30 minutes after hanging up the phone (I've never eaten there though).  Victor's is my go-to delivery pizza place in the city.
author: Carrie L.

description: The pizza is excellent if eaten in-house, but two attempts at delivery to Alamo Square haven't been very successful, as both times the pie was soggy and cold by the time it arrived. Pasta dishes, particularly gnocchi with pesto, are excellent. By your third visit, they'll be treating you like family. A little too loud for a first-date, but lots of fun if you're with a group.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Before we moved from the tender nob to the sunset, Victors was at least a weekly delivery. Always solid for a late night grind. You know you are a regular when we would go to the restaurant with by folks to dine, and they call us by our address instead of our names. Their meatball sandwiches are perfect and melty. My favorite dish is the pesto tortalini or chicken picatta. I miss you Victors.
author: Amanda L.

description: Best non-gourmet pizza I've found in the City so far!!  They make it fast and fresh, the crust is perfect, not undercooked and the toppings are always really good!  The added bonus is that they deliver to any bar in the neighborhood so you can have a nice solid foundation of pizza in your stomach before you begin destroying your liver for the evening.  Try the eggplant on your pizza, it's the best thing they've got on the menu!  The Victor's Special is also really good!
author: Craig E.

description:
this is a pretty good new york style pizza, though not nearly as good as arinell's.  The slice itself wasn't large enough for a true slice of new york.  there wasn't enough sauce, and the pizza itself was just too dry.  but the crust was nice, thin, and just crunchy enough.   I'd say the only ones I've had better in the city are Arinell's, Amici's extra thin, and escape from NY by the slice (by the pie, they seem to undercook it, since they seem to be ready to reheat).

I've been back a few times now, and still, the reheated slices ahve dry cheese on top, and the crust is inconsistent--it gets thicker closer to the edge of the pizza.
author: Fong L.

description: Chicken parm dinner is out of sight. Garlic bread, pizza, yowza!!
author: lowell d.

description: Born and raised in Brooklyn New York, so I can't give them a five. It is very good "California Pizza" though. Nice thin crust and decent sauce. The place is dark and very warm inside and sort of reminds me of some pizza places in Brooklyn and Queens. Sweet Meatball hero. I have lived in the neighborhood for 6 years now and this is my pizza joint.
author: Phil O.

description: My second favorite pizza behind Arinell's. Thin, cheesy, great tasting, similar to "new york" style. The best part is the delivery. I have ordered dozens of times and they have never taken more than 30 min! Sooo good. They don't like to deliver to the mission most of the time though, otherwise it would be five stars.
author: Julian M.

description:
I maintained my composure here in this this cozy Polk hood pizzaria even as I took a bite of the piping hot pizza, the sauce burning my throat the cheese welding it's self to the roof of my mouth.
After this mistake on my part I really enjoyed the food and the cola that helped me not die.
I'm never in this area but some friends swear by it so when I did find myself here with a hungry stomach and a a bit of time I sat down and devoured the pie right up!
author: Daisy S.

description: I heart you Victor's and your yummy cheese slices. I would have given you five stars, but when I get just a slice you shoo me out and force me to eat it on the street.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Pizza deliziosa!  Great veggie pizza and great pepperoni. Only reason it's not 5 starts is the garlic bread:  I wish they would roast the garlic or rub the bread with the clove when it's hot vs. chopping up raw garlic...was a bit overwhelming for me. Grazie.
author: Erin T.

description: My boyfriend introduced me to this place a couple years back on our first visit to SF together. I agree with all the reviews. Pizza is damn good: Thin, crisp, full of flavor. The minestrone soup is also delicious.  It's open late so you'll be able to indulge after a long night of drinking.
author: Veronica V.

description: Whoo-hoo! I totally agree with Catherine! I can call Victor's and they NEVER ask for a credit card, like every other pizzeria I've ordered from. They are simply INCREDIBLE. I order an extra-large with triple cheese, pepperoni, mushrooms and garlic every time I want to reward myself for something (hey, it's not often), and they NEVER get the order wrong. It's ALWAYS delivered within 45 minutes of my order, even though they say "two hours," and I live on Russian Hill. I scarf half that pizza in 20 minutes, and I eat the second half cold the next morning. It's like heaven, really. I can't say enough about this place's pizza--except that I will never order from any other pizzeria unless I'm in another state (of the Union, or consciousness).
author: Giovanna M.

description: For some reason I had really low expectations of this place and they blew me away.  As I've said many times... I'm a certified pizza snob (happens when you grow up on the east coast) and this place scores high on the ratings scale.  Good job boys...
author: Tom C.

description: I haven't tried the pizza...but the linguini w/ white clam sause is very, very good....and garlicy....pretty quick delivery.
author: Nancy P.

description: Great delivery option in the Nob Hill/Russian Hill/Pac Heights area.  The pizza and calzones are great, pastas are big and come with salad or soup.
author: phil h.

description: After reading reviews for Victors Pizza online my family and I decided to give it a try since it was only 5 blocks from our hotel. We were very satisfied with everything. The ambiance was very San Francisco, the service was great (our waiter came around many times to make sure everything was going okay), and the food was delicious (we ordered a XL sausage and pepperoni pizza). Would definitely recommend.
author: Aaron P.

description:
UPDATE: Something is rotten at Victor's. Not literally. I don't think. But this years-old pizza standby has of late fallen from grace. It has become a bland, flavorless, soggy pie that skimps the cheese and burns the crust. I'm not sure what happened. I mean, it's still pizza, so it's good even when it's not. But it's not great anymore. It doesn't hit the spot anymore. 

I am sad. 

Victor's, come back! 

OLD 5-STAR REVIEW:  Sunday. Hangover. The entire second season of 24 on DVD. The couch. Bottomless glass of water. Large, pepperoni, sausage, mushroom and olive pizza from Victor's. Bliss. 

My BF usually prefers the thicker breadier crusts, but he still is on my side when it comes to Victor's thin, light crust. It must be the sauce. The herbaceous red sauce with the right balance of tang and spice. The equitable distribution of toppings. The cheese, never too little, never too much. 

Victor's pizza is perfection.
author: Sage R.

description: The pizza here is so-so. I dont' think its anything really special its just pizza. Its a bit more pricey than i'd like as well. For the price you should just go down to Escape From New York Pizza. Their Gnocci isn't that great either.
author: Steven C.

description: Was back in SF last week and had a chance to eat at Victor's again.  We LOVE it!  My daughters loved their Hawaiian pizza and I loved my pepperoni, olive, and mushroom.  I wish there was a huge pneumatic tube so they could deliver to Sacramento!
author: Kathleen D.

description: Nothing to write home about but definitely a solid pie. Got the Victor's special. Ton of toppings. All fresh. Quick delivery. Leftovers tasted just as good the next day. Toppings don't get soggy.
author: Nada b.

description:
Victor's thin crust pizza is the best!  The reason why it only gets four stars is because it's can be hit or miss sometimes, especially when it's busy.  And the one time I had their pasta, it really was not very good.  So this review is strictly about the pizza.

But this is thin crust pizza at it's best.  I always ask for them to do it well done, so it's super crispy.  My favorite is the sausage and mushroom pizza.  The sausage is flavorful and they give you a fair amount.  And the mushrooms are definitely fresh.  This is probably the best pizza place in SF.  

I definitely recommend this place to friends all the time.
author: Deborah H.

description: I'm a fan of Victors Pizza!  I really like all of there pizzas and the chicken Parmesan!  I would defiantly recommend this place.
author: Russ B.

description: My wife and I went there last night on the way to a show at the Red Devil Lounge.  We each got a slice to go, and decided that since the place was only 1/4 full with patrons, we'd just eat the slice there.  Well, the guy taking our order was extremely rude about not being able to eat the "to go" pizza in the restaurant.  I'm ok with them having a policy, but he was over the top with his attitude.  The pizza was ok, but since it had to be reheated it didn't taste that fresh.  We left with such a bad taste in our mouths (pun intended) after our encounter with the employee that we will NEVER go back!
author: Scott G.

description:
We have been loyal fans of Victor's pizza for the past three years, and order from them regularly. Their pizza is consistent, always arrives hot, and absolutely delicious.  The crust is perfect, and quite satisfactory to someone like me who swore that good pizza could only be found in Naples, Italy. Please note that we have tried many different pizza options in the city--including Mozzarella di Buffala, Little Star, North Beach Pizza, Cybelle's, Blue Moon Pizza--in search of the perfect pie. Our search has ended, as we are delighted with Victor's. 
PS. We ordered Victors for some NYC native foodies, and even they were impressed.
author: Susan H.

description: This place has some pretty awesome pizza, even if they do overcharge for a bottle of wine and sometimes you get drunk guys rambling on about magnets and solar powered computers sitting at the next table over. You can still get an extra large pizza for something like $22 that will feed a group of four nicely. Pizza had a nice crisp crust and was pretty delicious. Now if they could only get something other than budweiser on tap.
author: Tom H.

description: I like to stop by here after a yoga class and bring the pizza home (but they deliver too) its just I like to munch on it on my way home...There is something in their crust- its not quite the new york crust but comes close...they have a restaurant that serves italian fares...not too keen on their entrees that's the minus 1 star.
author: Arissa C.

description: I had the thin crust cheese pizza; very good.  My friend Andy says the both the chicken and the eggplant parmesan are good.  "Dude, we order it all the time! You get a huge thing of chicken or eggplant parm, pasta, and a salad all for just over $10.00.  That Includes DELIVERY!"
author: Amme P.

description:
We will NOT be going back to Victor's!

They sat us in an area that was so dark. I know, mood lighting & all that, but a person should have enough light to see the menu. The staff looked over at our table, saw me holding my menu up to the dim red light, but did not offer to light the candle that sat on the table, or make it brighter. Not only was it a strain, but it made me wonder if they were trying to hide something.

We started with salads, topped with what were obviously bottled, tasteless dressings. The lettuce was relatively fresh, but what's with the triangles of supermarket deli cheese? Tasted like white american cheese.

I decided to order something simple: cheese ravioli with tomato sauce. They certainly weren't stingy with the sauce -- the plate was loaded down with mounds of it. Well, I thought it was supposed to be marinara, which should be light, with visible pieces of tomato. It was very thick, over-cooked and/or over-processed, & had a very strange taste which I couldn't identify.  I scraped off the sauce & ate the ravioli naked. It was a bit too al dente; actuallym it was hard, either from being undercooked, or stale, & the cheese filling had absolutely no taste. I should have asked the waiter to take it to the kitchen, rinse it off, & bring me some olive oil & butter. Later that night my stomach felt a bit off, & I worry that it was because of the sauce. I can't imagine how I would have felt if I ate more of the sauce. Ugh!

My husband said his canneloni was good, but after the miserable excuse for dinner on my plate, I had no desire to taste it.

The waiter was fine, & that's the only reason I'm giving this 2 stars.
author: Holly K.

description: By far, my favorite pizza. Cool atmosphere, and cheap beer on Wednesday's. When I lived in the neighborhood I went there weekly and I got to know the staff, they are really nice. Only downside- you have to go through the kitchen to get to their sub-optimal bathroom.
author: Emily W.

description:
as a born and raised new yorker, i've got to say that most places on the west coast just serve baked dough covered in tomato sauce, cheese, and misc toppings. victors pizza actually manages to break out of that mold (or at least does so more than the other places).

this is my go to place for delivery pizza and i just plain like it. it is no east coast pizza, but it's a pretty damn good west coast version. if you live in nob hill and are luck enough to have them deliver, try the garlic and baby clam pie - it rocks!
author: Marcy S.

description: I've been going to Victor's for years, and the place has not changed in consistency over the years, you know that you will get great pizza every time. . .the best NY style pizza in town. Try the Linguine with white clam sauce for a change. Get a donut at Bob's and you will have the perfect meal ;-P
author: Arlene C.

description: Delicioso! The Pizza. Yes, Big time...I am a super picky Pizza eater. This is the BEST. So many lazy nights over the years to go out for dinner after work. Or just too dam cold, foggy, and rainy. I do take out here. It arrives piping hot and fast. Know the staff for 15 yrs and they are really cool. You can go in and see them roll out the fresh dough... The toppings perfectly seasoned, light crust and yummy cheese. So so good! I am ordering now...
author: Sandi P.

description: Lot's of reviews on this place, so I'll be brief.  Great pizza, lousy decor.  Good place for pizza and throwing a few beers back with friends, but if you're looking for more than that, either go someplace else or get your pizza to go.  4 stars STRICTLY for the pizza.
author: Richard F.

description: I am happy to give this place a five star review. I ordered for delivery last night for the first time. The menu prices were fair and the portions were generous. I liked how they didn't hold back on the feta cheese on both the salad and the pizza. The man on the phone who took my order was friendly and efficient. He quoted me 40 mins and I expected about 45 to and hour. I was in no hurry to eat but when the food showed up under a half hour I was surprised and happy. Then, I thought the pizza would be undercooked.. but that was not the case at all. Cooked perfectly. I've been looking for "my" pizza place ever since moving here from Chicago.. I found it. Thank you Victors Pizza. You guys are awesome.
author: Tony M.

description: I finally tried Victor's after many recommendations. I approve. Pizza delivery was fast and it sure was yummy. Will definitely order again.
author: Rikki D.

description: Weak !! Average, bland, greasy pizza.  Delivered lukewarm.  Are these people eating the same stuff or did the Victor's Delivery guy just pick up a competitor's pizza and deliver it to us?
author: Neuro G.

description: I live pretty close to this place, so I'm not sure how quick they are on delivery to other parts of the city -- but I've gotta say, every time I order delivery, they tell me 35-40 minutes and it's there in 15-20. Amazing. Plus their pies are delicious. Toppings are always fresh, sauce is just right...sometimes a little too much cheese, but I can live with that! I haven't found a better piece of pizza in SF yet.
author: Kay B.

description: Best pizza in my neighborhood. Period.Staff is a little distant,  but that's the only even slightly negative thing I could think of. This place is seriously underrated. Yum!
author: Daniel S.

description: Sold, classic pizza in a casual, homey atmosphere.  Had dinner here w/ some friend from the neighborhood and I'll def. be back.  Veggie pie had a lots of veggies, nice thin well-baked crust.
author: shoba d.

description: Arguably the best pizza in SF.  Delivery is very prompt.  Recommend the combo pizza.  Yummy!  I can't recall trying their entrees.
author: Cyrus S.

description: Great delivery option in the neighborhood - especially when it's 'my turn' to cook for the kids!
author: Kennedy G.

description: Really impressed with their pizza. Just had the Meat combo and ooooh tasty..... I always order deliver so I can't say much about the space/decor e.t.c. Definitely one of the best in the city.
author: Teddy d.

description: I had the Victor's Favorite. I love tons of meats on my pizza and this pizza certainly has alot of meat on it.
author: Luke R.

description: I love this place. The pizza is so delicious. The crust is not to thin and with the right amount of crunch. The calzones are really good too. It can get pretty packed sometimes but I suggest trying a mini calzone. Very filling and delicious.
author: Andy D.

description: Sorry Little Star, but Victor's is el supremo.
author: willy j.

description: I ordered gnocchi and it was great. But my bf said his sanwich was not good and didn't finish his spaghetti either.
author: Justin R.

description: Good Pies! I just ordered 6 pizzas for my work crew here for lunch. We ordered 3 specials, 2 sausage and pepperoni, and one Hawaiian. All were delivered. Every one was  very good. None were greasy and the crust was New York style....nice and thin. Everyone said it was the best they had from around here (Downtown)...Delivery was pretty fast as well...Good place, we will order from them again...
author: Michael M.

description: Victor's is awesome. I used to work downtown and ordered delivery from Victor's way too much. It's a toss-up between the cannelloni and the chicken parmigiana for my favorite. Since I have to go pick it up now, I usually order both and thrown the cannelloni in the fridge to heat up later. The chicken parm is so huge I can usually save part of it and make a sandwich later. The pizza is good, not my favorite but definitely up there. Their homemade pastas and sauce are amazing and all entrees come with soup or salad and fresh bread made from their pizza dough. If it isn't a pasta dish your entree also comes with pasta. I wish Victor's was closer to me... but maybe it is better that it isn't or I might eat there every day!
author: Troy K.

description: I love this place!  My roommate prefers Escape From NY Pizza further down Polk, but they are so inferior that for once, it's not worth walking towards the NICER part of Polk!  lol  I prefer walking towards the seedier part of Polk for some amazing pizza!  The crust is thin, the way I like it, and the sauce is flavorful which I find lacking in many pizza joints.  I recommend you eat it fast because like any pizza, even this slice of heaven loses its deliciousness once it has gone cold.  Opens late enough and is a great way to get rid of your hangover the next morning after a night of pub crawling in the Polk.
author: C. T.

description: The only thing I have every ordered here has been the chicken milanese. One of the rare italian places in SF that actually serves it properly... with lemon only, and the filet of chicken beaten down very thin... YUMMMMMM! It come served with salad or soup (go with the salad) and a side of pasta with marinara sauce (skip the pasta, it's usually overcooked) and steamed veggies, ... for $12 and all that food you really cant beat that! I really miss living in that neighborhood!!!!
author: Marina K.

description: Best Pizza place in town.  Tasty sauce, delicious crust, and the most affordable price.  Not that greasy compared to most pizza places. The spaghetti is really good too.  The house wine is surprisingly good.  The Fetuccini is horrible the worst fettucini I ever had.  But they still get 5 stars because the Pizza is so good and cheap.  Forget Amici's, way to greasy and pricey, come on its F***ing flour and tomato sauce. Extreme Pizza just plain sucks donkey d*ck. The only other place that comes close is Marina Pizza on Lombard.
author: P D.

description: I am surprised that no one has mentioned Victor's INCREDIBLY good, garlic-drenched gnocchi pesto. (There is so much garlic in it that you will want to cajole your dining companions into getting something equally garlicky, or content yourself with dining alone.) This is a terrific restaurant - they have been in the same location for 50 years, and you feel as though you are dining in another era when you eat there. Their salad is good, their (fresh baked) bread is good, their garlic bread (more garlic!) is great, and there is room for a large party in the adjoining dining room. Rah rah Victor's!
author: Jude F.

description: I ate a whole medium pizza with a super sized combo salad.  Luckily I was able to roll my ass off the couch to write this review.  I ordered an eggplant, spinach, and mushroom pizza.  The eggplant was awesome.  I am calling my pizza the "Fatty A.plant special."  Tell them Fatty A. sent you.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Victors offers by far one of the best slices of pizza in San Francisco- hands down. 

The perfectly-done crust and just-enough sauce combination are what do the trick, but adding your own fresh toppings (garlic, onions, sausage, green peppers, mushrooms, olives, etc) is definately the way to go here. At 3 dollars a slice, it's more than affordable. They also serve excellent sit-down meals ranging from gnocchi and salads, to pizza and garlic bread, for parties of 8 or more.

The service is always very attentive and the owner is *always* there, which makes it feel like your parents' kitchen back East. Best of all, it offers a seductive, dimly-lit back room where couples often enjoy a slice or share a pasta dish in romantic privacy.
author: Alex G.

description: Coming from the East coast I know a good pizza when I taste one.  Although I'm disappointed in a lot of pizza in the bay area (especially the prices) I have found an excellent za joint and that place is Victors.
author: Dave R.

description: At first the only highlight of eating here was seeing 9 policemen enter in for lunch....but the pizza is actually pretty good. Tip: don't order a Greek salad -which is just a pathetic waste of $7 (green leaf, zeta, and sliced black olives). The thin pizza is crunchy, they don't overload the cheese, and they give you a little more than enough of the right toppings (i.e. you aren't rationing the pepperoni). Lunch for two with soda about= $25. Boys don't bring girls you want to impress here because the decor ain't all that.
author: Kat F.

description: As many times as I've stopped in for pizza at Victor's, I never thought to use them for delivery service. Today I did, and I must say, that is the fastest I've ever had a pizza delivered before! It took no longer than 15 minutes for a fresh, hot NY-style pizza to arrive with some gooey, garlicy garlic cheese bread.  Definitely some of the best pizza in the city and certainly the fastest delivery! Yum!
author: Susie D.

description: Probably the best pizza in the neighborhood. I had it delivered the other day and they were actually here a good 10 -15 minutes faster than they told me.
author: Tamara F.

description: I'm surprised by some of the crappy reviews!  I've been lucky enough, that i never met a Victors pizza i didn't like!
author: simon r.

description: Get a slice to go or have a nice sit-in meal with some of the best pasta in the area.  The staff is friendly, the restaurant is generally quiet and comfortable and not to mention their sauces are great.  I prefer Victor's to "Ti Piacera" just up the street.  Excellent service and food that actually taste good, and at a good price nonetheless.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Victor's has been here for soooooo long.  It use to be the best!  i think it has lost it's glory.  The place itself needs cleaning up.  The food is meh......rather spent my money at Tony's - where I hear the Pizza is out of this world.
author: Kendall R.

description: Victor's is not as good as Arinell's, but it's not far from it, either.  I've been known to have their pizza delivered 2x a week for months at a time.  Since, they deliver to me (Cow Hollow) in 45 minutes or less, I can't complain.
author: Kelvin K.

description: Tommaso's pizza got a 4 stars from me so I think it's impliedly unfair to also give Victor's a 4 stars when I think Victor's may be slightly better (maybe by a 1/3 star). I like that you can buy pizza by the slice here and that they also deliver (Tommaso's doesn't do either). Sure, nothing compares to NYC but this pizza definitely comes close.  It's pretty darn good. So good that you may end up challenging your spouse to a Battle Royale to determine who eats the last piece....
author: Colleen L.

description: My review is overdue.  The pizza I admit is very good.  But on my last visit to Victor's I did a NO-NO and ordered the carbonara.  BIG MISTAKE.  Doesn't come close.  Carbonara is eggs, cheese, pasta, and pancetta, and tons of black pepper.  Having lived in Rome, birthplace of carbonara, I now of what I speak.  Order the pizza but stay away from the pasta dishes.  I guess this happens when non-Italians are doing the cooking.
author: Unemployed A.

description: This pizza is greasy and disgusting.  I think I would say it is the worst pizza I've ever had.  If you order delivery, and your pizza has toppings, the crust gets so soaked with grease that when you try to grab a piece the end just flops down, the toppings fall off, and it's difficult to even manage eating it.  Anyone who likes this pizza must be from California.
author: Erin D.

description: I have been hearing about this place from a friend for a couple of years and decided to try it.  It is a tiny hole in the wall place but nice enough.  We ordered the Victor's Special pizza and it was great.  Thin crust just like I like it and the vegetables were fresh.  I ordered a salad to begin with and while the lettuce and tomato were crisp, the dressing was more like something out of a bottle.  One of our party ordered the rigatoni bolognese with Italian sausage.  It was pretty good.  I love the sausage they use.  The garlic bread is really good.  Small pieces of buttered bread with minced garlic on top.  It seemed a little expensive for the portion size but some of the best garlic bread I have had.  Overall, a great little place.  They deliver so I will definitely be taking advantage of that.  For some reason, it is tough to find an Italian place that delivers and has really good Italian sausage.
author: David S.

description: Victors pizza is delicious. Its even great when you have it delivered. The stuffed canneloni is also a favorite of mine. It has a great cheesy meat sauce all over it. Glorious. $5 pitchers of beer on Wednesdays too. Its a cool little spot to eat at with the old crusty ass booths and great portions.
author: Adam F.

description: It took me way too long to find this place that's only like four blocks from my apartment.  Screw Za's and their hipster cornmeal bs.  I've lived in California for three years and this is the best pizza I've had.  The eggplant is required on pretty much everything.
author: Matt S.

description: I'm from southwest Michigan, so I grew up thinking that good pizza meant Pizza Hut and Little Ceasers. Hence, I'm no pizza snob. I love Victor's pizza. I'm especially enamored of the resturaunt's low-lighting, vinyl booths, and the oversized glass grapes hanging form the ceiling. It's old school.
author: Kezia P.

description: I had a slice of cheese here the other day which I had to get to go because they don't allow you to eat there if you just get a slice-minus one star. When I walked out the door a homeless guy ask if he could have a bite! Had I known what it taste like I would have probably gave him the whole slice. The crust is decent but the cheese is just not it. And they don't put enough sauce. There are to many other pizza places in SF. Go to Gaspar's out on Geary. They have delicious garlicky thin-crust pizza! I will never go back to Victors!
author: Jack B.

description: The gnocci bolognese  rocks my world.  As does the lasagna.  And the pesto.  And the meatball and sausage sandwich. The all meat pizza is exactly what will cure the "I need meat and grease or someone will die" PMS symptoms that midol can't touch.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description: I've been going to Victor's since before most of y'all were born--since I was a college-kid fag hag in the early Seventies and my gay male friends and I used to spend our weekend nights on Polk Street (before the Castro was, well, the Castro).  Victor's was a staple.  Not the greatest, but pretty darn good and, most important, had an almost palpable old-timey Italian pizzeria vibe.  Open late and dependable and a Polk Street institution.  I'm glad they're still around, and I'll keep eating their pizza until one of us kicks.
author: Earline A.

description:
been eating victors pizza for 30+ years and never had a bad one...
one of the best pizzerias in the city......imnsho
author: arthur c.

description: The pizza was ok - crispy, right thickness, though not memorable. But no garlic powder or oregano shakers in the joint  - a big no-no for any self-respecting Italian pizza place. Eating there for lunch sucked - service was virtually nil. They didn't even bother turning on lights. A buck-25 for a small glass of soda that is 85% ice cubes, and full price for refills! The slice specials were $4.75 for a small slice, nothing else included... you kidding me with that price, in this neighborhood? The booth cushions are all torn up too... overall shoddy and icky vibe inside, which, I guess can be sidestepped by taking your food to go or get it delivered, if you really must have pizza from there.
author: Clar L.

description: Okay, so Victor's pizza is really really good. True. Walking by there is always a trial cause they've got it in the window and you know how easy it would be to just get one slice. BUT, the restaurant is a great little place itself, with a really hearty minestrone and solid pasta dishes. Not expensive, either. It's not as formal old school eye-tal-yan as Original Joe's, but it's old school---OJ's is where the family'd go after a funeral or a wedding or someone's communion. Victor's is like, where you'd go after spending the day in the park or on the boat--plastic checkered table cloths, those red glass candles, etc. It also works for a cheap-o romantic dinner, since it's so dark.
author: SheRat R.

description: $36 for a large and garlic bread. Seemed to have been cut blindfolded, slices were anywhere from 2" to 10" wide. i was so disappointed. The crust was decent, or I should say would have been were it not completely soggy. I had to put it in the oven for 20 mins just to dry out the crust a little bit. The taste was fine, but next time I'll do Mythic Pizza.
author: Allie D.

description: Smells so good from the street, but taste so soggy upon delivery.  I ordered the Victor's special and 40 minutes later, was totally disappointed.  My boyfriend and I walk past this place on Polk every now and then, totally enamoured of the wafting aroma of melted cheese and browning dough.  Unfortunately, reality did not surpass fantasy.  25.60 for a large.  Eh.
author: Hiromi N.

description: So for what you get (decent pizza, cheap pasta al dente, and nice-sized portions) it's worth it, but then you have to take into account the customer service.  I swear to God, every time I go there it takes over an hour start to finish, which is way more time than I want to spend at a pizza joint that has booths that are torn and poke me in the hiney!  Also, you will need to sip very slowly on any bevvies, because asking for a refill is like pulling teeth!!!  Delivery experiences on the other hand have been really great... I mean they are there in 15 minutes (I live about 5 from here), makes me wonder if they knew what I was going to order already.  By the time they get there everything is still fresh.  And lastly, decent pizza to stop in and grab a quick slice that's pre-made.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Victor's Special - DELISH... great sauce and tons of toppings.. but the crispy thin crust takes the cake for sure!!   

Delivery was way fast, less than 20 minutes - I was a little skeptical about the pie when the delivery guy rung the bell since it was so fast...

Clearly not an east coast pie by any means... but definitely so much better than all the other options in the neighborhood.. 

Next delivery will DEFINITELY include garlic bread.. droollz....
author: Huy N.

description: Victor's pizza is really good.  Their pizzas have a really thin yummy crust, and are best with just a few simple toppings.  I personally like a sausage, mushroom, and fresh basil topping combo.
author: Olivia C.

description: To quote Randy Jackson from American Idol, "It was just OK for me...."  Nothing special - pretty good pepperoni pie..... very greasy.  Quick delivery, but the guy taking the orders has an attitude that I don't really think is necessary....
author: A B.

description: They have a hot side (with the trellis and mood lighting) and a cool side (the one that gets natural light.  Good pizza pie.
author: T-Bone L.

description: It's not one of the pizza greats, it's not as perfect as the Cheeseboard or Arinelles, but they do make a damn tasty piece of pizza.  The slices to go are perfect for a quick snack.
author: Herbert S.

description: Victor's is one of those homey old school I-talian joynts that serves up tasty vittles at low prices. When you walk in the door you have 2 dining room choices - the one on the left features booths and is a bit darker - definitely a better choice. Great pizza, ginormous salads, and Bud on tap - what more do you need? The service is friendly if a bit slow. Overall a great meal on Polk.
author: Colin S.

description: I like that you can stop in and get a slice on the run. The crust is crispy and thin and the sauce and cheese combo is good, too. I haven't eaten in the restaurant, yet. They also deliver and are very quick... For San Fran, it's probably the best pizza I've encountered, esp bc I'm a big fan of thin crust.
author: Maren P.

description: Good pie. I agree with Rise G., gets a little thin but sauce is good and crust is also. Not the best pie in town but will do in a pinch. Also - the delivery guy showed up 20 min. after we ordered with our pie. That's a first in this town where the average wait is an hour. Had to tip him a full $5 for that and will call again soon.
author: Matt H.

description: Great place for late night snack after drinks next door at Rouge...but thin crust can never beat thick crust...and seeing your chef so sweaty is not very appetizing....and yes...the cashier is not too nice....if you are open late night, you know you will get the obnoxious drunks....pls still smile at us.
author: Jenny K.

description: I wont even begin to go into how bad the pizza is in SF.    Thank the maker for Victor and his crew, who serve up an excellent slice in a city built on papa johns and pizza hut.    East coasters, rejoice.
author: Dan G.

description: Decent enough for slices.  I kind of hate the crust though, too crispy, like a cracker or some shit.  I'm lazy though, so I end up going here a lot.  Not too greasy or anything.
author: Coco D.

description: The only decent pizza I've found in the city - sooooo glad it's in my 'hood too!
author: Angela N.

description: Good pizza.  $2.75 for a slice of Cheese Pizza.  Got a New York Style slice to go.  Nothing fancy, walk in, order, 3 minutes later walk out.
author: Atif Q.

description: Excellent pizza...the perfect amount of good tasting sauce, lots of cheese, lots of toppings, and a nice thin-ish crust that wasn't too chewy and folded very nice.  Delivery was fast and the pizza was quite large.  Next time I'm looking for some delivery pizza it will probably be from here.
author: Brett T.

description: By far, my favorite slice of thin-crust pizza.  The key to Victor's is they have the pie cooked already and then when you order a slice to go with toppings, they wrap it in foil and toss it back into the oven to cook once again.  Three to five minutes later you have arguably the best slice of pizza in the Polk Gulch.  Perfect for eating while nursing your drunken stupor, or before hitting up the bars.
author: Taylor P.

description: Ahhh Victor's.  You make me feel at home with your delicious pie.  The Italian Sausage is by far my favorite, tasting a lot like the sausage I would get in Philly as a kid.  The delivery radius is pretty good and I have never had them go over their time, they mostly beat it by 5-15 minutes.  By far my favorite pie in the city.
author: Jeff R.

description: Quick delivery, decent pizza, handmade pastas, large portion entrees, kickin' slabs of fresh, moist carrot cake with delish frosting, fresh baked bread - I'm sold.  Not crazy about the soup or salad.
author: Esther R.

description: I had heard this place was good from a friend.  I then checked the Yelp reviews and knew I had to try it.  My boyfriend and I started with a Caesar salad.  The portions were large, but was it good.  Not really.  We definitely could have passed on that.  Then we tried the garlic bread.  Could have passed on that too especially when they give you bread anyways (which is pretty good).  However, the pizza was awesome!  Quality was great and I would definitely go back here again.  I heard they have slices which I would want to try.  Anyways, one of my top 5 pizza places in the city and same with my bf and that say a a lot!
author: Rachel S.

description: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had.  Period.  I can't say enough about this pizza - this, spicy, flavorful, rich, cheesy, mouth-watering pizza.  Mmmmm....I gotta go get some right now.  The slices are pre-made, but cooked to-order.  They come out of the oven steaming hot although I like to ask them not to heat them up too much so that I don't have to wait to eat it.  Paired with an ice-cold Sierra Nevada is how I like my Victors.
author: Charles W.

description: This place is great for delivery.  I love their thin crust peperoni, reminds me of nyc, yum!
author: Alison D.

description: Actually, this is a 3.5 star review. I called Victor's on a friend's recommendation and spoke to a rather irritated sounding guy. I gave my order and 30-40 minutes later, I got a delicious pizza. It's not outstanding, but it is better than either Front Room Pizza or Cable Car Pizza. Side note on the irritated sounding guy, I don't necessarily have a problem ordering from people who sound like they are irritated for a majority of the day, every day of their lives. I do have a problem ordering from people who have the potential of delivering good customer service over the phone, but choose to be assholes anyway (ie Za Pizza). So yeah, don't get put off from the guy answering the phone, he's probably like that all the time.
author: Raymond P.

description: having lived in nyc, i've made it one of my missions to find a pizza place comparable to a ny slice.  unfortunately, victor's did not meet my standards.  their slices are thinner than most other pizza joints in the area but the slice i had was just OK.  i would prefer arinells slice to victor's since most other yelpers compare the two.
author: Helen T.

description: Good, solid pizza.  Bread sticks taste like pizza crust, the garlic cheese bread has chunky chunks of garlic in it (a bit too much for me), cannelloni is good (although my leftovers the next day sort of resembled chef boyardee, but no worries- it didn't really taste like it) and you cannot get beef in the calzone, but they're pretty tasty with feta cheese.
author: yvette l.

description: Yummy slices, yummy pizza -- probably one of the top 10 pizza joints in the city.  Would not recommend the caesar salad.  They don't give refills on soft drinks either.  The guy is kinda rude sometimes about not being able to sit and eat slices too, but he was pretty nice the time we ordered a whole pie.  Open late night which is good.  It's a great pizza joint, everything else is okay.
author: Latef X.

description: This place was exactly what I needed at the time I stumbled in here: Quiet, uncrowded, excellent service, yummy pizza, and open. A friend, my sister and I wandered Polk St at 11pm in search of some good food, and were drawn to the large "Pizza" sign. Crossing our fingers that it was decent, we walked in. We definitely were not disappointed. The server was phenomenal; always there exactly when we needed him. Right when we decided what we wanted (the vegetarian pizza) he appeared at our side to take our order. Deathly thirsty, I set my glass, empty of water, down and whoa!! There he was with a pitcher of water, "May I fill your glass?" I think maybe he was telepathic or something.... The pizza was done nice and crispy in about 10 minutes. It wasn't the BEST pizza I had ever had, but it was cooked and delivered quickly, fresh tasting and had a good crisp factor; good enough for me to grab for seconds. Thanks Victor. You made my night.
author: sharlene s.

description: I am from the east coast and like to think of myself as a true pizza snob.  The pizza here was ok.  Nothing to complain about, but also nothing to write home about.  The crust could have used more seasoning.....
author: Joanna S.

description:
they have fresh pasta that is very very good, so good that I have never ordered the pizza.
one room is bright, and one room has dim red lighting,
they are very nice people and will never rush you.
author: adam m.

description: Their pizza really hit the spot for me the other night  - marinara sauce is garlicky and the crust was chewy and moist - which could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on your taste, but in my view, a fine, fine pizza.   A friendly neighborhood pizza joint that'll put you at ease as soon as you sit down.
author: Jonny L.

description: Really like the pizza - thin crust with tasty sauce and plenty of herbs. I like the pasta even better - try the meatballs!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Victor's is my new favorite neighborhood slice.  The Front Room is good.  Pizza Pino is satisfying at 2:00 AM, but Victor's is my new slice of choice.

It is a good rendition of NY style - thin, soft crust, a fair amount of good sauce, and a healthy amount of cheese.  Sound simple?  It is.  But it all works together very, very well to create a perfect slice.  Yummy!  I can't wait for my next pizza binge!
author: t l.

description: The pizza here is pretty darn good with a New York style crust (which I love).  Maybe not the best slice to ever grace your hungry lips (oh my!) but some good food.
author: Anya L.

description: YUMMMM! Super dooper fast delivery and great pizza! I love the thin slices and wonderful toppings. I'm a fan of pesto and mushroom. It's delish cold too! We walked by the shop the other day. It's really tiny but there was a line out the door for takeout. It's not that expensive either!
author: J K L.

description: Delivery pizza is common so the quality of the pizza is what needs to distinguish one place from the other and Victor's is better than most.  Despite being delivered, the pie was fresh and hot.  The crust was still crispy and the toppings were tasty.  I was especially impressed that it arrived at my door in just 40 minutes.  Victor's Special is what I'd recommend (ala a typical combination).
author: QuodE D.

description: Not too bad...the middle gets a little too thin for my liking, but it was a very good pizza.  We had the Victor's Special - no olives on half.  They also deliver, which helps us out on a hangover-Sunday.  It was a little more expensive than what I originally expected, but worth the price.  They do have a lot in the line of pastas too, so I am looking forward to trying some...maybe next Sunday!
author: Rise G.

description: dude, this pizza is just awesome, too bad its all the way in downtown! GRRRRR. but this is the best pizza on the west coast. Hands down!
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
the pizza here is really great, that's for sure.  my mom, who was born in sf and lived here for part of her life as a child, said she used to go there when she was young and loved it too and can i believe it's been around as long as it has?  but i can, because it's very good and classic italian food.

one night a few years ago a few friends and i decided to have sit-down dinner here, instead of just pizza.  i was pleasantly surprised-the food was tasty and affordable , and the lighting was very dim, which i appreciate.   there is nothing shi-shi or pretentious about this place, which is refreshing.  i ordered the vegetarian lasagna and a glass of the house red wine.  all was good, and they gave you bread and salad with the lasagna.  i haven't been there in quite awhile, and i am itching to go back for that lasagna.  however, maybe i should actually try something else on the menu...
author: Kate W.

description: Best slice in the city! perfect ratio of cheese:sauce:bread... doesn't even need toppings.. 2 slices of cheese, Pleeeeze!!!! mmmmmhmmmm
author: Beau R.

description: Reminds me of Homeslice in Austin, TX without the yuppie, pseudo-hip atmosphere. Very solid pizza and the veggies aren't from cans. They might add a few more draught beers and the lighting in the main dining room was extremely dark which made me think they were hiding something, but my tastebuds don't lie so 4 stars it is.
author: Slaton C.

description: One of my favorite pizza places by far. Do yourself a favor and order Victor's Special, with mushrooms, sausage, peperoni, salami, bell peppers, cheese...etc. Perfectly cooked on a crispy thin crust. I crave this pizza often, and if I lived within a mile of the place I would be as big as the side of a barn! Also love their bolognese sauce, with spaghetti. In fact, I've tried most of their pasta's and not been disappointed, and for the price, which includes salad, is quite budget friendly. I always eat in, as I live to far for take-out. Make sure to insist they seat you in the main dining room instead of the annex to the right, which looks like an afterthought. The main dining room is dark, and cozy, with booths, and candles, as my aversion to bright as day, fluorescent lit restaurants has not diminished. Finally, the wait staff is always extremely friendly, and prompt! One particular waiter has worked there for years, and usually knows what I am going to order before I do, or maybe he's telling me what to order, but never the less, he's never steered me wrong. The only thing I deduct one star for is the restroom, It's ummm... seen better days. All in all, solid Four Stars!
author: Anthony K.

description: I had a slice at Victor's the other day for lunch.  Very good old-style pizza and a great price.  You can eat in or take away.  Service was friendly and fast, even at 2:45 in the afternoon.  I had the mushroom pizza (yeah, very "out there" of me), which was perfect -- not too much cheese or toppings.  If you're looking for more of both, then get the supreme.  My friend did and she couldn't finish it because it was so piled high with meat and fresh veggie toppings, ranging from sausage and pepperoni to onions and bell peppers.
author: Kevin M.

description: omg... GGGGRRREEAT PIZZA.  Bought it and got it to go.. couldn't wait to eat it, so took a bite... and half the pizza was gone by the time i got home.  awesome awesome!
author: Young K.

description: this place probably deserves a four star because as much as i want to critique it, i gobble up the food, tempted to lick the plate. there is no frills, but it is really homestyle italian-american food. the reason i don't give it 4 stars is probably because i used to work in italy and i am comparing. anyways, order: the house salad (greek salad is good too) it is big enough to share. the pizza is pretty good, but i suggest the pesto pasta (pesto is homemade) or gnocci.
author: S. G.

description: I've ordered from this place a couple times now and have been pleased both times with excellent pizza and good sides too.  Delivery was swift and friendly as well.
author: Derek D.

description: So this is single reason I gained 5lbs in 3 months...I fell in love with this place while going to school around the corner.  The pasta is just like grandma makes it and it's cheap too!!! Guys...definitely take the ladies here...cute restaurant with old school checkered table clothes and where else do you get  fresh bread and a salad with your en tree??
author: Charisse F.

description: These folks know their pizza.  The crust is both thin & chewy, the sauce is nicely spiced and the toppings are generous without being gushy.  We've never had a bad pizza here.  The salads and pasta dishes are pretty much what you'd expect--good additions to the pizza.  The waiters here are terrific--one guy knows which of the Italian beers we like, when we can't even remember which one it is, and we don't come here that often.  Impressive.  My only complaint is that it's so dark I have trouble reading the menu, but I'm getting pizza anyway so what they hey?!
author: Jennifer F.

description: Victors is tied for the best pizza in SF (tied with Amicis).  This is a legitimate pizza place in a city that is otherwise devoid of good pizza spots.  The crust is thick and they pile on the cheese and toppings. They also have a wide variety of non- pizza items on the menu.  I like their calzones and pastas.  Additionally, and this is near and dear to my heart, their pizza ages well (it is still moist and very tasty as many as FOUR DAYS after delivery - I have never run across a pizza that ages that well).  Order the Victor's Special if you are undecided.
author: Trevor T.

description: My mom and I both looooooove their italian salad dressing. The gnocci is always delectable and the pizza has been nothing but delicious. The wait staff are always pleasant and efficent...by the way did I mention how much I looooooooove their italian dressing. They should bottle it....a small request from a big fan! :)
author: Layne C.

description: Only pizza joint I ever go to.  Whether its to sit down and have a pie.  Or before/during/after a night at the bars.  Slices to go only, no slices when you eat in.  That is only reason for 4 stars.
author: Mike A.

description: Their pizza is still the greatest but their food has a lot to be desired. I recently tried their food menu (always only had pizza before) and it was at best mediocre. The chicken parm was just plain so so and the egg plant parm wasn't much better. I'm going to just stick with the pizza from now on.
author: John C.

description: Victor's has some of the best pizza in the city (yes, it's West coast, but it really is good) AND one of the best deals on Wed nights.  Get a group of friends together and dine-in - they have beer specials on pitchers of Bud (around $3.50 per pitcher!).  The staff is friendly (esp Francisco) and willing to put up with some, ummm, loud behavior if you treat them well.
author: Zach L.

description: Being from NY, pizza has always been an integral part of my diet.  However, this changed when I moved out to the land of Ahi Tuna and Avocados.  Just when I was about to give up on my quest to find anything that resembled real pizza, Victors somehow came into my life.  I'm convinced that, west of the Mississippi, this is as close as it gets.  No bells.  No whistles.  Just good pizza.
author: Joe F.

description: This is my favorite delivery pizza. The garlic is very strong and the crust is super thin, but not cracker crisp. It takes a while for delivery, taken the restaurant location to my apartment location, that is understandable. I hope to some day make it in for a pie.
author: brandon b.

description: At Last !!  Oh, Chronos, thou mischievous God of Time... Long hast thou plagued and condemned me to order bland, oft-times disgusting Pizza-Pie delivery.  I had given up on this once-loved food tradition, thinking it forbidden to enjoy the sweet victory of hot melted cheese on soft dough in mine fabled village of  TenderCenter.  Alas, Sir Victor !  Alas !   The Halls of Glory ring most happily with the uproarious sounds of thine triumphs !  Foul Demon-Cybelle's begone... your misery is a blight upon the land NO MORE !
author: critical Francis ..

description:
A solid four stars. I've ordered from these guys before and they were good. Highly recommend getting sausage on the pizza, their sausage is hands down some of the best I've had on pizza. They also deliver on time and decently priced. The one downside is that they don't seem to put enough cheese so there are times when you get just crust and tomato sauce. Adding extra cheese is an option if you're willing to pay for it, but after doing so, I felt that there was too much cheese; it felt like I was just eating solely cheese and when I'm spending most of my time trying to break down giant chunks of cheese in my mouth, that's just not fun (or good).

I have tried their pasta but I can't recall what it was (think it was linguini with white clam sauce) and I didn't finish it because it just wasn't good. So, word of caution for the pasta lovers. I can't say that all their pasta is this way since I haven't tried them, just be wary.
author: Richard C.

description: One of the worst pizza i had ever. ended up getting sick after eating the pizza there, the meat on the pizza came uncooked!!!
author: Sam L.

description: I am a native New Yorker - Queens to be exact and can tell you that the thin crust pizza here at Victor's is as close to what I had growing up as any I have had in the 25 + years since I left.  The place itself is somewhat small but it is your typical "pizza joint".  Highly recommend the entire menu.
author: Art S.

description: Great consistant pizza. We have it delivered often and never disappointed. Love the clam and garlic with the addition of some spinach. Love the thin crust also. One of the best pizza places in SF!
author: JaVae B.

description:
Just moved to Cole Valley and have tried all the places within the (wide) vicinity, what a WASTE OF TIME.  I am hopping in my car and going back to the old 'hood from now on to get my Zorba Special.

This is the only good pizza in town if you like thin-crust, east-coast style.
author: Steve C.

description: No frills place, but the pizza rocks!  Being from the East Coast, it's pretty difficult finding a decent pizza joint, but this place is pretty damn close.  :)  Thanks Victor's, you're a bastion of pizza excellence on the Western Front!
author: M G.

description:
I strongly advise against eating Victor's pasta.  I ordered the rigatoni, which came thirty minutes later completely undercooked and paired with a fishy marinara.  When I told the waitress it was terrible she simply walked away.  Smooth.  I would never go back.

(oh, and dont get the minestrone.  watery, mostly celery, a few pieces of carrot.  i think the strategy is to serve it SOOO hot it burns your tongue and you can't taste the rest of your meal)
author: ramona j.

description: I work at a bar down the block and I just have to rate Victors. I have only eaten pizza by the slice there, but it is great. Even a slice of plain cheese will leave your tummy wanting more. They put some mixture of spices and herbs on the pie that will make your mouth water. If you get the chance, definitely check it out.
author: Chase K.

description: Been eating here for 20+ years, back when it was Victor's Daughters. They have amazing pizza with perfect crusts. The salads are huge, theCalzones are yummy, and its a great place to stop by for a slice. If you want an affordable Italian meal, this is definitely a place to try out, the dinners are tasty, HUGE, and totally price friendly.
author: Jason S.

description: Got 2 cheese slices to go on a Saturday night around 9:30. They had clearly been sitting there for a while. The crust was flimsy and the slices tasted like cheap pasta sauce. Also, they gave me their "dinner salad" in a Chinese to-go box and drenched it in dressing. Not very appetizing. I'm guessing from their overall rating that the sit-down food is not as bad.
author: Steve N.

description: I only spent a year in NY, but the memories of the excellent pizza I had there will remain indelibly etched into my memory forever.  Ahh, Tony's in Hemtstead, Gino's in Long Beach and I don't even know how many little hole-in-the-walls in Manhattan.  Victor's is just about the closest I've found in the City.  I won't even consider a pizza joint that doesn't sell slices.
author: R D M.

description:
I have been coming to Victor's Pizza since I was a kid.  The pizza is great.  The salads aren't bad either.  You can stand in the street on Polk and watch them throw the dough up in the air like all of the old pizza joints used to do.

I rarely eat in the restaurant anymore because their delivery time is almost just as fast as if you were eating in the restaurant.
author: Karen B.

description:
Unfortunately I wasn't drunk when I visited Victor's. We decided to stay for pasta as we had been staying at the hotel down the street and the place smelled great outside. They cook the pizza in front, and that's what smells so good. 

I have NEVER sent my food back other than when I visited this place and ordered the most disgusting fettucini of my life. The sauce tasted like cheese from a can and the pasta wasn't properly cooked (or was of unbelievably poor quality). After sending my plate back, I ordered marinara spaghetti thinking no one could screw that up. I ended up taking it to go and giving it to a homeless man along with an apology for how disgusting it was.

The service was pretty good and they didn't get too pissed off when I sent my food back. The pizza was mediocre and you're better off going a few blocks down to Pino's for a decent slice.... even if you are drunk.
author: tim m.

description: Was strongly recommended by a homeless man on the street.  Went there and ate a "Victor's Favorite" pie and it was excellent.  Would be 5 stars if they also had Bud Light on tap (the only have the heavy duty BUD)
author: adam b.

description: This place is the bomb. The pizzas and the calzones are both stellar. The sauce to cheese ratio is perfect and the crust is chewy but a little bit crispy as well. They have pink lemonade as part of their fountain soda repertoire and I'm a huge fan. The one time I got it delivered it was super fast. The slices are not the best part of Victor's. If you really want some delish pizza, sit down and get a whole pie and a salad with ranch dressing and a pink lemo. Done.
author: Jessica K.

description: ok delivery pizza. thin crust, tangy sauce but gross cheese. Amici's still takes the, uh, pie...
author: Dennis R.

description: i was raised on this pizza and pasta....! great food over all.... i really recommend their specialty pizza "victors favorite" with jalapenos.... if yur in the mood for pasta their cannelloni, and tortellini in pesto sauce is awesome.... if you are looking for a vegetarian dish they have an amazing eggplant parmigiana. over all this place rocks...!
author: Mayra M.

description: Amazing pizza and quick delivery (most of the time)! The guy on the phone even sounds Italian, which just makes it feel authentic.
author: John M.

description: I was so happy to find this Pizza place back in 1990 after moving from NYC. I was looking for a great Pizza joint and I found one.They are one of the best pizza joints in town and the meal and side dishes are well done and take out is fast too. Prices are faIr
author: Kurt G.
