description: they totally put cable car, north beach, etc., to shame, though of course they aren't open as late for delivery.  definitely the best pizza deliverable in sf, especially for the low price... they have amazingly good calzones too.  the pastas haven't impressed me as much (except the lasagne)- i appreciate that they're house made, but i'm someone who never adds salt to food and i have added it to their pastas each time, they just taste lacking.  contrarily, delivery has never ran later than the time quoted, and the pizza sauce is super fresh and unique.
author: Ariane R.

description: ahh hell yes.  been here twice.  finally a place in san francisco that serves actual large portions of food where you actually get one you pay for, in this case, damn good pizza and italian food.  i can vouche for the pizza, calzones, and the gnnocie bolognese, all excellent stuff.  definitely the place to go after blowing $1100 at guitar center around the corner on an amp of questionable quality and having to deal with an inept salesperson.  also good for dates.
author: eric i.

description: I have been looking for a good pizza place in the marina, nob hill, or pac heights and I finally found it., VICTORS PIZZA.  I love their pesto pizza and their garden salad.  It is fast and you can buy by the slice.  I'm actually having some tonight. :)
author: vikki a.

description: Pizza and eggplant parm are fantastic.  The Victor's delivery guys know us well.
author: Beth L.

description: if you have four people and everybody names their favorite ingredient, it doesnt always add up to an amazing combo. but if it's scrumptious new york style w/fresh ingredients, it can survive. yum.
author: Seiji C.

description: fresh dough, delicious tomato sauce, mozarella cheese with spices on top make this a great place to grab a slice of pizza when you're in the neighborhood.  the basil on the top makes all the difference in the world.
author: Amy Z.

description: one of the best slices in the city, AND they deliver.  if you live in the 'loin, go here.
author: Khoa N.

description: Great flavor, quick delivery right to my hotel room.  Spent $145 on fine dining last night and I think my belly is nearly as happy with the Victor's Pizza I just had.  Ordered on site midway through my run and they delivered 15 minutes later. House salad was so-so but atleast very fresh greens. Za was fabulous!
author: Madster L.

description: Great Delivery Pizza. Just moved here from Boston where all pizza is awful unless you are in the North End. The crust was crispy and had a nice saltiness to it with out being overwhelming. I am sick of places adding too much sugar to their dough or sauce and this sauce was heavy on the oregano but pretty much perfect otherwise. We got half Hawaiian and half Victor's Special (cheese, mushrooms, pepperoni, Italian sausage, salami, bell pepper, onions, black olives). Both were really good. There was too much sausage for my taste but the pizza was not pooled in grease as a lot of combo pizza with cured meats can be. They do not skimp on toppings either, without making piles of goopy cheese. We WILL be ordering form here again.
author: Caitlin S.

description: Great pizza.  I have never had a bad slice of pizza here.  If you are looking for a pitcher of beer to go with your food, you can do that too.  Pizza by the slice is also available.
author: Matt J.

description: You know what, it ain't half bad! I'm a NY-style pizza person, through and through. I generally don't eat pizza in CA, but seriously - I deem this pizza very respectable. Their homemade pasta ain't bad either. This isn't exactly a first-date kind of place, as it's a seriously no-frills joint, but frankly, it's a nice change from time to time.
author: Lemon S.

description: i would give this place a million stars if i could.  every pizza i have eaten from victor's has been consistent, tasty and well-made (i am so picky about my sauce proportions).  their pasta dishes are really great as well, and their garlic bread will leave you wondering if you should have gotten two orders.  skip the dinner salad, however, as it is nothing to write home about at all.
author: calamity d.

description:
theres something about this pizza thats incredible... its the sauce.. wait no, its the dough.  waaait... fresh mozz?

forget it.  this pizza is damn good.
author: E. R.

description: i was very pleased with my pizza (altho the topping didnt want to stay in the crust) but all in all a good place to get some pizza
author: Trevor B.

description: i'm a huge pizza snob and a huge fan of victor's... nuff said
author: daniel c.

description: I ordered a veggie pizza for take-out, the walk back home took 5 minutes. The toppings were generous, sauce was reasonable however the crust was flimsy thus making it difficult to hold in the hand.
author: Dev A.

description:
Well, I didn't get some pizza, but it looked good and i saw a bunch of people eating it all up and down the block. No, today i was interested in a calzone, but was tempted by the breaded chicken on garlic bread because A) that sounds damn good and B) it also came with salad and pasta so was a whole meal for 9 bucks instead of a (probably great) calzone and nothing else. well lets hit it up part by part.
the "pasta" that came with the sammich was great. it was some weird flat noodle that they probably had just lying around, but their sauce was meaty and just right, no flavor too strong, but all of them present, the meat, tomato, spices.. mmm, even for just dished out pasta it was good and tasted fresh when i finally got it back to work 10 minutes later. 2) the salad, another surprise, a BIG full salad, not just some hot lettuce, first off it was in another container staying cool on its own, and came with meat and cheese and i don't even know.. carrots, celery, mushrooms, tomato, other stuff, all from an included side salad!
oh k. onto the sammich itself... i have to say this is where they lost points. the chicken was fine and tasty, hot, breaded, with yummy melty cheese and it was between garlic bread, but the presentation was terrible, it looked like they had some bread and threw some chicken at it and served it up, the bread was a little overpowering and really the whole thing left a lot to be desired. not because it wasn't made great and with great ingredients but just that it was a terrible contrast to the unexpected surprises and layers of the pasta and salad.
author: Raccoon S.

description: Victor's. Shit, this is gonna be a tricky one. I wanna like Victor's, really really really. An institution in Polk Gulch, it's obvious from the pics across from the register that Victor's has been serving pie to the hood long before it was a hood (in the modern vernacular at least). Stepping into the place is a time portal back to 1953, especially if you have a seat in one of the ++ahem++ dining rooms (very loose term of the word). Try and wrap your mind around how many pizzas the oven has baked? I've heard scores of former east coasters swear by Victor's, and while it does rise above the mass of craptacular pizza in SF it falls a bit short on what a good pizzeria should be, a place for amazing pie. Damn the dining area, screw the fact that you have to walk through the dish washing station to use the bathroom, Victor's pizza is simply average. Wait, what's that? My friend's kicking me for forgetting to mention the oregano. He swears that a good pie does NOT have any oregano on it (so a word for the purists out there). Personally, I can live with the oregano (I recently read "The Paradox of Choice" and am learning to be more of a "satisficer"). Victor's is a pretty good crust and nice sauce (a little too sweet, but again satisficery). The skinny? Good as a fall-back, or for a walking slice. This is the best pizza in the area (about the same quality as Escape From NY in the Haight), so when the pie demon rises and you can't get to Amici's there's always Victor's.
author: Rob S.

description: really some of the best pizza west of new york.  if you get homesick and are tired of getting burned by imitators, give victor's a try.  they make it right!
author: Melissa Y.

description: I have a confession to make: I'm an East Coast Italian food snob.  I have heard over and over again about how such and such's pizza is as good as East Coast pizza.  While I haven't found the Pepe's (New Haven) of San Francisco, it may actually be the best in the city so far in my experience.  I had their Calzone last time I visited and it was the best I have eaten on the West Coast.  Their pizza has that east coast flavor.  It's a toss up as to whether it is better than Tomaso's, but it's in my neighborhood so certainly convenient.
author: Thomas W.

description: it's more like 3.5. every time that i have been here, it's been late which is great. there's always pizza by the slice and they'll put whatever topping on for you. i've never sat down and ate there so i can't say much about the dining experience. but if you're around the neighborhood and want a quick decent tasting pizza to eat, this is the place to go. the people are fairly nice there.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: i haven't tried much here; every time i come here i get a victor's special and the super combination salad. But it has been extremely consistent. The interior is cozy and non-pretentious.
author: Galen R.

description: This was better than most the pizza spots i've ordered from.  Their dough is good and crispy.  (not fluffy like so many other CA places).  Good anitpasta just make sure you don't get the house dressing in a cup, it leaked out the bottom in my fridge.  Their meetballs are small but taste a smig above par -they are served in a delicious meet sauce.  I would order again.  $30 order    (lrg antipasta, small 2-topping pie, side of 2 meetballs, and a tip)
author: j j.

description: With so many restaurants to choose from in San Francisco, I often find myself choosing an eatery based on my desire for a specific favorite dish at a certain locale.  Victor's is one such restaurant.  Invariably, I go to Victor's for the Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich.  The eggplant is always perfectly cooked, sliced nice and thin with no tough skin to deal with, and served on the most amazing crispy-yet-soft homemade (?) roll.  I've been going there for so long and ordering the same item that they always know what I've come for.  The only other item I've eaten here is the calzone, which is also top notch.  Victor's has a way with pizza dough, and their hot pizza dough rolls served in lieu of  regular bread at the table is also incredible.  The atmosphere in the darkened, low-key, former smoking section of the restaurant is a perfect place to relax in a comfy booth and hide the fact that you're pigging out.  I just wish they still had more of the plastic grapes on the ceiling.
author: Tim D.

description: In a town of not so great pizza (compared to NYC) this is one of the best around.  Most of the entrees are very good, too and the gnocchi bolognese is to die for.  Reasonable prices and quick service.  I know it's a small thing but I hate the $1 delivery charge.
author: Liz M.

description: bad ass pizza with thin, crispy crust. Slices are a bit pricey, but worth the extra $0.50. I haven't had a slice from Irving Pizza in weeks.
author: Fire P.

description: About 6 months after moving here from NYC I was walking down Polk St. and smelled something that was vaguely familiar... Pizza! Real Pizza, not the weird doughy SF pizza that everyone was trying to tell me was just as good as NYC pizza.  Even though I was on my way to dinner somewhere else, I had to follow my nose.  It's a hole in the wall, for sure, but that somehow confirmed to me it would be good.  I took a bite and never looked back - I won't go anywhere else for pizza in this town!!
author: Catherine B.

description: i have to admit that i was sceptical at first.  its nothing much to look at from the outside, or even from the inside for that matter... but... and its a big one, the pizza is delish...  thin crust... gooey cheese.. great toppings.  yumm!
author: Venessa C.

description: worst experience of my life for so-so pizza.  i was carrying groceries from whole foods so didn't want a slice to go - asked for it there - they said yes.  i sat myself down at one of the tables and waited.  i'm fairly active so didn't want to sit for too long - wondered outside to be in the sun.  came back in and picked up pizza which the fellow making it said was ready.  took it back to my seat it was in foil and on paper plate.  attempted to eat but that's not always too pleasant with foil coming with the pizza so asked for a plate.  that's when the owner came over and said (in a nasty manner) "did you 'grab' the pizza from the counter?  if you didn't do that i would have brought you a plate."  I said no, i didn't grab the pizza merely picked it up but would like to leave as you're being rude.  he then proceeded to say many unpleasant things including you're old - all old people are crazy - please go.  please, i'd rather never repeat that experience.  not recommended at all.  pizza was not bad but nothing great  btw.
author: Joan M.

description: By far the best pizza I've had this side of the Mississippi.  Fresh ingredients + thin crust = YUM
author: J C.

description: nice, thin crust pizza. delivery came right on time in north beach. i like.
author: hugh k.

description: Very good pizza! There are a few pizza joints in the City that I can count on and Victor's is one of them. When I have training for work in the area I always stop by for a slice. The staff is great, the prices are relatively inexpensive and the pizza is served piping hot. I'm looking forward to my next training date so I sink my teeth into another slice.
author: Mack F.

description: I went here for lunch on a sleepy Sunday afternoon and had a calzone--it was excellent. The ony thing that bothers me is they don't allow you to eat in if you order pizza by the slice--even if the restaurant is mostly empty, as it was when I visited.
author: Doug L.

description: it was ok. we got delivery, and the guy who delivered was nice. the pizza was ok. the guy taking our phone order was NOT friendly whatsoever! too bad the pizza wasn't outstanding, we woulda made it our pizza delivery place! the garlic bread was wayyy too garlicky, and little slices of baguette, we've had better.
author: bhavna p.

description: I thought this place was brutal. First, they use pizza cheese for their salads. Second, they have a bell which doesn't do the food any justice anyways. I don't know how they stay in business with their food, the salad was very soggy, the pasta was far from spectacular and the service sucked. My wife and I are young but we were sitting in the restaurant for 10 minutes with the menus when a lady behind us sits down to eat. She is immediately asked for her order soon after her arrival. The waiter then leaves us waiting for more than 10 minutes again probably as he goes and runs to the front to ring the magical bell some more. The pizza had raw onions, cheese was CRAP, the salad was the laziest salad i've seen with carrots the size of hand sized rocks. I would seriously rather go to domino's and eat that tuesday pasta stuff.  did I say service sucked? This place sucked so bad I just had to yelp it. jesus christ.
author: fanta c.

description: the toppings were cold and the guy there could give a shit. its the drunk patrons that give these guys good ratings.  everyone gives out 4 stars like  girls in california say amazing. its screwing with people trying to find good food.
author: santiago c.

description: i moved here from nyc 8 months ago. every pizza place in the city like amicis is crap, and doesnt even taste like pizza. this is the next best thing to a nyc pizza. for those who dont like it, you never had real pizza.
author: Kevin S.
